Good ambience, definitely great service with friendly staff to assist, Adonis is always there to chat you up.   Should you be needing a good place to drink, why not head over to Origin and enjoy yourself

We have been staying here for many years and still love it. We have stayed in both the Valley Wing and the Tower Wing, which has fabulous views over Singapore. The service is excellent, and Melissa and the rest of the staff in the Horizon Club could not be more helpful. The Shang Palace Chinese restaurant is as good as ever - we ate there twice this time. The pool area is a lovely place to spend time relaxing, and again the service could not be better. The gardens are beautiful to have a walk around also. Definitely the best hotel in Singapore.

It’s our first time to be in SG When we arrived in hotel it was around 2 o’clock and didn’t need to wait for the room Front desk staff Rei greeted us and reserve welcome drink immediately We got the deluxe room with King size bed which is very adorable. The view was fine because there was not much too see nearby but the room condition was sooooo great and sooo user friendly!!!  We had breakfast at the line located on the 1/F in Sunday morning. However, it was pretty busy and no one was standby at the reception. After waiting for a while, we finally got the table reserved by Mugilan. He was very efficient and clam when he knew that we were not in a good mood. Also, he was quite helpful for the whole breakfast period. The choices of the breakfast are very multiple and above…

Service throughout our stay was excellent. Food outstanding. Room a good size, kept exceptionally clean, with turndown chocolates at night. Staff friendly, non obtrusive but attentive. Grounds beautifully kept.  Hotel location  perfect for shopping ( 10 mins walk) and sight seeing. We have stayed here before and will always do so when in Singapore.

This is one of the best and beautiful hotel in Singapore. Staff was very polite and co-operative with their customers. This was a very luxury hotel and all type of services was quick and i didn't have to wait There for anything..

The scent of fresh cut holiday greens stirred my senses upon arrival after a brutal 21+ hour flight from the east coast of the States. The lobby, resplendent in its seasonal best... to include a live Christmas tree from Oregon, was amazing. I was greeted at the car, welcomed warmly, and shown to my room. The club floor was the perfect place to contemplate jetlag over a frothy cappuccino and ample tasty offerings. The local breakfast- to include the prawn dumplings, were an absolute treat. The sleeping accommodations were perfect and in room L’Occitane bath amenities were spa like. I was also truly stunned by how manicured and gorgeous the over 15+ acres of gardens were surrounding the pool. The teak orchid garden folly was simply serene and a wonderful place to give the mind a…

Our stay at the recently renovated Shangrila exceeded expectations. Both the high ceilinged lobby and guest rooms exude luxurious refinement.  Service is excellent throughout. I particularly like the well equipped gym, which looks out onto the lush landscaped gardens. The lobby now has a section which serves local hawker favorites for breakfast, or afternoon tea; which includes Nasi Lemak & Chicken Rice. Highly recommended.  Taxis can take longer to come, so allow yourself ample time. In a city crowded with plethora of branded hotels, the Shangri La stands out from the rest

World class hospitality from the Valley Wing staff from arrival to departure. Attention to details and generous hospitality made this 2D1N stay perfect. Special shout out to the ambassadors - Amanlina, Carlitos, Elvy, Jessica, Jade and Priscilla for your exemplary service and hospitality. - Stayed at Valley Wing Deluxe Room, with option for full board. Quality nibbles with free flow Champagne.

Review title: Great stay at Shangri-La Orange Grove Street Singapore
Review: Lovely hotel, nice and friendly people. The manager Xavier is excellent and accommodative  The Bell Captain Sharmah is always smiling and helpful   The ambience is good Nice breakfast and very helpful people

Spent 10 wonderful days at Shangri-La for R&R and within the first few hours of arriving we felt revived and relaxed into our holiday. The expansive green lawns and gardens make this feel an oasis, and all so near orchard Rd and all its buzz.  Our garden wing room with balcony was perfect. Palms , trees and watching squirrels nearby. I love to be able to sit on the very private balcony and breathe in the air and that unique warm scent of Singapore.  Loved the occasional brief thunderstorms and rain, then back in the pool to cool off.  Grand foyer, choice of restaurants and friendly service.  Special thanks to concierge Raj. During our visits over the years he’s always there to ensure it’s a perfect holiday. Makes it that much more special. He was right to recommend their Origin …

We spent 3 days and nights. The property is spectacular. Didn't use the Spa or gym, but saw the facilities and they are amazing. Our only complaint is that 2 of the 3 restaurants were booked to wedding parties, so the only restaurant available was the Chinese restaurant. The Bar is AMAZING, and the bartender, Adam Eddy Bursik, is fantastic. They ven re-distill alcohol to make flavored alcohols. The Christmas Gin is incredible. It actually tastes like Christmas. Thank you, Eddy. Peggi & Steve

Great hotel ,fantastic staff and great food. Good location,need to use taxis to see all the sights. The light show from the top of Marina bay Sands in the evening at Larvo’s restaurant was amazing. A must to see are the gardens at the bay,two enormous domes house a fantastic display of trees and plants with an incredible waterfall.

stayed another two nights in Valley Wing on our way back from NZ to Europe. And again, it was a perfect stay - thks to the Valley Wing staff who were so helpful. When the room above ours was a bit noisy (newlyweds...), they immediately moved us onto a different floor the next morning, so all good. Shangri-La remains the hotel of our choice in Singapore.

Singapore is our favourite stop off during our annual visit to NZ from the UK.  We haven’t used this particular hotel for a while but have wonderful memories of previous stays.   The hotel has recently undergone a refurb and it continues to maintain the quality of excellence we remember. The recent addition of the facilities for children is outstanding.....even baking classes!   The evening buffet is amazing, with food stations from around the world. You can enjoy curry, sushi, lobster, wagyu beef, to name but a few mouth watering choices. There are also many superb ethic restaurants.  On our return in April we may consider upgrading to the luxurious Horizon Club. I have to add that the staff are delightful and nothing is too much trouble.

We arrived post cruise and was allocated a fabulous room - on the sixteenth floor - which was as requested, very quiet, with a stunning view over the city.  We were helped from the moment we arrived until we left, with the utmost professionalism and charm.  I can totally recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a luxurious and restful stay.  The location of the hotel is perfect for shopping on Orchard Road.  The pool is very large and the pool attendant excellent.  All the facilities we used were first class.  We dined in the Line Restaurant twice and also had breakfast there.  The choice was just incredible at breakfast.  On a Sunday evening there is an eat all you can buffet which was vast.  We felt totally valued and looked after for our whole stay and will definitely stay…

We have stayed at the Shangri-La in Singapore numerous times. We were disappointed to see the red and gold panels in the lobby had been replaced with a live wall of plants, a pool and some odd figures. It could be Rome, Paris or London, it has lost its Asian feeling. But the rooms was lovely and service great. We had dinner in the Line restaurant and it took ages for food to arrive and it seemed a bit chaotic. However, in general it is a wonderful hotel. We were fans of the new bar which is off the lobby.

Thanks once again for the outstanding service we received again . Without a doubt Singapore’s best hotel well done . Cannot fault the hotel traveling for a living I spend a lot of time in hotels around the world but this The valley wing  is my favorite.

Review title: Staff that go over and above what is expected.
Review: My family stayed 6 nights in the Shangri-La Apartments, which is right next door to the hotel. We stayed in a 3 bedroom/3 bathroom apartment with living area, dining room and small kitchen....absolutely ideal for our 3 children aged 7 and under.   Despite being in the apartment, the hotel was less than a two minute walk. We walked across to the resort each morning and had a delicious buffet breakfast, a buffet fit for a king. We were able to utilise the resort swimming pool, however the apartment swimming pool and toddler splash pool was more than ample and still stunning, so we ended up using the apartments swimming pool more often.  The apartment was spotlessly tidy and housekeeping did a marvelous job each day. The kitchen had all the usual appliances and this proved very…

Although the exterior is looking a bit dated, the renovation of rooms in the tower block makes them ideal for the business or leisure traveller. Whilst not the largest rooms that you might expect in a luxury hotel, the layout is very functional. However, when all is said and done, you mainly sleep in your room whereas you live in the hotel and here is where the Shangri-La shines. The service is impeccable. We invested in a club room and the amenity of breakfast, afternoon tea and evening cocktails and canapes on the 24th floor was complemented by the warm welcome provided by the staff. Similarly, the staff around the pool couldn't have been more helpful or welcoming. Although our children are grown-up, the kid's club looks amazing and we hope to return with grandchildren someday.

Review title: Perfection. This is how a proper hotel works.
Review: The customer service was thoughtful and genuine, and the team at Shangri-La made our seven year old feel very welcome. It is a completely relaxing hotel, very clean, well cared for, and maintained with pride, through all levels of staff. The management should be very proud of their staff. The food is spectacular, and the little gestures that staff went to for children made us feel very special and appreciated as guests. We’ll be back for sure.

Review title: What a place - exceptional service and fantastic experience
Review: My wife and I stayed at Shangri-la Singapore Valley wing during 4 nights and had an amazing time.  Coming here after being delayed on the flights by more than 8 hours and with our luggage even more delayed, they really took care of us from the minute we got here.  The check-in experience was great and was enhanced with afternoon tea, champagne and a lot empathy for our situation. They even helped us get temporary clothes and offered express cleaning.  Throughout the stay we were met with the same level of service wherever we went, always kind, generous and always very professional.  The hotel itself is also great. The room was spacious and very clean. The bed was big and very comfortable. The pool area was equally pleasant.  One of the benefits with staying in the Valley Wing…

Beautiful hotel just minutes walk from Orchard road.  The Shangri-la is luxurious with unparalleled service.  Amenities include a top-class fitness center with wet/dry saunas and a whirlpool.  The hotel also has a Spa with Asia-inspired wellness and massage offerings.  There are also several restaurants within the hotel offering local cuisine as well as Italian, Japanese, Chinese, and steak.  The restaurants also cater to travelers with celiac as they offered multiple gluten friendly options.  Finally, the hotel is a great place for families as it offers a dedicated breakfast area, a kid's baking kitchen, and swimming pool, and an indoor playscape.  The only downside is that the prices are a little steep and its a 15 min walk or more for other food options.

Even although the hotel was clearly busy, the service was seamless and outstanding.  Room was in the garden wing and was extremely luxurious and comfortable.  Very high quality breakfast buffet.  Good gym with friendly staff.  Hotel is only a short taxi hop into town.  Highly recommend.

We stayed in the Garden Wing. The room was spacious and had a balcony overlooking some gardens. The bed and pillows were comfortable. A bonus was a Netpresso machine in the room with complimentary pods. Check-in and check-out was smooth. 5 stars. But, the breakfast buffet was less than perfect, so hence the 4 stars. The place was packed on the Sunday morning and we ended up outside after a short queue. Although it was in the shade, it was still a bit hot and sticky, and the service was not so good, as we needed to make at least 2 requests for tea/coffee (each time) before it appeared. Inside, the staff did not seem to know where every thing was - my enquiry asking where the butter and jam was elicted the response that it should be there - pointing to where I had just come from.…

The Shagri-La Singapore is a fantastic hotel.  Very friendly service.  Bellman Faireen made us feel very welcome and nothing was too much trouble.  True class!  The service and warmth and attention we received from Nicole, Raj, Manav, and Govinda was everything one would expect from a 5 star hotel.  Thank you you for a wonderful experience!

We stayed here one night (Saturday night) as we attended my niece’s wedding solemnisation and wedding banquet held at Shangri-La hotel. The garden room that we had was luxurious and very comfortable. The gym was very well equipped. Breakfast buffet was included in our room rate for three adults. The breakfast was very good indeed with a very wide selection of western, Chinese and Indian cuisine. Go early for breakfast. When I went to the gym at 7.40 am there was hardly anyone having breakfast at the Line restaurant. When we went at 9 am to the Line restaurant for breakfast there was a very long queue and about a ten minute wait. Staff members were extremely helpful and courteous. We had a very pleasant stay indeed.

Review title: A true paradise- the name fits!
Review: We could not imagine a better experience. Our stay at the Shangri-La was heavenly. From the welcome with a beautiful orchid and a glass of champagne, the impeccable and thoughtful house keeping, delicious food, beautiful surroundings, and acommodation for a late check out, from start to finish, our stay was incredible and perfect. We would recommend a vacation at the Shangri La to anyone we know. Thank you so much for a wonderful trip! We will be dreaming about when we can come back!

We visited the Shangri La Singapore on the 23rd of November 2018 to celebrate the birthday of my youngest sister. We were a group of 6 adults and we loved the hotel and its atmosphere. We were served very well by the staff there and they attended to all our needs very quickly and kindly.   Frankly I never expected the same level good care and attention we are used to receiving at Star class hotels in Sri Lanka in Singapore, but to my surprise the hotel staff at Shangri La Singapore were exceptionally very kind and caring. Based on this brief visit I will really look forward to staying at the Shangri La Singapore in my future visits to Singapore.

Just enjoyed a fantastic 4 night stay at The Shangri-La Singapore. We opted for a Horizon club room which had benefits of a lounge on the 23rd floor serving breakfast, afternoon tea and evening drinks and canapés. The service from the moment we checked in was outstanding. The food was all excellent with good variety. Orchard a road is a 10 minute walk downhill from the hotel, but taxis are always available and cheap. Will definitely be our hotel of choice on our next visit.

on a stop over for a couple of days flying between Scotland and New Zealand.  i have been lucky enough to stay here previously, but not for a number of years.  the hotel is beautifully appointed and has wonderfully attentive staff.   i stayed in the Garden wing with a pool view, which i would say is the ideal if you are willing to pay the premium for a balcony.

This is a very comfortable hotel, in a great location for Orchard Road shopping and many sightseeing activities. The range of food available within the hotel is very broad, and room service is reasonable. The thing that will do your head in is the lighting in the rooms! It is a strange puzzle to get just the level of lighting required as lights are grouped onto switches. We were alternately dazzled or plunged into complete darkness as we tried to get it right! Sunset from the Horizon Club is not to be missed.

Stayed 2 nights in the Tower of this totally charming Hotel. Very relaxing in a great location on the hill just a short walk to Orchard Road.  Surrounded by beautiful gardens and with a swimming pool area and large well appointed rooms, you feel as if you are truly in a Resort.  The Executive Lounge is second to none with the most capable  staff led by Jenny who provided an amazing friendly service and helpful information on how we should spend our time in Singapore.

We had an amazing staycation at the family themed room. Kids loved the castle theme room, playing at the indoor and outdoor playground as well as the huge variety of food at The Line. What made the stay memorable was the superb service by the staff. Special shoutout goes to Cory for coordinating everything, Thabar for his attentiveness at The Line and Amirah who is always full of smile at Buds. Highly recommended for family with young kids!

Our suite in the Valley Wing was spacious and well appointed. Very impressed by all the staff, always smiling and very helpful. The Horizon Club, renovated since our visit last year, impressed with the selection of finger food and fine wine. However the highlight was the staff. We were surprised that the lovely Angeline was a trainee. She presented as an experienced professional, courteous and always smiling and ready to help. And of course Amir was the experienced professional, who supervised wonderful service by all the staff. The omelettes made by Connie are a must have. The Origin Grill was great, and we were privileged to meet the Head of Cuisine, Heidi.

This is a true 5 star hotel! Service and amenities are really what one expects of this wing of the hotel.  Everything is perfect from breakfast to pre dinner canapés. Having stayed here on numerous occasions I would highly recommend this hotel to the discerning traveller.

Everything about our stay was top notch: our room, the breakfasts, the Horizon Lounge, Nami Japanese restaurant, and the public spaces. The service was uniformly warm and professional. We reserved through Amex Plat Fine Hotels and instead of upgrading our room, we were given access to the Horizon Lounge, a much better benefit. We loved our room in the Garden Wing and can't wait to stay at Shangri-La again!

We booked 2 extra nights in the hotel before picking up our cruise ship . The room was beautiful, well furnished, kept very clean as you would expect. Everything there that was needed, I particularly liked the furnishings.  Plenty of choice for breakfast , ample seating , pleasant outside , but agree with previous review about cafeteria effect if eating inside.  We decided to eat in hotel on last night, sadly we didn’t book The fancier restaurants and ended up in the same restaurant as breakfast time. The price for buffet was extortionate, $ 95 per person, but as the waiter said ‘ there is a lot of food to choose from’ !   Instead we ate ‘a la carte ‘ and was so disappointed . My husband was asked how his meal was and he replied , ‘ok’,  however although I had left most of my…

Hotel was great, room was awesome, reception staffs were horrible, i have booked a tower wing room for 3 nights, while i arrived at receptions table, the staff, Yang Long, if not mistaken, said that tower wing room is max for 3 persons, i came with my wife and 2 daughters, 2years old and 1 years. Because of that i must upgrade to garden wing room if i want to stay in the same room for 100SGD before tax.  When checked out, i asked another staff for that matter, she said it is okay to stay in tower wing room if i didn’t bothered to stay in one bed with my kids, because it will be cramped, (....... after a long sigh), i told her, whatever the room i stayed in, i would sleep altogether on one bed, and i’m guessing, for a famous chain hotel like Shangrila, u will get a king size bed…

Room was spacious and had everything required. I am disabled and the room was one of the best for people like me that I have encountered. The staff were friendly and very helpful. The included breakfast was excellent and the range of food impressive. The hotel  appearance, particularly the gardens, was of the highest standard.  The only disappointment was the room service meal, which was rather bland and not up to the standard of the rest of the hotel.

Visited this establishment to have dinner with my friends at origin bar and grill. All I can say is that atmosphere at the bar is something that is not to be missed. Lighting is nicely dimmed (romantic), attentive wait staff, music is not too loud where you can have a comfortable conversation with whoever that you're there with, and also feast your eyes and tastebuds on their wide range of cocktails. For a complete experience, visit the restaurant section which features unique and delectable dishes that's carefully crafted to please your instagram followers and stomach.

My wife and I celebrated our joint birthday over 3 days, 16th to 18th November 2018 booked under one night with the massage package and another nite the Horizon Club package with a set lunch at Nami Japanese Restaurant. Our room was facing the pool and having morning sun.   16th Nov 18  We had tim sum lunch at Shang Palace before checked in and followed by massage at Chi Spa. Then gym before proceeding to The Waterfall for Pizza/seafood dinner. Finally, we enjoyed the in room dinning (chicken curry rice and nasi goreng) experience.   17th Nov 18  We had buffet breakfast at the Line and set lunch for 2 at Nami Japanese Restaurant (good view) and enjoy the Horizon Club Lounge (good view) for afternoon tea. Then followed by dinner at Shang Palace for 6 pax (Longetivity Peach puns,…

Review title: Staycation with the kids at Shangri-La Singapore
Review: The staff are attentive and personalised. Service standard is high and they makes the hotel guests feel pampered. For example, staff who will hold the lift for guests if they happen to be there even at other levels, staff who will smile and acknowledge you when they see you, etc. They even prepared a kitkat cum M&Ms birthday cake for my younger girl who celebrated her birthday during her stay - she was beaming with joy when she saw the beautiful cake.   There are indoor and outdoor facilities to keep the kids occupied and happy - allowing the parents to catch a breather. The kids and i are very happy and enjoyed our stay here.  Thank you for such a wonderful experience and keep up the good work! Well done to the service crew! Keep up the great work!

Review title: Another amazing stay in this wonderful hotel
Review: We were here last, in July 2017 and decided to stay here again for longer than 7 days. However, we chose the Garden Wing this time with a balcony overlooking the city view. As per usual the standard and service, not only in our room but overall was beyond reproach. This considering our stay there coincided with the visit of the Malaysian Prime Minister and also the first time visit of the Russian Premier, Putin to Singapore. As with such visit amidst tight security etc, there was minimal disruption for guest and this must be a credit to the staff and management of the hotel.  Should anyone consider visiting Singapore, this is the location to rest and recuperate before venturing the sights and scenes of the city, you will not regret it. Thanks for another wonderful stay and well…

Stayed in Shangrila Apartments Singapore during Nov 11-17, 2018. It’s a lovely place to stay with family. Quiet place. Staff is very friendly. The house keeping team is very polite, helpful and prompt. They used to promptly arrange cabs for us every day.  We were there to celebrate my daughter’s 18th birthday. They surprised her by arranging small celebration for her. It really touched being in a foreign country. I would definitely recommend this place for family stays.

Review title: Valley Wing is certainly a luxury hotel.
Review: What impressed me most about this hotel is their arrangements for breakfast. You choose from a menu and it is served at your table and mercifully you do not encounter the roomful of dishes at a buffet that most hotels now offer. I stayed at the Valley Wing. The rest of the stay was comfortable, satisfying and I will very much recommend it to anyone willing to spend more for the comfort of a suite. The rooms are well appointed. The TV in living room is good but the one in the bedroom is not of the same standard. The staff are pro active and polite which is, to my mind which is the great differentiator of a great hotel.

A two night stay before our onward flight to Chiang Mai. A beautiful hotel ideally located for Orchard Road and around a brisk 15 minute walk to the Orchard MRT Station but the hotel does have a shuttle bus if you don’t feel like walking. We stayed in the garden wing which offered a good sized room, furnished to a high standard as expected from any Shangri -La hotel but it also had a balcony which we like. Breakfast which was served in the Italian restaurant by the pool was outstanding with an amazing choice. The bars & lounge also had a great atmosphere, we only tried their bar menu but what we chose was well presented and enjoyable. The gardens are well kept as is the pool area, there is also a fabulous Koi Carp pool. Lovely to stroll round in the evening. Staff whether from…

The service is amazing, the employees absolutely top professionals and super friendly, helpful and great. The location of the hotel is also very great. Finally I found the hotel I was looking for in Singapore. Top hotel even if the rooms are a little older. Gym needs major improvement.

The Shangrila Hotel is a great place to be weather it be for business or holiday. the service provided by the bell boys on arrival through to bus tranfers on departure was awesome.the food,cleaniness of the place and the friendly staff is just great.it is worth every penny spent

Superb location, courtous and friendly staff, nice and clean rooms, Check in and out was awesome with a favorable time given for early check in  and check out.  Good amenities. Would advise to go for a fantastic breakfast..

Stayed in the Tower Wing which had very noisy and old ventilation system.  Key card did not work because the card reader was out of battery.  The furniture in the Family Suite had sharp edges posing risks to children. Very rough facial tissues and toilet papers, only provided softer ones after request. Makes one wonder if the management is cutting cost. Service was just ok and not particularly efficient.  Hard to believe this is Shangri-la's flagship property.

Review title: Wonderful service; a 5 star hotel that does walk the extra mile
Review: Of course one can expect great service in a 5 star hotel, but Shrangri La at Orange road does provide this service. Efficient and friendly staff, clean, all facilities available for business travellers (and family). Good food. Fast check in and check out. Only minus: airco in the public area's (specially the meeting rooms) is just too cold!

This hotel was beyond exceptional. We stayed in the valley wing and enjoyed a beautiful room on the 12th floor with amazing views. The staff were excellent and special thanks to Mr Edward Chew who took the time to help us make the most of our limited time here. The breakfasts were the best we have experienced in any Shangri La hotel. Champagne bar and afternoon tea were a lovely treat returning from sightseeing. I can’t think of any negative comments to make about this hotel . They have got it so right. Thank you for a wonderful stay.

Arrived after a cruise to stay 2 nights , room was not ready were told to inquire in an hour ! Waited although could not find a comfortable chair together after nearly an hour inquired again and told again to ask in an hour !  1 and a half hours later roomers ready ! Then waited nearly an hour for luggage , bed room was nice , large but had no bath tub so whilst waiting for luggage asked to move to room with tub as suffer with bad back and like to soak in tub !  We were moved to a small room which was very average !  We then tried to get food down stairs !  Buffet had finished by this time and a la carte in Lodi area  there was no where to sit !  I don’t like eating in bedroom so did not want room service ,  There was a take away coffee & snack kiosk in lobby so ended up having…

First time travelling with a 3 and 1 and half old and my experience at the Shangri-La was unforgettable! It’s a fantastic hotel if you have young kids as it caters for your every need, not just the kids but adults as well! Staff were very accommodating and friendly, nothing was too much trouble.  Too much to mention but here are some of the highlights: Free pram hire Night light when sleeping with kids was perfect and even one in the bathroom which was great as you didn’t need to turn on the lights and disturb the kids. Free Kids activities Amazing kids play centre Pool and wet play area for kids Lots of variety for buffet breakfast  Horizon club is a MUST which also caters for kids! Awesome pillow menu

Review title: Nice 5 Star Property- Quietness in the midst of the city and next to Shopping paradise Lane - Orchard Road
Review: Went to Shangri-la Singapore in mid Oct2018 for a conference and find it a nice place to be in. The City View it gives is so serene as it does not show you the city traffic and you intend to have a feeling of living in a country side property. Nice and Courteous staff with good facilities around. became more famous after famous Kim Trump Summit. Walkable distance from famous Orchard Road for all Shopohlic people who want to pick their liking stuff day in day out.  As a personal liking -- I like the Mom and Son Murals they have in their main lobby.  Nice artistic view with uniqueness.

Really friendly staff. Lots of facilities, great for kids and family. Varieties of food and beverage. Near to city. Free shuttle bus to the nearest mrt and malls. Even thought is near to the city,  full of greenery and tress that make you feel like u're at the resort. Definitely a great place for families!

Review title: One of the great hotels of Singapore
Review: This was my first stay at the Shangri-La in Singapore. Its a grand old dame which has kept its reputation going since the 1970s when it was established. Its a 7 minute walk from Orchard Road (slightly uphill coming back!!!) but a free hotel shuttle provides regular services to ION Orchard. I was in the executive room with access to the executive lounge on the 25th (top) floor - great views, wonderful breakfast! The hotel prides itself on great service and I fully endorse that. If I am to criticise anything: the swimming pool is NOT for laps ... its a flower shape ornamental pool for kids and dads to frolic; basically - its tiny, therefore I could not do my laps or swim properly (weekends its a beehive). The tropical gardens around the pool are on the other hand - really…

Stayed here whilst visiting family for Christmas. Lovely hotel staff were very friendly and seemed very happy to help with anything you needed. Room was very clean with a lovely bathroom. Very nice swimming pool area which was great to cool off with a dip in the pool after spending all day exploring. Christmas Day dinner was amazing

Shangrila never disappoints - beautiful hotel great location for orchard road. It is a big hotel but still manages to feel spacious and not overcrowded. Breakfast is a feast! And great staff with exceptional service.

As usual, worth to spend money where value is there. This hotel in Spore offers a convenient location quite close to Orchard, but at the same Looks far from the confusion and crowded places. Excellent service with committed personnel, able to make you feeling important without invading your privacy zone. Restaurants, swimming pool, business center and rooms... all of them convenient in a short distance and able to satisfy any need. In short... Shangri La...

very nice hotel and location and decoration and services. my memorable honeymoon was 27-30sep in this hotel. pool area. perfect breackfast. large rooms. all staffs behavior and ... easy and fast check in and check out and very nice room service. hope to book it and come bach again as soon as possible.  payam.

I recently had the pleasure of staying at this hotel.  Every thing from check in to departure was flawless.  This was particularly amazing since I was there at the same time as the Asian defense ministers meeting.  The security checks were a little burdensome but necessary.  Every staff member I encountered was fabulous.  The GM needs to be commended for the fine job he has done to train them.  In a city where 5 star hotels are a dime a dozen, this one rises to the top of list.  Keep up the good work!!!

I think the hotel won my kids who are 4 and 2 - from the first 5 mins they set foot at the lobby. They were greeted by lovely receptionist with cookies on hand. And as the lobby is spacious, the cookies were great incentives to stop both kids from running around. The check in process was seamless, everyone was so helpful. Information about the kids club was given straight after we check in to the hotel. The kids club was amazing - it was new I think, extremely clean and so much fun, the hotel also run free baking class for older kids, singing session, etc (can’t remember the others. The swimming pool is big enough to entertain the kids day and night without them being bored. Room service was great. We always order food around 20 mins before we finished swimming, so the food…

Review title: Wonderful getaway in the wonderful Shangri-La-La
Review: We booked a 10 day getaway from Autumn in the UK and decided to escape to the tropical warmth of Singapore. From the moment we stepped out of the taxi we experienced the wonderful service and facilities of this great hotel. We had booked a junior Suite in the tower wing which includes access to the Horizon club - and after a quick welcome drink at the front desk were kindly escorted up the the 24th floor Horizon Club to complete our check in - and to enjoy some of the complementary sparkling wine, wines, beers and cocktails / canapés - which was the perfect welcome after a long flight. (We soon found out this was available daily from 5 - 8pm and the perfect way to enjoy a ‘sundowner’ before dinner. Equally daily high tea was available 2-4pm  - all of which was presented…

Username: กรณ์ปารณีย์ ย
Review: The hotel it's 5 stars deluxe hotel located on Orange Road.The hotel is located in central part of city and comfortable to travel with  family,can to travel Merlion Park by subway or Taxi,30 minutes for subway and 5 minutes for Tax but more expensive. Hotel good atmosphere and good environment.The hotel it's a beautiful decorator. Staff in the hotel are friendly and helpful,good hospitality.

This hotel nearby Orchard Road, so it’s very private enough to enjoy, relax and recharge  And that’s amazing located because hotel is located in Central part of city. The hotel’s staff so very lovely, polite, friendly and helpful.            Hotel is perfect for a family to stay, room is super quiet and comfortable everything is a great hotel should be so, I would definitely to stay at this hotel again.

We loved the hotel. The amenities are many and so well laid out. The pool and pool area are great for anyone including families. So accessible. I did not give the rating an excellent as A few of the employees were not as hospitable as the last two Shangri-La hotels we stayed at in Thailand on this trip. For example, the Consierge would not give us a steak house recommendation outside the hotel because he wanted us to eat in the hotel. My guess is he was somehow connected to the restaurant. That recommendation at the Origin was not a good experience. We missed a good night on the town because of this gentleman. Just please be honest.

As the delightful check in lady ushered me out of the limousine directly to my room, after a perfectly executed transfer, I mentioned that I wasn't so much interested in the refurbished building but whether SLS had retained its magical people skills. I wasn't disappointed.   The In Room Entertainment needed a fix - done immediately, and from then on as my brain came back into gear over 48 hours all was perfectly executed.   Room Service - Great Food On Time. Reception Support - Correct and Swift.  Bell Boy Support - Grease lightening were they waiting outside?  And so I could enjoy the mini hanging gardens of Babylon vibe of the Garden Wing and a room with a Verandah, very nice, and the gym and the pool and the walk to the retail therapy.   There were quite a lot of people…

One of the best hotel for staying in Singapore..Hotel is located in Central part of city and environment is amazing...Everybody must enjoy food here...Amazing experience and enjoyed a lot here....Excellent....

First time staying at a Shanghai La Hotel so we did not know what to expect as we usually prefer smaller boutique style hotels or private properties as large hotel chains so often disappoint and feel soulless.  However we have been absolutely delighted by The Shangri La at Orange Grove Singapore.  It’s a beautifully decorated hotel immaculately maintained with genuinely lovely staff. The hotel feels stylish and elegant and the room is super quiet and very very comfortable.  The location is also well placed for all Singapore’s main attractions.  We would definitely stay again and can highly recommend the hotel. Horizon club is also worth the upgrade. The pool and gardens are great plus there are two excellent tennis courts.

If budget is not a constraint, this hotel is perfect for a family or couple to stay.   Checking is fast and staff are polite, friendly and helpful. Food from the hotel lobby and The Line is delicious. We ordered a tea set in the afternoon after check in, ala carte dinner and breakfast at The Line.  You can also book the outdoor restaurant space for a special occasion. Ideal for a proposal.  There is a children’s play area beside the restaurant which is open to public. Hotel guests can get a discount for their kids for indoor and outdoor play area. Quite worth it.  The hotel is near to Orchard road yet private enough to enjoy, relax and recharge. Absolutely love it.

Review title: Lunch and Dinner at the Origin Grill - first with wifey then with family of 3 generations!
Review: We had a family night out to celebrate my son’s success over post medical registrar exams. After weeks of hard work and preparation thought it was fitting to have a celebration over a sumptuous dinner with the family of 3 generation. This was my second visit at Origin Grill.  First was an executive set lunch I had with my better half which offered value for money and good bite size portion: not too heavy for the afternoon meal. Perfect set meal as far as my wife and I were concerned. The various house poured I had and the dessert port wine made it a pleasant afternoon. My wife obviously had to drive who hardly drank more than a glass of red with her eyes trained on me as I happily seep the “grape juice”.haha..  The dinner ambience was perfect in the private room for 8 pax.  We…

As in the past we once again came back for the Iconic fare at Rose verandah . Whilst the ambience look and feel is always fresh the food item spread  and desserts were as usual very well presented and tastes also delicious . The Japanese sushi sashimi were good however could have been better . Same for the  dimsums - taste average . The sea bass in local Sambal chilli sauce was a nice addition as was the sea food Catalana made up of squid, prawn and salmon ... The hazel nut ice-cream and strawberry sorbet were superb.  The choice of teas and coffees was as good as any where else if not better . Highly recommended !

Friendly staff who are ever ready to greet you start from the moment you stepped into the hotel main entrance. The Tower Wing deluxe room was expectedly clean and well provided with stationery and easy wifi connection, though the king-size bed tends to make the room a bit squeezing. The bathroom was huge with the expected quality toiletries . The breakfast was sumptuous and located just outside its dining area is the outdoor swimming pool surrounded by matching landscape plants. Overall, a highly satisfying stay and  wished we had more times to enjoy the facilities.

Review title: A great option but needs to up its game!
Review: I spent three nights at the Shangri La, staying in the Valley Wing; what the hotel classes as its most luxurious wing.    Although this will soon undergo renovation, with the Garden and Tower Wings having recently re-opened following their own renovations, the hotel is still in a mostly excellent condition, minus some very tired and worn out carpets.  Part of what differentiates the Valley Wing from the rest of the hotel, is a more personalised service as well as the complimentary provision of drinks and snacks throughout the day at different parts of the hotel, be it the main lobby, the Summit Room or the pool area.    My room was big and spacious with large windows overlooking the pool. The marble and wood decor is traditional Shangri La, with a large spacious bathroom, with…

Review title: Everything a great hotel should be
Review: We spent 7 nights at the Shangri-La Singapore and loved it. It was everything we hoped it would be. We had a beautiful, large comfortable room with great service, a lovely pool, good food and drink and a good location. I cannot wait to return. It is the perfect place to unwind with a vibrant city on your doorstep.

Last day of a fantastic 7 night stay in the valley wing....everything about this hotel is class.... facilities too many to mention.... service 1st class....pool environment stunning....food amazing..... we stayed in the valley wing which I booked directly through the hotel website and f ankle was an amazing deal.... room and breakfast would have been good value in itself but then add in complimentary afternoon tea, evening canapés, champagne and drinks all day and this must go down as one of the best value places in the whole of Singapore. The rooms and class of the valley wing are worth paying a bit more for... separate entrance and you can see why so many heads of state choose to stay here... well done to the hotel and all it’s staff.

Review title: Excellent in every way and all ways
Review: We stayed at the Shangrila with our 2 year old toddler and it was the best stay decision we could have made . We stayed at the valley wing deluxe suite and everything was just perfect. The room was very spacious with elegant decor. The room was well stocked with goodies , chocolates, fresh fruits , drinks, magazines and our favourite nespresso all of which was diligently restocked everyday. The housekeeping was immaculate and turndown service was twice a day.   The lobby staff and front desk staff was most helpful and very friendly and pleasant; always available for any queries or any general help like taxi booking etc .  Our package also included free high tea and canapés everyday in the lobby area with most lovely live music from the harp being played in the background.  As…

We stayed at The Shangri-La in the Valley Wing. This is almost impressive hotel with excellent service. The rooms are beautify decorated and very comfortable.  The pool is very nice with plenty of space and not overcrowded.  Food is of excellent quality and the Service second too none. We highly recommend a stay here.

Stayed here in October what a hotel from we arrived till we left first class service. The hotel is stunning. Our room was on the. 11th floor with pool. Views well equipped and spotless. The restaurants were fantastic food top  notch. The breakfast was great with champagne. Plenty fir everyone the pool area was lovely very large pool the gardens were very well kept. This hotel is well worth the cost you are treated like royalty it’s also within walking distance of the restaurants shops and bars the staff are friendly and very professional there uniforms are even spoyand very smart the managers are always visible and ask how your stay is the light music in the foyer bar is nice to listen too over  a drink. First class hotel

Review title: Luxurious hotel that is totally kid friendly!
Review: We stayed in the Deluxe Family room for 5 nights in October with two children under 3.  The room was lovely and the wing we stayed on was so useful.  We were able to cook in the pantry which allowed us to prepare solid food, great as our younger one refuses pouch food and we were able to wash our clothes halfway through our trip.  Furthermore we were provided both a high chair and buggy.  The facilities were wonderful - our older one loved the Buds and he went there everyday.  due to meeting relatives (try to avoid going at weekends as its super busy), it is a shame that we did take more advantage of the wet play and pool areas.

The serviced apartments at the Shangri-la are comfortable and more spacious than the hotel rooms and offer a pool next to the building and also easy access to all of the services of the main hotel.  This is the best serviced apartment deal we have experienced in Singapore both in terms of quality and amenities as well as price/value.  Highly recommend.

Great experience by any measure. Staff were very welcoming and attentive on arrival and check-in.  Room upgrade is never a bad thing and our was excellent.  Appreciated the inclusions of fruit drinks etc   Room was quiet the blinds were excellent and the view was surprisingly good.  Slept like the dead which is always a good sign.  Had a quick walk around and the pool facilities and other restaurants etc look excellent.  Check out was also an easy experience.  We will definitely be back

Review title: This has to be the best hotel I have stayed in.
Review: From stepping out of our car, we were made to feel special, even though we possible we’re not looking at our best after the long haul flight. All the staff were polite, friendly and attentive.  We were given an upgrade to a suite, which was just pure luxury with magnificent views.  Attention to detail was evident everywhere. We sat in the bar late on our first evening and despite not being on the menu The barman made me the best ever Singapore Sling. The breakfast was in my view spectacular, I had to walk round twice just to take in the overwhelming choice.  I hope that we can come back here as our stay was just not long enough.

Went for a staycation for 1 night with me Wife. We were both very impressed with the newly renovated room. Clean, spacious and nicely decorated. View from the view is really amazing! Can see the beautiful nightlights of Orchard area.  Hotel’s breakfast buffet spread is one of the best we ever had. From local to international fare. Lots of choices. Overall one of the best hotel stay experienced we had from the moment you stepped into the hotel.

We have just returned from an 8 day stay at the Shangri la, with Horizon club access and absolutely loved it. the service from start to finish was exceptional. It was our first family holiday with out young son, Jack and we now have life time long happy memories. We had access to to the Horizon Club lounge which was perfect with our young traveller. there is a special designated area for families, which means that the children can play while Mum and Dad enjoy a beverage between 5 and 6.30pm. The nightly canapés were delicious. Overall we were in heaven and didn't want it to end. We hope to be back soon. Shout out to Puneet and Yang, the staff are so good with children and seemed to genuinely love kids. Thank you!! Paula, Blair and Jack.

We enjoyed ourselves so much in 2013/14 we returned to celebrate my sister's Birthday.  Our room overlooked the garden and was breathtaking.  What a wonderful time we had and the Valley Wing staff made my sister's Birthday enjoyable and a day we will always remember.  They are truly exceptional.  When returning from a day's outing they welcome us home.  When cleaning our room they are so discreet and very rarely seen or heard.  When tempting us at breakfast they provide further options not on the menu.  Evening drinks (champagne or a wide selection of still wine and cocktails, teas and coffee)  in the Valley Wing with canapes and Khristina playing the harp is truly an experience not to be missed.  The dress code has been modified in the last 5 years to smart casual, keeping up…

Review title: Beautiful, elegant , fabulous Hotel in Singapore
Review: We enjoyed 5 nights of luxury in this magnificent hotel, with a great view from our 11th floor widow, looking out over the city and down to the gorgeous swimming pool. This was great for our family (grandchildren)  who used both the indoor and outdoor play areas: pirate ship with water canons, and indoor ball pool and climbing cage.  Our grandson called it "Granny's house", and for us it certainly felt like home from home.

Review title: Very Good Hotel but there is room for improvement
Review: We stayed here for 4 nights and found the facilities and room excellent and very clean as ever with the staff at Shangri-La hotels the staff were excellent.  Room for improvements concerns breakfasts the food is not kept hot enough and plates were cold. The best way to get hot food was at the stations where food was cooked to order and get your own coffee the waiters brought tepid at best but get your own it is piping hot. The food selection is fantastic but attention to keeping it hot is essential. The decor in the dining area was not to my personal taste. The ASEAN military conference proved somewhat of an inconvenience with the extra security armed police and army security checkpoints concrete blocks and CCTV a little alarming and whilst the hotel tried to keep things going…

On this trip, celebrating a milestone birthday with family and friends from all around the world, we chose to stay at the Shangri La Apartments (adjacent to the wonderful Shangri La Hotel  in Singapore). As a frequent visitor to both the Hotel (Tower Wing, Garden Wing and the very exclusive Valley Wing) we knew what to expect in terms of great accommodation, hospitality, professionalism, efficiency, tasty food but most of all the friendliness of all staff.  Of course we were not let down.   How lovely to return to a place where staff who previously greeted your young children (Hotel Pool people Raymond and Bernard) now greet the younger generation (5 year old grandson).  Satay by the pool (Hotel) - as delicious as ever.  The culinary Gift Shop Shophouse in the Lobby of the Tower…

I stayed at the hotel for 2 nights as part of a "staycation" with my wife and 3 children. I had booked 2 inter-connecting Tower Wing Deluxe Rooms (One King and One Twin Room, with an extra bed) however upon check-in we were advised that the room could not accommodate an extra bed as there was not enough space. No bother, the check-in staff apologized for the miss-understanding and gave us a complimentary upgrade to two interconnecting Garden Wing Deluxe Room, which could accommodate the extra bed. A very nice gesture and very much appreciated. The hotel is everything you'd expect from a Shangri-La, smart, luxurious and very tranquil - sat by the pool, you'd never know you were in the middle of a bustling city. The breakfast buffet was awesome - it had everything you could…

Highly recommend this hotel, nothing was a problem to ask for, the staff were beautiful, and genuinely kind and friendly.  We asked for Kate check out as our flight left at 10pm and we checked out at 2pm and were kinder offered to use their spa showers at any time before our flight, which they organised the best time with traffic and booked taxi for us. The location I found great, food was fantastic. We will be returning here.. it definitely aided in us falling in love with Singapore , what a beautiful city and genuinely friendly people. If you get the chance to stay here for a night or two,  Don’t think twice about it, just book it. 👍🏻

The hotel is beautiful, lobby is stunning with lots of greenery and artwork. We stayed for the children’s facilities and weren’t disappointed. Kids club amazing, the outdoor water playground also fabulous. Our daughter (aged 7) raved about them both and really enjoyed the time she spent in the kids club and water playground.  We had a family package, and were supposed to be on the family friendly floor especially for kids. Unfortunately they had overbooked so we were located on another floor, and as such we did not receive any kids amenities in our room and to call and request them for our children. They also forgot we were celebrating a wedding anniversary and our daughters birthday, which had been confirmed via email prior to arrival. We did receive cake and wine once they…

We stayed at the Shangri-La Singapore from 29 September until 1 October (our first visit, but certainly not our last) as a stop-over on our trip home from London, to assist us with jetlag recovery. As soon as we pulled up in our car we were greeted by the resplendently attired doorman eager to take the luggage before showing us into the entrance lobby. The cool lobby was a real contrast to the heat of the outside. A lovely team member (Vanessa) commenced the check-in process before whisking us up to the 7th floor.   The Valley Wing was absolutely fabulous. From the moment we checked in we were treated liked a valued customer, even though we hadn't been there before. The staff went out of their way to make us feel welcome and at home, from an extra early check in (8:30AM) to a…

Peter in the lobby welcomed us warmly and escorted us to the club check in personally. He remembered us throughout and showed much consideration to customer service. The hotel was very nice with an excellent pool area. Club had a very good selection of food and drink and was good value for money. Our room 2009 was near the lifts and a bit noisy at night and should be avoided. Location is calm and away from the bustle of the city, a short and cheap taxi ride into the bay. We would recommend and come here again,

This hotel is fantastic!!!  It will take me too long to capture all the things this hotel is doing right.  First, we travelled with our two kids (8 and 5) and arrived late at night.  We had booked a themed family suite and our check in was in the room so that the kids could familiarise themselves and not have to wait downstairs in the lobby after an 8 hour journey to get there.  That was a thoughtful beginning and our stay continued in that manner.  The room was so beautiful.  The parent's area was great (eating area, comfortable bed and small bathroom).  The kids room was massive, had a castle (with two beds in it), a mural on the wall, a hidden TV, a hidden door, a large bathroom with lowered toilet and a bath tub and kids toiletries (and nappies if you need them), and kids…

We loved this property so much and had a hard time leaving. It was luxury all the way and the staff were wonderful, the facilities great and the food choice was exceptional. The rooms are very generous and the comfort factor was wow. We decided to stay in the Garden Wing and we were very happy with the choice. We'll definately be back to visit,

Had the pleasure of 4 nights in the Valley Wing - Lynn at the main reception suggested upgrading from the Tower Wing (Horizon Club), and after inspecting a Valley Wing room, it was an easy choice. Everything was perfect. My wife and I particularly loved the breakfasts, afternoon tea and drinks/canapes, the very attentive and helpful staff (particularly Dominique) and the amazing pool. We'll be back.

Recently stayed here for 4-nights as part of a business trip. The hotel was busy managing multiple groups and also conferences. However, what surprised me is that staff is always composed and able to deal with different guests' requests with no major hassle. Staff we bumped into always smile and courteous, which i was most impressed and a reflection of a world-class training and truly a 5-star hotel. Please keep up the good work. Shuttle to Orchard Rd is also handy, but do get full quickly. Otherwise it is a short-stroll or a short taxi ride. Buffet breakfast is never short of choices; my favorite is the freshly made omelette and the kaya toasts.

Had to write a review after our 5 day stay at the Shangri La complex. Stayed at the apartments next door for space (see review) but visited the main hotel every day for the extensive breakfast buffet.   Without a doubt our experience wouldn't have been half as special without chef Dean Bush who could not do enough to make us feel welcome. Always on hand to remember what we liked to eat and drink, provide excellent recommendations about what to do and see whilst in Singapore and keep us laughing with his sharp wit and charm.   The breakfast spread is phenomenal, catering for every taste, with a huge array of diverse world foods as well as an extensive bakery, fruit bar, live egg station and many gluten free options. We particularly enjoyed the inclusive Bellini bar as an extra…

Great Hotel. Can’t fault it, great food/restaurants, pool, best hotel gym I’ve ever used. Staff can’t do enough for you, often over and above expectations. Special thanks for Cheong Wen Jie the Guest Service Officer for really looking after our team, for advising us and making recommendations. Also special thanks to Emily in the Bar for the friendly and efficient service. Would highly recommend this hotel and would love to come back. Singapore in general is a really nice place with really nice and friendly people.

The property is a great place. The size of the rooms, the grand lobby, umpteen number of meeting rooms makes this perhaps the best hotel in Singapore for business meetings.  However a special mention about the concierge, Johnny and Arif. Both these gentlemen were extremely helpful, cheerful and helped our stay in Singapore special. They gave us information on places to visit and the restaurants to eat. As we were in the country for a limited time actually drew up a plan that allowed us to experience the whole city in a short time. Even experienced travel consultants would not be able to do this

Had a beautiful birthday dinner for my nieces. Special thanks to Gobi. With his excellent customer care, he’s able to spot that we are having a birthday celebration and got us a cake for my nieces. Always checking if everything is good. It’s always the thought that counts and these make it a wonderful birthday celebration for us. Thank u Gobi..

I'll never stay in another hotel when I visit Singapore. Impeccable and attentive customer service everywhere you go...front desk, spa, concierge, bell hops, cleaning. My room was spotlessly maintained. You could eat off the floor (exaggeration, of course). Loved the lobby and cool sculptures. Just wish I brought a bathing suit to enjoy the pool! Can't wait to return.

During our stopover in Singapore after an Indonesia trip we stayed in the Shangri-La Valley Wing. The feeling of luxury after a few weeks of 'back to basics' was simply amazing. Large room with perfect bed and huge bathroom was a perfect way to finish our break. On top of the great room the service level in the vally wing is simply the best in Singapore. 'High tea' in the lobby with a glass of champagne and the attentive staff is a great way to end an active day.

Review title: Child Friendly Shower Facilities Required for Better Experience
Review: The children all had a grand time at Buds at Shangrila’s indoor playground.  The set up encouraged a lot of active play.  The charges also included access to the outdoor water play ground which was very well built and incorporated interesting water activities.  However we were grossly disappointed with the lack of proper shower facilities nearby or at the water play area.  Instead we found that the available bathrooms near the pool and near the Health spa were too far and did not fully cater to children.  I would think that a 5 star hotel that offers a water play area would be equally sensitive to catering to shower stalls with basic amenities like children’s bath soap and shampoo, more conveniently located to the water play area!  It is not appropriate for children who are…

Review title: A nice Dinner with a great services and nice food
Review: I and my husband having dinner at The Line Restaurant on 2nd October to celebrate my bday and our 1st wedding anniversary. The staff did a great job, good services given to us during the dinner. They sang me a bday song and gave me a delicious choclate cake. Food tasted good, the seafood fresh and i loved the dessert so much. Keep up the great job guys 😊

A short stay which completely rejuvenated me. From the very first step into the hotel, to my last wave goodbye to your attentive personnel, nothing but five stars from me! The children's Buds play area was definitely an added bonus, although, would have been great if the outdoor wet play area was complimentary instead of charged for entry. Otherwise, all is good!

This was my second visit and I trust will not be my last. The service was simply excellent. The staff go out of their way to recall your name and to serve with style and courtesy. The Garden Room suites are simply glorious and the hotel provides even comfort and necessity. I cannot commend it highly enough.

Review title: Overall in my opinion one of the best Hotels I have stayed in - 6 not 5 star
Review: Stayed here for 3 nights after a cruise from Hong Kong. Chosen as a spot of out of town luxury for a special birthday we were not disappointed. You can make a grand arrival to be met by traditionally dressed doormen. We were then ushered across to check in and then had a nice surprise to find that as we were staying in a Tower Wing Horizon Club Deluxe Room we could check in at the Horizon Club Lounge on the 24 floor - we were escorted there by Peter from the Lobby Team and checked in while we had a complimentary drink with no fuss by Rachel. Our room on the 22nd floor was a you might expect very nicely appointed with both a bath and walk-in shower, bathrooms, slippers etc. Our favourite feature was the motorised curtains which revealed a view over Singapore. We made good use of…

As it has been, Shangri La htl is great. I stayed with 4 of my colleagues n all of them were satisfied at atmosphere,  food n services in Shangri La. Specially services from reception is one of the best from my experiences.

This is a beautiful hotel, the people are friendly, helpful and knowledgeable. I am happy to give them a 10 out of 10. Beautiful room, pool, food and people. They are happy to advise on sightseeing, where to eat and advise on catching cabs etc.

We stayed at the Shangri-La during our visit for the Formula Ones. Its a lush resort style hotel, with friendly, helpful staff. We stayed in a Horizons Club Premier room, which was huge - it was basically a suite, with two sections, two bay windows, sitting area and bedroom, with a nice view over surrounding suburbs. The Horizons Club was great - a large lounge on the top floor with great views. The food took it to another level - beautifully crafted cocktail food and afternoon tea 'snacks.'  The drink choices were varied - we had a few of the local 'Singapore Slings.' All staff were friendly and attentive. The lagoon pool was magnificent, and the perfect temperature - not too cool, and the surrounding gardens were lush and magnificent. The hotel lobby lounge area and bar were a…

We recently visited Singapore for the first time for the Grand Prix. We stayed at this hotel as it was also for a wedding anniversary. The hotel is fantastic, position for shopping and sightseeing is great with several option from walking to metro. We could not have asked for any thing more. We also had dinner at the Cantonese and Italian within the hotel which we both fantastic.

First time for me at a Shangri-la property and I must say it was great. Room, bed, shower, service, everything was perfect.  The international Restauarnt for breakfast was great and the service was flawless.

Good food, wonderful service & very clean. One of the hospitality staff, Uma, was exceptionally friendly & helpful. Will definitely come here again. I especially enjoyed the teh tarik, tasted like it was mixed by a pro 😀

Stayed at the the Shangri-La Valley Wing whilst on a flying visit to the far east to celebrate my birthday -SL is one of my favourite hotel groups, especially in the far east so I knew what to expect, however, the actual experience in the Valley Wing was more than exceeded and I am at a loss as to why it is not showered with lots more accoldates?!  The welcome upon arrival and the personalised check in set the scene for a memorable albeit short (birthday) stay with the added surprise of an upgrade to a suite.  The whole hotel complex is an oasis of peace and calm in the middle of a very vibrant and bustling city. It is rare to come across a city centre hotel anywhere in the world with such a large pool and gardens and likewise I am not aware of any other hotel that has a "Valley…

Review title: Stunning hotel, in the heart of Singapore
Review: My family and I stayed for 5 nights in August The hotel is superb! Really stunning and aesthetically beautiful We had a suite - not a themed suite - but my sons slept in the lounge room (in roll out beds) and we had our own bedroom The room was perfect - it even has a kitchen (which we didn’t use). It was really big and had everything in it that we needed The hotel is very close to orchard rd. We always caught a taxi to Orchard Rd though - it’s too hot and sweaty to walk! The breakfast was huge and amazing. Service was a bit hit and miss when getting our coffee - but otherwise, faultless The restaurants in the hotel are really good too - we had Chinese and the buffet a couple of times. Amazing food - we were always stuffed at the end, it was so yummy! The facilities for the kids…

On the first night 2 rats dunoon around pool area. Constant music in every bar. Impossible to sit for a moment without the endless staff asking and then asking again can they help. Breakfast was a zoo. Cold scrambled eggs and despite a family area children everywhere   This is best described as a package holiday hotel

Review title: I really wanted to give it 5-stars, I really did
Review: Shangri-La is most definitely a 4.5 star hotel though, but didn't quite meet our expectations for a 5.  The hotel is exquisite, it truly is.  From the nubbed silk uniforms donned by some of their staff, to the understated elegance of the lobby, to the beautifully manicured grounds, to the well-stocked library, to the high teas they offer, Shangri-La is a grand and refined property.  A few minor hiccups kept us from rating it a 5.0, and it mainly had to do with housekeeping.  One day, we arrived back at the room at 4:45PM to find our room had not been cleaned.  We did not have our privacy light on, and even though they quickly rectified it, we had to find something else to do while it was being cleaned.  Toiletries and towels were also hit or miss...sometimes we got 4 shampoos…

Review title: Sets the standard for Shangri-la globally
Review: Stayed for 6 days with my family in the middle of a long business trip.  We had adjoining rooms (Junior Suite - 686 - which is massive) and 687 (twin room and we had an extra roller bed).  2 Adults and 4 kids. it was hot and we were tired so we  spent a lot of time in the hotel.  The grounds are lush and green with amazing and huge pool.  We ate at The Line (breakfast and lunch on some days) and also Waterfall (Italian).  Waterfall in particular was amazing (also with great wine selection). We also enjoyed the Horizon Club for breakfasts some days and pre-dinner drinks.  We also went to the Japanese on Level 24, also very good and authentic Japanese. We had such a relaxing and lovely time that we didnt really venture out of the hotel that much (except to hawker markets for two…

Review title: Fabulous deluxe hotel ideal for business or pleasure
Review: This exquisite hotel is the place to stay in Singapore!  As in all Shangri-La hotels the staff are fantastic and from the moment you arrive are incredibly attentive and helpful. The hotel itself is large with several wings. I stayed in the rooms accessed via the lift from the main reception. These seemed recently renovated and had a very comfortable king bed, shower, bath, desk, couch and flat screen tv. The wardrobe was made of glass which is perhaps a little unnecessary but you can live with it.  Outside of your room the gym is large and well equipped, there is a good size outdoor pool and a large indoor soft play area for kids. The exec lounge serves a good breakfast as does the main restaurant which has many stations with breakfast options from around the world. I ate in the…

Have attended meetings here in the past and this time had the good fortune to stay for two weeks in a garden view room which was spacious and well-appointed. Special thanks for personal and first class service to Jaz in the Chi Spa and Kanan in the Lobby Lounge for making my solo travel so comfortable and taking such good care of me while I was there.

Review title: 5 Star Hotel with 6 Star Customer Service
Review: I recently stayed at the Shangri-La Hotel in Singapore with my wife to celebrate a major birthday.  The hotel has recently been totally refurbished throughout, including the grand lobby & reception area and all the rooms in the Tower wing, where we stayed. The hotels luxurious new interior compliments the beautiful gardens that surround the hotel. I have stayed at a number of 5 star hotels in Singapore and none have the feeling of space and tranquility that is afforded at the Shangri-La. The pool area is large enough to accommodate plenty of guests without the worry of getting in someone’s way like so many of the other hotels.  While this beautiful hotel has had a make over, it was the incredible level of customer service that really made our trip so memorable. From the moment…

My husband and I recently stayed at the shangri-la last week for his 50th birthday. We have stayed there often over the past 17 years and have gotten to know the staff and feel very much at home, which is why we chose the hotel to celebrate such an important occasion. We were not disappointed.  The hotel was excellent. We stayed in a junior suite which was well appointed, clean and very comfortable. We enjoyed the hospitality of the horizons club and ate at the origin grill and line restaurant. All were excellent. For us, the reason we return to the shangrila-la is not just for the excellent facilities but the staff. We travel a lot and we feel that the staff at this hotel exceed expectations and standards worldwide. We would like to make a special mention to vijay, who is…

This hotel is fabulous, nothing is to much trouble . Closes to  MRT stations and great shopping and bars. The room was lovely very large with great views. Breakfast was some else....... wow what a choice there wasn’t any thing you couldn’t have would definitely go back to this hotel

We are on our way back to Brisbane from Europe and we always stay in Singapore to help overcome the jet lag. This is the first time we have stayed at Shangri-La and it won’t be the last.  The property is set on acres and acres of land with beautiful gardens full of orchids and flowering ginger and bougainvillea. We were greeted by friendly staff at the door and reception and a lovely girl showed us to our room in the Tower Wing. We also had use of the Horizon Club Lounge which was absolutely fabulous on the 24th floor. The property is a bit further from the Bay but we wanted to just relax around the enormous pool which had plenty of  pool lounges for everyone so it was perfect for us. In summary if you want to stay at a hotel for a relaxing stay in amazing gardens with several…

Review title: Good choice if you fancy something a bit different
Review: The Shangrila is a 15-20 taxi ride away from the central business area.  The hotel has a resort complex feel with a generous outdoor pool.  The breakfast selection is suitably international with a very wide choice of cuisines and dishes.  The amazing Botanicsl gardens are a 20 minute walk from the hotel. The garden’s stay open until midnight and the paths are well lit. They are well worth a visit.  I would also definitely recommend the Shangrila.

Review title: Birthday celebration at Shangrila Garden Wing Suite
Review: Nice suite with a spacious patio. It has a bbq station and a Jacuzzi. Patio can comfortably accommodate 12 guests. Had a great time and hotel staff were very friendly and accommodating.   Hotel provides free complimentary car park for all guests.

We arrived early morning at the Shangri-La and were met from the taxi by a doorman who whisked our bags off (we did get them back!), leaving us to sample complimentary tea at reception while checking in. As the room wasn't yet available, we explored the pool area which is basically the same as you'd get at a resort - an unlikely find in the middle of a major city..  The room (junior suite) was beautiful; I particularly liked the automatic curtains :), and the free water was useful if you aren't one for tap water.   It really is worth paying extra for executive lounge access, where they provide breakfast, afternoon tea, and evening cocktails (though you have to make your own) within certain times each day, and soft and hot drinks 24/7. The service was outstanding, for example one…

Stayed there for one night on a business trip. E/thing as you expect from a Shangri-La. Pretty large hotel but does not feel like it once you are in your room. Not exactly in the CBD either but short taxi ride is ok. B’fast at club level very good.

Thank you to hotel staffs for making the effort to set up a cute decoration during our birthday staycation.   Pros: - Very spacious, comfortable and luxurious room with one of the best study area design. - Good wifi - Spacious shower area and bathtub - Good toilet amenity - Good location, close to city area - Friendly staffs - Thank you for the complimentary birthday cake and decoration - Very quiet room  Pros: - When we reached our room, we were surprised to find that the room was not locked. Staffs were still getting our room ready even though we reached at 3:40pm. I believe it is the most basic requirement for hotels to get room ready upon check-in time which is 3pm, especially for a 5-stars hotel like Shangri-La.  - Even though I appreciate the birthday set-up, hotel staffs…

Its nice to be ba k here at Shangri La Singapore. The moment you step in, you will be surrounded by polite and staff ready to assist you whether they are the doorman, service crew or even the security guys. This what I always said Hardware and Software matches. The restaurants are always full butvthebataff are always smiling too. Thanks for taking care of our stay. Will be back

Stay here 3 night during for my business trip. This hotel is huge:lobby , bar, restaurant.. have several hotel wing, look like a small oasis in busy singapore. The lobby is so nice with all the contemporay decoration work of art, Enjoy my time here

Review title: What a nice and friendly service at the shangrila lobby lounge 🖤
Review: We visitted shangrila hotel just for dinner at the lounge. When we got there, the staff were very friendly especially Allie, Kannan, Annie and yissa. Allie kindly helped us choosing dinner menu, laksa and bah ku teh were awesome btw, Annie and Kannan made special drinks for me, and Yissa made us feel special being served,, Anyway we are willing to visit shangrila lobby lounge again next time.  Thank you for wonderful foods ,drinks and service.

Review title: Business meetings with locally inspired cocktails
Review: Had a business meeting at the lobby lounge and was impressed by the selection of drinks and recommendations from Kannan who helped us navigate through the menu, Annie who was serving us that day also help my business partner with his selection of local food, great ambiance and conducive to have a non formal business meeting

We spent 4 days in Singapore (our first trip) and really did not know what to expect.  We were quite impressed at the nice greeting we got.  We were escorted to the check-in desk, and since we had reserved a club level room we were escorted upstairs to a separate check-in location.  We got to sit down and enjoy complimentary drinks and food (with a great view) while Rachel ( I think that was her name) took care of checking us in.  She also gave us info about some of the things we wanted to do and was very helpful.  The room was very spacious with everything you would need and very clean (same for the bathroom).  We decided to go to the dinner buffet and were overwhelmed by the quantity and quality of the food available.  They had everything.  We went to the breakfast buffet in…

We stayed at the hotel in July for one night. It was an amazing experience. The staff were excellent and nothing was too much trouble for them. The gardens were beautiful especially the orchid arrangement. We could not fault the hotel and we will return.

A hotel that constantly sets the standard for customer service, decor, room quality, associated services....  If u have never stayed at this hotel or the shangri la chain - treat yourself   Too many features to mention and notjing is too much trouble for the staff  Can not recommended enough.  Sets the standard for luxury hotels the world over

Review title: Never fail to Amaze...My Best Bet!
Review: Shangri-La is my one of my favourite chain hotel and it never fails to deliver to my expectation as always. Stay a night here early this month while on a staycation with my family, the stay was fantastic and the service was excellent. The guy, Jim who checked us in, was friendly & efficient, and even gave us 2 dine-in credit vouchers for the bar when we asked him about chill-out venue.   We booked the hotel in the early morning, the same day we checked in, and the room was already ready with all our requests, baby cot and connecting rooms the moment we checked in, Bravo to them for the extra details and services. Room is spacious and clean. Swimming Pool is heated, and this is excellent for my kids and my baby. Room service prompt and breakfast at The Line was great.   All in…

As a regular business traveller to Asia, I always try to stay at Shangri-La Hotels (unless I’m in India where it’s Taj or Oberoi). They have a level of customer care missing from the western chains (with the exception of the Four Seasons Group). The Shang in Singapore is a legendary hotel. The recent refurb is welcome and the public areas much improved. I’ve been coming here for 15 years.
