I’ve also stayed at the Fullerton and Mandarin Oriental but I really wouldn’t stay anywhere else in Singapore if I were you.

Top class... excellent service, food, room, location. Old world charm meets modern requirements. I felt like a celebrity and certainly got treated like one 🤩. Well worth every dollar..... nothing is too much trouble and your every desire to eat is available.

This is our 3rd stay here for the GP weekend and it never disappoints. The rooms are always lovely along with great service and a vast array of restaurants to choose from. It makes things so easy and hassle free.

I am lucky enough to be writing this sat within the walls of the marvellous utopia known as The Valley Wing.  Since arriving early Friday morning we have been looked after at a standard not experienced in any five star hotel we have been lucky enough to frequent.  This includes The Ailia Diwa Club Wing in India, The Ritz Carlton in Hong Kong and Chambers at St Pancras in London.  These hotels are at the top of their game but do not come close to the personalised and very attentive service given by every member of staff working in this wonderful environment.  We have not found one fault with the standard of food, service or detailing offered by this hotel.    The whole team are an absolute credit to the amazing management team who ensure the highest of standards within the Valley…

Review title: The only hotel to stay at.
Review: Booked The shangri la / vally wing after extensive research on trip advisor.  Upon arrival, my mother and I were gifted with precious boxed orchids. Beautiful welcome.  Check in was smoothest i have ever seen. Aysha was beyond helpful and most welcoming. Aysha welcomed us into our vally wing room 955 which was nothing but I can only describe as vintage elegance. Spacious room. Clean, equally pretty bathroom with a Tv in front of the tub. Perfect way to unwind after a gruelling day of hard core sightseeing.  For breakfast we enjoyed The line. Wow what an culinary experience was that.  Wondering round the hotel lobby’s, garden wing and tower wing, i came to realise that the vally wing is exactly what I wanted. Peaceful bliss with a personal touch.  The staff at the vally wing…

Review title: BT and RT 4 day stay in September
Review: An excellent Hotel. Clean throughout and the facilities are first class. A wide choice of foods and beverages for breakfast. Very helpful staff at the LINE breakfast restaurant. The Hotel is in a very good position and within easy walk of the main shopping street and restaurants in SG. We had a garden room overlooking the large swimming pool and of course the well maintained and beautiful Hotel gardens. The staff are very helpful and courteous. A special thanks to the vivacious Cory Wright, Senior Service Manager and the very knowledgable Hotel Concierge Johnny Hor and also the very delightful lobby bar staff for making our stay so pleasant and restful. We will certainly return to the Hotel next year.

Review title: Two nights in Singapore at the Shangi la
Review: We had two days in Singapore before embarking on a Cruise around the Far East. We chose the Shangri-La due to our experience in Abu Dhabi where we were wowed by the hotel. I have to say we were a little disappointed with the Singapore hotel I’m afraid to say. On the positive side the hotel itself is lovely, with large spacious rooms and very welcoming staff ( expecially at front desk and conscierge), but some of the things that we loved in the Abu Dhabi Shangri-La were absent.   We booked  a horizon club room and expected to be able to get a snack there when we arrived at about 10pm, but we were advised that the food had finished at 9pm and so we would have to order food in the bar. This turned out to be very loud and rowdy with a live jazz band and many after work drinkers. I…

We stayed at the Shangri-La after reading the great reviews on tripadvisor and from a personal recommendation from friends who stay there every year. To say we were happy with the hotel is an understatement!! We stayed in interconnecting rooms in the Garden Wing and it was fantastic! The view from the room was amazing, looking over the pool, perfect! The pool was fantastic, much of our 5 day stay was spent beside or in the pool. Breakfast was also a highlight. We had the buffet breakfast a few times and also decided to try the breakfast at the Italian restaurant a couple of times. Wow, we loved it there. Service was impeccable and surrounds were beautiful. We found the staff quite helpful. The hotel ground are also very impressive. If you are after a resort hotel for the whole…

The service is excellent and all the little extras are worth a stay at Valley Wing. Best Hotel in Singapore. Just been travelling Europe and this is the best Hotel to come back before heading home to Melbourne.  The service is outstanding. We will be back.

As a place for a work trip, this place is excellent.  Easy check-in, quick room service, etc...  Breakfast was of the level you expect at a big hotel like this.  Nice that there were no lines to be seated. Coffee service was efficient.  They even had a little coffee and pastry stand at the entrance for anyone who was in a rush and just wanted to grab and go, which I thought was a nice touch.  They also had a separate area for families with small children - also a great feature.  And there is free wifi everywhere!!!  This is a really great feature if you are moving from one meeting/event to the next.  I was always online so did not need a local sim card.  Rooms were a good size and bed was very comfortable.  Location is central, but not right on a main street so it is a bit of a…

Stayed in the Shang over the Father's Day weekend for a little staycation and decided to check out the new kids' facilities the hotel has. Check-in took a while due to the weekend, and many new guests but staff were helpful to let us know we could check in with the app which helped to speed up the process.  We stayed at the Tower wing and the room was big and very comfortable for the whole family. The bed was very comfy, and I believe the rooms we renovated were recently. The indoor and outdoor Bud play areas for the kids kept my daughter thoroughly entertained when we were in the hotel. The mornings were a little quieter so it was perfect for her to get to play whatever she wanted, a perk of staying in the hotel. The hotel also has free shuttle to Orchard if you want to get out…

Thanks for all staff shangri la ... Went on a business trip but it felt like a short getaway. The staff were friendly and hospitable, they made me feel comfortable and valued. The whole hotel ambiance was very relaxing.The decoration, furnishings and amenities were well thought out. The gym was also well equipped and just enough for one to continue their fitness routine while away from home. I don’t think I want to stay at any other hotel for my future trips!

My boys and I stayed here in the New Year on the way to Phuket. Its alway nice here and my sons were treated to a nice couple of days. They thought the changing day in the lift carpet was great. We will be back when we pass through Singapore next.

Review title: Nice and newly renovated Tower wing room
Review: Stayed 1N in a tower wing club deluxe room for a quick local getaway.  Room is recently renovated with a nice modern touch vs some Shang properties in this part of the world, which is a blast from the 80s. Sound insulation is great and I slept well despite being a light sleeper.  Service is polite, discreet and efficient as is the hallmark of Singapore hospitality, but not as warm and inviting as you would experienced in Shang KL or JKT.  Location is a bit off but there is a shuttle to Orchard mrt station that runs quite frequently. You can walk there too in ~10-15mins (barring bad weather or you have young or old in tow). Onsite F&B is great and the horizon club provides food or snacks through the day. Only complaint is the breakfast offering in th horizon club; food are cold,…

The buffet in this hotel has a wide range of food. Whether it is Western or Japanese,the food tastes good. There are also choices of Hong Kong roast pork and Indian cuisine. There is a kids corner which display kids meal.

Great hotel if you need space. A big hotel so! The service is great and every little details are looked after. The location is good but you need a taxi to go to Orchad however you enjoy à quite green place! The rooms are spacious. Food is good and swimming pool is large with a good gym. Again the only things is that the hotel is a big one with a lot of guests.

Fantastic stay, great service and fabulous restaurants. Upgraded to include horizon club room. Well worth paying the extra which included very early check in. Easy access to Orchard Road shops. Worth spending time with the very helpful concierges who advise when and where to go including how to save money

Had a PERFECT experience at Shangri-la, 3 times better than our 2nd-time stay at MBS!  Every thing was great, the excellent service, generous and meticulous in-room amenities, superb ambience (not as crowded and commercialised as MBS) and tremendously worth-while for families!!!  We made several requests and all were acceded to, and even went above and beyond!  I don't know how to better describe such a pleasant, smooth and relaxing stay with my pregnant wife and 2 year-old son.   Impeccable, hugely-underrated (because there are just too many high-end hotels in Singapore) and absolutely recommended by demanding Singaporeans like us!  Great job, Shangri-la, impressive:) Keep up the great work, all the staff!

Review title: Great Staycation in a family-oriented hotel
Review: We decided to book a weekend staycation package that included access to Buds, the fantastic indoor playroom and outdoor water playground that Shangri-La decided to install on their premises.   Our daughter had a really good time checking out all the slides and ball pits! Non-stop fun that was well worth the price paid for the package.  Our room was on the family floor which came with a room containing all the amenities that those with babies and young kids need. The room was spacious and came with very useful items for kids and babies. We particularly liked the baby bedroom slippers!  Our package included buffet dinner with unlimited drinks including alcohol. This was again a great addition to the package. Breakfast was really crowded but the spread was great so we still ate to…

Stayed here after leaving Bali early due to earthquake so was really looking forward to serious luxury and pampering....have to say on arriving the lobby area is a hive of activity and atmosphere, very tastefully decorated and certainly gears you up for whats to come next....or not. On arrival after traveling for two days we asked could we upgrade our rooms ( 2 rooms ) as we wanted a bit of space...unfortunately we were advised this was not available. We went to our rooms which were nice but not 5* we freshened up and relaxed . The following morning we went to breakfast which could best be described as bedlam it was so crowded after securing seating for the four of us we were greeted by " the buffet is clising soon " nice welcome to get but we went up to get breakfast only to be…

Review title: ROM at the Garden Wing Premium Balcony room
Review: We had our ROM ceremony at Shang's garden wing premium balcony. Would like to say a big THANK YOU to their Lobby Ambassador Mr Tim Ang! When we visited Shangri-la still undecided on our ROM venue, we were so lucky to have met Tim who brought us around all 3 wings and explained in details which would be the best room for our event. And because of him, we were also able to recieve many blessings from the hotel like wine, bouquet of roses, cake & champagne.  Thank you so much Tim, for your wonderful world class hospitality. You are the best thing that happened during our stay in Shangri-la.  Unfortunately, for the rooms, it was abit dusty and old. The wardrobe almost fell apart and we had to get the repair man in. The jacuzzi wasnt working well as well. I feel the staffs of…

High standard rooms as usual. Location not as ideal for business travellers but fairly convenient for high street shoppers, especially not always easy to get taxi in Singapore. Breakfast quality fairly disappointing in terms of quality.

Top notch hotel with great grounds close to the CBD.  Really enjoyed my stay at the Shangri-La during a business conference.  Breakfast was great and enjoyed a few hours around the pool.  Rooms were of a high standard.  Highly recommended.

We booked our stay with Shangri-La  back in April; 4 months in advance of our actual stay, with confirmations of interconnecting rooms plus and 2pm Late Checkout (possibly 4pm).  Everything started really well, with a warm welcome at the airport, through the swift in-room check-in and the waiting birthday cake from the pastry team for my wife's upcoming birthday.  At breakfast, whilst the choice was great, most buffet items which should have been hot on both days were not hot. At most they were warm. Having just spent a week at a JW Marriott property in Thailand where food was always hot thanks to the use hot plates / burners and the constant supply of freshly made items.  On check-in we were moved to a one bed suite plus an interconnecting room; it later came to light that this…

We arranged the theme room for our lay over on way to Sydney. 2 night stay.  Upon arrival at the Airport the driver was waiting and everything was on route to be a great stay, until the car showed up. I did pre book a 7 seater because we had lots of luggage, the Mercedes S class just wasn't big enough so we ended up 4 people in the back and 1 suitcase on the front seat.  Once at hotel we where great by a very friendly staff member who made everything smooth and relaxed, check in was in the room which was very handy.  The kids loved the Theme room with the treehouse, very well made and lots of good details.   Before we arrived we got an email asking about our kids,  tells us a little about your kids so we can make there stay as awesome as possible. that was a nice touch, but on…

This hotel has very friendly staff and modern decoration, although it's family rooms seem smaller compared to other places I've stayed. It was a lovely experience with nice clean rooms. The only let down was that they couldn't locate my email about connecting rooms even though I had sent it a few days earlier.

Very nice hotel. One of my favorite especially their ambient and interior, while remaining their usual oriental, they added the simplicity yet modern concepts. Room is big and clean with common utility and toiletries. Friendly receptionist and porter.

What a great few days we had here whilst on honeymoon! You enter into the wonderful large lobby and greeted by the fanatic friendly staff. The room was spacious with a brilliant bathroom. Breakfast was excellent too with food from all over the world on offer in the huge buffet dining area. A 10 minute walk from the MRT (underground) which was ideal for getting around. Thank you Shangri La for making our stay perfect!

So many Shangri La, so little time.  I have been to almost 25 Shangri La in the world and this one does not disappoint.  Great location of course Standard Shangri La amenities  Of course, the scent of Shangri La takes you away

Review title: Bud by Shangri-La review - nice playground, pity about the service
Review: I took my 1 year old baby to play in Buds last Monday 20th August and I was disappointed by the quality of service provided by the staff there. As a regular visitor to the Shangri-La hotel in Singapore, I am accustomed to the excellent service standards provided elsewhere in the hotel and the service in Buds is far from that.  There were a couple of service mishaps where we asked the lady at reception how to get to the outdoor play area and instead of giving us directions she asked us to wait whilst she finished doing something on her computer. She then forgot about us and when I approached her again she asked another reception staff to take us there but instead we were just given a brief description on how to get there. The first lady could have told us that herself instead of…

This is the third time I was staying at the Shangri-La hotel in Singapore.  All the three times, I was part of a meeting that is organised in the hotel itself.  Each time, I have enjoyed their courteous service, their fabulous buffet breakfast and other meals.  It is a perfect location if you are interested in shopping and also plenty of local food to try on if you walk a short distance.  I love their room with terrific view and the sense of space is great.  Overall, a great experience.

To begin with check in was like breeze and smooth also the child friendly floor is one of the best in the world I have experienced. They really have done it up well and with amenities and the room is also properly planned . The breakfast is elaborate . The pool is nice and the hotel lobby is spacious also the staff are very good .

The Shangri-La never fails to please. Excellent rooms in the garden wing, would be hard to improve on service. Spotlessly clean and efficient. Staff anticipated our needs and remembered our preferences. Can’t think of better service anywhere in Singapore.

Seriously amazing hotel. The staff are so lovely and friendly. Beautiful setting great location. Breakfasts are amazing and fab restaurants and facilities. Our room was perfect and we loved the garden wing. Thank you for the lovely chocolates, card and bottle shiraz for our honeymoon.so nice to have the picture too in a frame thank you. We had an excellent stay and it is the best hotel we have been to. Loved singapore and already been saying when we can desperate to come back and stay here again! Thank you for making the last few days of our honeymoon so amazing.

At last, a hotel that delivers its promises. We have just spent 5 nights here and we were blown away. We stayed in a Deluxe Suite in the Valley Wing (pay the extra to stay in this Wing, you will not be disappointed). From the time you step out of the At last a hotel that delivers its promises. We have just spent 5 nights here and we were blown away. We stayed in a Deluxe Suite in the Valley Wing (pay the extra to stay in this Wing, you will not be disappointed). From the time you step out of the car at your own Valley Wing  reception you are swept up by the Valley Wing Family. Check-in is carried out in your Suite by the fabulous and most experienced Reservations staff. Breakfast is al a carte and included in the room and served in the Summit Room under the watchful and…

Fabulous hotel!  Amazing breakfast which we took everyday in the Waterfall restaurant to avoid the crowds in The Line. Great service and great accommodation. We enjoyed good food at the Waterfall and the Lobby lounge in the evenings too. My only critisism would be the pricey food and drinks but it is Singapore and it is a 5 star hotel!

Stayed a full week for work in the beautifully refurbished Tower Wing - make sure you get a room in this area of the hotel.  Service stunning, and the Horizon Club worth the extra $$ for access.  Didn't use the pool, but really appreciated the excellent gym which is rare these days in resorts.

Pros: Recently renovated ( not full-on) tower rooms.( But one of the smaller rooms I've experienced in Singapore and I was in a club access room) Clean , well maintained. Old style large lobby ( variable service on checkin, some got welcome attention/drinks, some not) Pool was great for the kids ( but no kids specific amenities like slides) Saw a decent looking Kids club ( not utilized) Good buffet ( some 'themed' nights better than others) Buffett breakfast also pretty solid. Good executive lounge. Unable to comment on the food/Beverage quality too much as didn't spend much time there. However afternoon tea time scones were excellent as well as other offerings during the one time we were there.  Cons Some mentioned above. Bit 'out-of-way' from shopping/metro so lose some…

My husband and I spent 4 nights in a city view room in the Gardem Wing. Check in was friendly and easy. The hotel was beautiful. Our room was so comfortable, spacious and quiet. Staff were always attentive, friendly and knowledgeable. A nice touch was when on my birthday evening I was greeted by a staff member who brought me a beautifully packaged mini cake with a signed card ! Wow, what attention to detail - we never mentioned my birthday. Very touching. The restaurants and pool facilities were excellent. Easy distance to Orchard Rd and easy to get taxis anywhere. We have a membership with Shangri la based on this stay and want to try their hotels around the world as our first choice. Thanks for a wonderful time.

We had a fantastic stay in the garden wing of the Shangri La.  The rooms are lovely  and the swimming pool and gardens are beautiful .  My children really appreciated the amazing breakfasts especially the donuts. There are a couple of people who deserve a special mention including the lovely lady who makes the eggs at breakfast.  She always has a smile whilst cooking delicious dishes for a number of people at once.  The other person who made a special effort is the lady who took the room service orders who remembered the not only the names of my children but also what combinations of food they ordered!  We have stayed at this hotel on a number of occasions over the years and it is now becoming a much more family friendly hotel which we appreciate.

Great facilities  and staff but a lot of issues for a premium priced stay (US$500 per night). Wrong room type, wrong room service food delivered, etc, etc. BUT the BIGGEST issue by far for me was safety. The swimming pool is beautiful and has a kids section. There's a largeadult pool and a small deep pool (2.5 m). This dep pool has no fence or safety around the edge and the path around it is VERY narrrow. If a child fell in and paniced, a  rescue would be very hard given depth. My son is 5 and cannot swim. He nearly fell in when walking past this pool and I saw that the only lofeguard was 30 m away on the other side of the pool, not at the lifeguard post near the deep pool.  This is simply a tragedy waiting to happen. Particularly with parents these dyas distracted by cell…

We recently stayed for 12 nights in the Garden Wing of this vast Hotel. Having previously stayed in the Tower wing, a few years back we wanted the use of a balcony this time, & the Garden Wing offers this.  We were welcomed warmly, and taken to our room where we were checked in.  The room was of ample size, well laid out and spacious enough to allow for the extra bed needed for our child. The balcony faced the city, with a pleasant enough view.  Whilst the room was comfortable, it showed signs of age, with too many chipped wood items and just a general feeling of tiredness. This was not helped by the inadequate housekeeping. Often we had no hand towels at all, and the room was barley cleaned. After a long day out, we came back to find the room not cleaned,& then had to request…

We travelled to Singapore with our three children and had an amazing stay at the Shangri-La. We opted for a family themed room and upon check in were given the space themed room. The kids were blown away as were we! The room was spacious and had a separate room for the kids with a space ship bunk bed that doubled as a play area for them, there was also a little secret tunnel connecting the rooms. The kids had their own ensuite with a kids size toilet and a large bath. They also had their own tv and mini desk with pencils and paper...did I mention the cute mini robes and slippers? Our section of the suite was large with a nice seating area looking out over the pool and the city skyline and a large fridge to keep food and drinks if needed. The service here was exceptional and up…

Review title: Valley Wing - Genuinely welcomed and duly served.
Review: 32 years ago I spent my honeymoon in a very special hotel in the English lake district. The Lodore Swiss Hotel owned and run by a Swiss family called England. The place oozed quality and professionalism and somewhere I would be happy to return to, my first Shangri-la!.  A lasting impression of 'Service' was embedded in me from that point.  Fast forward to August 2018 and the arrival at the Valley Wing of the Shangri-la Hotel Singapore. Following a short hop down from Bangkok (Shangri-la Krungthep Wing) we arrived for a 2 night stay before our return to the UK.   No sooner had we got out of the taxi we were greeted by the resplendently attired doorman eager to take the luggage before showing us into the entrance lobby, the cool lobby a real contrast to the heat of the outside. …

Shangri-la Singapore is special in it's landscaping, location and sheer size. It also has a fabulous pool. However, the breakfast at Line was slightly underwhelming (Shangri-la Yangon's breakfast is at least twice as interesting and scrumptious), staff friendliness can ostensibly vary (the lifeguard was grumpy), and they made a mistake with our reservation dates. Overall, just by virtue of size, location and landscaping (it's like a resort smack in the center of Singapore), it gets a 4-star rating.

Review title: EXTREMELY GOOD SERVICE, ESPECIALLY IN THE HORIZON LOUNGE CLUB
Review: Very good hotel, nice rooms, and extremely good service at the horizon lounge club. Breakfast and afternoon breaks are amazing, with such a good quality of food, snacks and good wines. Very good place to visit Singapore.

Review title: we were staying in the garden wing - fantastic
Review: this is one of the good hotels in singapore... very good views from our garden wing - suite-type, --- the service is good, centrally located on Orchard grove road... all staff members were good - but a middle-aged person -peter from the lobby was very nice- he should be promoted for his proactive guest relations-

Review title: Excellent Dinner at Diner de Fleurs
Review: We had a excellent 8 course dinner for 2 prepared by chef Ganesan. The setting was excellent, providing privacy with the occasional sounds of laughter from the pool in the distance. We especially enjoyed the ginger infused buttermilk shooter which was very refreshing; also a very well balanced salmon starter with yuzu and pomegranate, which had great textures. Would highly recommend this experience to all.

Review title: Amazing!!! From check in to check out
Review: Photos truely don't do justice for how beautiful this resort is.  Staff are attentive to all your needs, very welcoming and helpful especially with my many questions being 1st trip here.  So close to shops and hustle of the city.  Kids club is over and above any expectations my child loves baking and they had chef classes for children under 12.  Separate family dining area for breakfast.  Children are at the heart.    We stayed in the gardens rooms very large rooms as the tower wing was sold out free rollaway was placed in the room for us as well.  3 restaurants to dine at for breakfast from quiet intimate dining to busy buffets.  Will be back for a visit I am totally in love with this place!

Had a short staycation over a public holiday and despite it being just a 1 night stay, it was fun and memorable. The kids had fun at the indoor playground Buds although we had to pay extra $28 per kid for 3 hours of playtime. They wanted to come back again the following week!  Convenient location for shopping along Orchard Road and lovely restaurants to try as well. The buffet breakfast had a vast spread and was delicious. On the night we were there, the buffet dinner included tropical fruits like durian, mangosteen etc which was a delightful surprise.  All in all, a lovely getaway for the family!

Review title: Good hotel but with some issues
Review: The positives are it’s a Shangri-La so good service, comfortable rooms and lovely ambience are normally assured and we weren’t disappointed. We were on honeymoon too and the staff went to great lengths to note the occasion and which we really appreciated.  However, on this 5 day stay we had 3 issues which ultimately prevent a high rating, see below.   1. You now have to make your own cocktails in the Horizon Club! I’m not a cocktail expert so I would have wasted many drinks in trying to get the mix right and therefore didn’t attempt. I was ok with self pour wines and spirits but I was disappointed with the cocktail service omission which we’ve greatly enjoyed before and it spoilt for us what was overall a nice club experience. 2. The hotel has made major investments in providing…

We stayed in the Valley Wing for 12 nights with our children ages 1 and 7.   We loved our room which was spacious and elegant in style, the bathroom was huge and the kids loved the TV in the bath.   We enjoyed having access to the lobby lounge all day it was a lovely place to have a coffee or a glass of champagne.  We were conscious that it was quite quiet and not really ideal with a noisy baby so we opted to have breakfast in the Horizon Club on a few occasions which also worked well, but I personally preferred the breakfast in the summit room which was really nice .   We were made to feel welcome with the children but we were conscious that most people staying there weren’t looking for noisy children to ruin the ambience so we made sure we moved somewhere more appropriate if…

Review title: Lovely Hotel, an Oasis in the Busy City
Review: A wonderful in city sanctuary hotel. Like all luxury hotels in this part of Asia, service is first class, facilities are amazing, and rooms are very nice and chock full of amenities. This property is on par with hotels 3x to 5x the price in the USA or Europe. The dinning is particularly good with a vast selection of foods for every nationality. The only down side of this and other hotels of the same caliber in Singapore, such as the Four Seasons and The Regent, is that good and drinks are very very highly priced. Other than that you can’t go wrong. A great place to stay on business travel. And, a wonderful place to stay with the family while entourage to other Asia destinations.

Review title: Fantastic hotel, go for the Garden or Valley Wing
Review: I stayed at the Valley wing which is an even more luxurious "hotel in the hotel". The service is just perfect, starting from front desk to housekeeping to the butlers in the lobby that serve complimentary drinks and snacks. Definitely my hotel in Singapore.

So this is the third time my family and I have visited this Shangri-La, and it was a delight once again. To begin with, the setting, the property, and the grounds are well kept and dreamily tropical. The balconies spilling over with bougainvillea add a lush feel and the garden rooms (where we stayed again, in a suite) are perfectly decorated with gorgeous hardwood floors and gleaming granite and wood bathrooms. Exceptional amenities and a new kids’ club (immediately proclaimed by both my boys to be The Best Ever!) made our brief stay as wonderful as it could be. Do not go without experiencing the breakfast buffet—representing many varied dishes (Japanese, Chinese, Indian, western), it is a brilliant way to try food beyond of your usual tastes, whatever they may be. I recommend…

This is only a review for the online reservation. I tried to reserve a suite at this hotel on their proprietary online system. There were multiple rooms available at multiple price points. When I filled in all the reservation information it said I needed to call the hotel to book. I called, was placed on hold for a while, and then told there were actually no suites available. As I needed a suite I will stay somewhere else. There is no reason the online system should be so inaccurate- and then waste my time not only going through the system, but having to call and be placed on hold, only to find no rooms available. Although I have stayed here before and it is obviously an excellent hotel, they should avoid the appearance of a "bait and switch" tactic, as this online reservation…

Review title: So good I want to live here
Review: We stayed 3 nights in the Valley Wing. Wow. It was fantastic, the staff were exceptional, friendly, very professional and made the start of our holiday wonderful. We booked a limo from the hotel to pick us up and it made such a difference, get through security into the car and then comfort. The breakfast in the summit room was fabulous, service excellent and the food fantastic. Afternoon tea in the lobby wonderful, we typically went out walking and exploring in the morning so to come back and have lovely tea and cakes was great. Sometimes in life you have to treat yourself to something special, this was it for us and it was better than we ever imagined. We will be coming back.

Our second short stay holiday at the Shangri La in recent months. Enjoyed it so much the first time we went back for more. Quality of property, excellent swimming pool and surrounding gardens plus friendly and efficient staff all go without saying. This is away from hustle and bustle of Orchard Rd but close enough for a 10 minute walk to be amongst the action. Not the cheapest hotel in town so if you are on a budget it may not be for everyone but feels as though you are at a resort rather than in a busy city. Special thanks to management team member Riccardo , he is on top of his game. Try Garden Room with pool view.

This is our second stay at the Shangri-la Singapore. We were greeted by friendly staff Jacky at check in, and was upgraded to family suite due to no availability for connecting rooms. The wow factor continues as we came back the next day with a surprise birthday cake awaiting in the room. This made my mom’s day!   The only con is that the hotel is not located right at orchard or mrt. And we had to grab a taxi to look for local eateries.

we arrived very late 1am the young guy was so helpful when we arrived i had a few queastions about trips and he went out of his way to find out even going to the local bus stop to make sure he had given me the correct information, all the staff were wonderful so polite and nothing was too much trouble , i had been wiery of staying here as we stayed in the sydney one and had a very bad experience there , i am so glad i never changed hotels as that was what i was decideding to do, i will definatly stay here again, a big thankyou to all the staff who i had managed to meet

Location near to Orchard Road so handy for shops.  Service good, especially concierge.  A little slow around the pool area when ordering drinks.  Food good, huge breakfast buffet, omelettes/poached eggs especially good.  Rooms good although had more of a business hotel feel about them.  We are a family of 5 and had interconnecting rooms which was great.  Beds were really, really comfy!

I’m writing this review after staying here for 9 nights. The hotel itself is newly renovated, and looks great. The staff is also very service minded and helpful. But this is a resort for families with kids. And this is not something that they promote as clearly as they should. We are staying in a Horizon Club room, with access to the lounge. It should be called the kindergarden lounge. Screaming kids, kids running around. They have a generous period of three hours where you get canapés, wine/beer/cocktails etc. But it is not an environment to enjoy it.   I love the Horizon Club concept. In Dubai it was for adults, table service, etc. Here it is self service, while surrounded with kids. For me, it is not a concept when the difference is that big between two hotels.   I love kids,…

Review title: A resort in the City to treasure
Review: You leave the hustle and bustle of the City in this gorgeous property spread over a vast area with excellent lawns and a large lively swimming pool area. The service is very efficient, Asian hospitality. Good choice of restaurants. The waterfall and thè swimming pool bar I liked. Stayed in the spacious one bedroom apartment that's surrounded with plants. Excellent interiors.

We had a wonderful stay at the Shangrila Hotel. Amazing food options, very friendly staff and very helpful friendly people in Singapore. Peter from the lobby was very helpful always tending to our needs  Would definetly recommend.

Loved my room and service at the the Shangri La. From check in to check out this was first rate service and attention. I liked the hotel and facilities but the breakfast buffet was a bit manic! Overall a great option for staying in Singapore.

superb customer service coupled with well thought out facilities inside the room and around the compound...relatively decently near to ochard road...a good place to unwind once back for full of headaches business dealinga

Can’t find much family friendly hotels in Singapore but choose this. Very affordable pricing for a luxury hotel and wonderful kids friendly facilities. Could be better if kids amenities are provided like most Japanese hotels.

Review title: Great buffet experience at The Line!
Review: Very lovely staff who took care of my family very well! I had a special request to put candles on a durian (they have a durian feast special) for my dad’s birthday and they happily complied! Made my dad’s day!  Thank you Abby and the shifu at the durian stall!

What can I say about the Shangri-la Singapore and more importantly its staff that will do it justice? We have been coming to this hotel and particularly the Valley Wing for several years now and the service is second to none. There is nothing that is too difficult to arrange and the service we receive keeps us coming back.   While my husband and I come to Singapore for business regularly, this was a family trip including our sons 8th birthday. To say the staff went above and beyond is an understatement. There were balloons and a cake in our room on arrival, he had another special lunch arranged for him with another cake and then another celebration on his actual birthday. To say this was his best birthday ever would be right on the mark!   This was the first time that the…

The best hotel ever visited . Staff on top form know you by name, everyone so friendly and go above and beyond what is expected . Spoilt me rotten for my birthday . We were in valley wing breakfast was amazing . Bathroom was l’occitane and replenished daily. Well done everyone

Though is not in downtown it is a great hotel to stay if you are in Singapore for a business trip. Great facilities, gym and outside pool and gardens are a great place to relax/wind down after a business day

Upon arrival we were stunned with how grand the main lobby looked. It was just absolutely breath taking. We had booked a few nights in the garden wing and it did not disappoint. Check-in was a breeze and extremely fast.   The only issue was that the rooms in the Garden were a bit run-down. But I guess that's fairly expected from a building that was built in the 70s. The big plus was that the size of the rooms were fairly big for their price point.   Another thing I must mention and give credit for is the gym. The gym at Shangri-La Singapore has to be definitely one of the best gyms I have seen in a hotel. It had everything you needed from a squat rack, smith machine, dumbbells up to 40kg, and an assortment of machines and cardio equipment. The changing areas were extremely well…

We had a two night stay here. We arrived in the afternoon but we were told our room would not be ready yet, which was disappointing after it was after check-in time and we had a scheduled appointment. However, this was rectified by the hotel giving us a ‘better’ room and also gave us free drinks for our family at the bar.  We were given a room in the garden wing, which had a balcony outside the room that overlooked the street. Our room was a decent size, large enough to fit a single sofa bed for children. There was sufficient storage space; the usual kettle; an espresso machine and TV.  The bathroom was large enough with separate shower and bath tub. There are plenty of toiletries, although we had to request extra bath towel for the whole family.  We had breakfast at a nice…

One of the best hotels i have ever stayed in. Room, breakfast, staffs, etc all were really nice. Bathroom used to stuffed with all necessary items, even comb. The only problem I had to face was I could not go to my friend's room in different floor as my room card would not work in lift to go to my friend's floor.

Our family had another great stay at the Shangri-La recently on our way back from Europe.  The service and quality of the rooms and dining experience is exceptional.  We always feel like returning family members when welcomed by staff and that's why we keep coming back. After checking out early for our flight we arrived at the airport to find our flight had been oversold and we needed to stay another night.  A quick call to teh Shangr-La and we were back in the same rooms within the hour.  What would have been too much hassles for most hotels was handled with no fuss at all.  Thanks to all who looked after us during our stay and looking forward to seeing you again soon.

Review title: Massive  swimming pool and landscaped gardens.
Review: In Nov 2017 I stayed in the Valley Wing in a magnificently furnished large room overlooking the pool and gardens.The checkin occurred in the room. This  package included free champagne and high tea. I was most impressed with the breakfast service and staff attentiveness throughout the stay. The jazz in the foyer of the tower wing was a bonus as was the great selection of eating places within the hotel. The Line Restaurant was my favourite ( you will need to book as its very popular)

Staying at the Shangri-La was awesome.  The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. I stayed in the Valley Wing of the hotel.  The rooms were awesome.  What I liked about this wing is that if you are traveling with a couple, you are able to get the side by side rooms with a private door for that area. I really loved the Waterfall restaurant.  It is an italian restaurant, and the price  is right.  From the concierge staff to the house cleaners, the service was beyond great.  I would definitely stay here again.

Booked a few nights in the Valley Wing and was very happy with the exceptional service, great suite, beautiful property and gourmet breakfast! Best deal in Singapore! Booked via Expedia which offered a surprising discount.

The Valley wing was absolutely fabulous.  From the  moment  we checked in you were treated liked a valued customer even though we hadn't been there before.  We had a deluxe room and it really was.  Lovely king size bed, huge bathroom with french toiletries and fluffy towels! There was a fruit bowl, which was checked and refilled everyday, a nespresso machine and wedgwood china. The room was kept spotless by our great housekeeper. In the lobby lounge all the drinks and tea and coffee are complimentary. We enjoyed a glass of French champagne after a hard day of sight seeing(or maybe two). The breakfast in the mornings in the Summit room were delicious and you could not find fault with it even if you tried! All in all one of the best experiences we have had and will certainly be…

Review title: What a pleasure to return to the Valley Wing
Review: One of my favourite spots. Immaculate service, a heaven of piece where you are treated with care and courtesy. I love it.  I miss the old blue bar at the top though... I had a business lunch at the Japanese restaurant and this was rather disappointing.

Looovvveeee the room! We booked a tower wing deluxe room and it was facing the pool. The room is big and they had a pull out sofa for our 7 year old girl to sleep on. The bed is so comfy and my girl enjoyed bathing in the big bathtub. The best thing is they also have a indoor play area where parents can leave their children and it’s safe cos they have people looking out for the children. Although I would suggest it’s safest for children aged 7-12 years old. The breakfast also has wide range of selections from local flavours.

Was here for boyfriend’s birthday surprise. They were having the Durian Buffet Party. Suprised with how great their services were namely OM Zubidah, Mirko, Uma, Sayra and Victor! Thank you for the excellent hospitality. The spread were vast and palatable. The durian buffet was really awesome. Thanks guys for making the day a memorable one! Good job guys!

I stayed in this hotel for 3 night during my business trip in May. Infact I felt quite comfortable and got nice experiences during my stay here. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful. No problem occurred until now: They asked me and charged to my bank card a deposit amount of 600S$ when I checked in and promised to return it to me after check-out. However now it’s August and I don’t know where my deposit is. I know the standard term to refund is about 20-25 days so I waited patiently without disturbing them but there was no notice from them. In the of June I started to contact them about my isue. After exchanging email about 10-15 times, it’s still not resolved till now and they continue asking me to wait. I have doubts if they really keep their promises...

Awesome team hospitality  ANNIE  ALLIE  YASSA  SITI  And not forgotten the Legend Mr Kannan VJ !!! To all the tourist  out there who love to have all singaporean cuisine and street food, you guys can get the feel right here at the one and only shangrila hotel lobby bar!!!!  With Regards  Shanky Guru 28 hongkong street

What a stunning hotel! Having previously worked for a couple of prestigious hotel chains I’m not easy to impress, but I was.    The reception staff were attentive to the fact that we had a long flight and allowed us to check in early despite the hotel being fully booked the previous night.  Our room was clean, the bedding was very good quality which makes such a difference when your a weary traveler.  The complimentary bottles of water were also a nice touch.  We didn’t have cause to interact with the staff as we had everything we needed but on two occasions the two members of the concierge team (Arif and Ono) gave advice that not only saved us money but ensured that we made the most of our time in Singapore.  The hotel runs an efficient shuttle service to one of its sister…

Stayed here with my wife. We were looking forward to a peaceful and relaxing vacation until we needed to wait for room till 16:30. Rooms was not ready on check in time and we waited in the lobby with some customers which has the same late check in experience.  Asked for late check out time as compensation for late check in but was outright rejected.  Forget about turn down service, they didn't manage to refresh our room by 16:00. We called to refresh the room and went to the pool. When we came back, the room was not cleaned yet, fed up we asked for clean fresh towels.   Next day, we called to clean the room as we went for early breakfast. Was not informed housekeeping start work at 08:30 and the room was not clean yet when we came back from breakfast.   For the price we pay,…

Breakfast abd food are Amazing! I tried also the Italian restaurant. Food very good, the manager amazing but services very far at all.  In the swimming pool hard to find someone of the staff that speak English! I am allergic to the nuts, I mentioned many time but not one understand.  Room are not clean properly,also one day they forget to refresh. ..

I would say The Shangri-la is one of the best hotel i had my staycation as a family in singapore. The overall check in and check out process is excellent. The rooms is big and bed was comfortable to sleep. Breakfast spreads are awesome.   The staffs are very attentive and provided great service. I would like to particularly name afew staffs.  Thank you Ms Nithya, Mr Swaran and Ms Jacky for all the great service offered to us and making our stay a memorbale one. All of you were forthcoming with your pleasant smiles and being so helpful during my stay at Shangri-la. The service is superb!  And also to Ms Rajes from the Buds thank you for the great service offered and welcoming my kids well in the Buds. My kids truly had a fun time in the buds and loved every bit of it.   We will…

An efficient check in , excellent service, nice room though at Town wing, the room amenities are good quality, the breakfast buffet is full of varieties. I really love Shangri-La, coz so far no matter Shangri-La in which country, I am happy with all the stays.

We stayed here for 3 days on the way back from Thailand Holiday. Great location, high standard of service in hotel staff and property. Enjoyed the pool and close proximity to shopping and Botanic Garden. Had a very memorable meal at the Southern Italian restaurant in the hotel and a superb authentic Cantonese meal at Shang Palace. The Southern Italian Waterfall Restaurant was the standout, although both very good. The Concierge was really helpful about suggesting things to do if you only had a short time to stay in Singapore.

Review title: Amazing Stay With Our Two Kids
Review: We stayed here for a special two nights after a few night prior at the Shangri-La apartments next door.  From the moment we entered the lobby we were treated wonderfully.  A member of staff came up to us to help us immediately and offered to arrange the transfer of our luggage from the apartments to the main hotel.  They gave my children each a cuddly squirrel toy which went down very well indeed! We were taken up to our Jungle themed family suite and my boys were mesmerized by it.  It should be noted however that it isn't a bunk bed as such - only one kid gets to sleep at the top and the other sleeps in a pull out trundle bed.  Thankfully my youngest didn't seem to mind but I can see how this would cause a fight between some kids.  It is incredibly well set up for families with…

Why do I call it a flawed diamond? Read on, to know more. We enjoyed our stay at this beautiful hotel located at Orange Grove road. All the staff from the doormen, reception, restaurant and housekeeping were courteous, cheerful and helpful.      We stayed at a suite in the Tower Wing of the hotel.     For the first two days we had breakfast at The Line restaurant. They had a sumptuous spread but unfortunately, on the second day, my husband found a sharp piece of porcelain in his omelette, because of a bowl that broke in the kitchen. We complained in writing and Ms. Rachel Lee, (director of rooms) apologised profusely and that was the only reason why we didn't take up the matter further.    It was otherwise a great experience. Room was comfortable with all the amenities you could…

Review title: 4 Nights at the Shang, better than ever
Review: We just checked in today, so only a limited review this time as I have not yet had the time to check out all the amenities the hotel has to offer. This is our 2nd time here, and the last one was a good 10 years ago. Im glad to see that they have not only maintained the Shang standard of service, but vastly improved the property. We stayed at the Tower Wing this time (last time was a Garden Suite) and the room is fantastic. Simple and elegant, with a king bed fit for 2 adults and a child. Our daughter though opted to sleep on the sofa bed by the bay window, since she loves the view so much, she says. The usual room amenities are present, with a really nice deep soaking tub, (hard to come by in Singapore nowadays) although they could probably provide better toiletries ( guys, even…

We stayed in this hotel for 2 nights before our trip on the Star Clipper to Bali. It was superb from the food and drink to the friendliness of staff. The room was large with a good sized bathroom, safe, coffee machine and bed was extremely comfortable.Lovely grounds to explore and  a good sized swimming pool.

Review title: Stop over from Italy to Sydney for 2 nights
Review: Stayed at the Shangri-La Hotel with the Horizon Club option, best decision was to use the Horizon club. The service was excellent, especially the breakfast and cocktails in the evening. Special thanks to  Amir who spent a lot of his time helping and making it fun for his us and all his guests.

On arrival greeted at the entrance by management one with a box of orchids, wisked straight up to our suite with no fuss and from there the super service continued throughout our stay.  Breakfast was without fault with a good range at the buffet (the most delicious yoghurt from Ireland) to the a la carte menu (which included soft boiled eggs with caviar, yum) Dominique and his staff were constantly attentive.  Everywhere you turned at this hotel there was someone waiting to assist you from the pool to the Horizon Club lounge.  Nora (Manager of the Vally Wing was a most charming helpful person always with a smile on her face and an answer to any question). After 5 nights here we didn’t want to leave.

Had a 2 night stay here and it was a nice Hotel, the room could of been better though, was a bit basic with not many amenities in there! Stayed in nicer rooms to be honest. Downstairs though is a different story, it is really nice and we fully enjoyed being well looked after, couldn’t fault the quality of the food either. Great hotel for a short stay!

Review title: Visited for our honeymoon - treated like royalty
Review: We had a wonderful stay at The Valley Wing on our honeymoon. The staff were all exceptional and treated us like royalty throughout our stay. When booking in the Valley Wing you also get access to a complimentary champagne bar - a great perk!

A great hotel, apparently the best in Singapore!  Compared to the service, prices are well affordablei do suggest to take the horizon option with the access to the great lounge there!  Since my last stay, some little details has charged. No more slippers or cold towels in the sauna... At the breakfast the hot beverage are now with automatic machines...   But still a great hotel!

Service was top notched from arrival to departure.Rooms are clean, spacious and beautifully renovated.Breakfast, lunch & dinner at The line is always amazing.This hotel is of high standard and you will never get disappointed with what you paid for. It was a lovely way of ending our 10 years stay in Singapore and would definitely stay in this hotel again.

Another return visit and stayed in Garden Wing room, room is spacious and offer resort feel in big city. In general, all were better than last visit from water pressure for shower to general cleanliness. However, hair dryer was so dusty inside and it seems that it never been cleaned. Wonder how clean, it will be when you on this hair dryer. The bathroom amenities like shower gel, shampoo are below standard when comparing with other hotels of same category.  For this particular visit, we were offered to have breakfast at Horizon Lounge. It is a wonderful venue and much more pleasant than The Line (too noisy and busy even with larger choices of food). The food at breakfast were of high quality, very good display and taste good. However, there were only 2 staff who did clearing and…

I love Shangri-La hotel as they offer one of the most luxurious rooms I know and the hotel breakfast is definitely one of the very best I enjoy too.  The hotel service is very prompt and efficient with amenities request especially I will like to thank the housekeeping department who does a very good job helping me on it.  Definitely recommend people and visitors who enjoy staying near the shopping district area(5-10 mins drive to Orchard Road)and yet enjoy a tranquil environment.  Simply one of the best hotels in Singapore!

Review title: 3.5 stars , Nice but has lots to improve
Review: Hello my dear readers  So during this trip in singapore , i went to check other bigger names of the hotel industry .  I went online and book 3 nights in shangri-la hotel , singapore  Price was not cheap but fair compare to same category hotels . In pictures hotel were very appealing as far as amenities  its offer . When arrived , you been welcomed by a guy wearing traditional clothes which is nice but not like their other resorts on the islands , having very warm welcome with traditional drums and dance . ( El Nido  Philippines) .  When step in , hotel art very impressive and i definitely like the design  .  What i did not like is how busy hotel is and few reps welcoming so many guests .  I stayed in club room so check in was suppose to be on their 24 floor but no one letting…

Exceptional rooms and an amazing set of facilities, particularly for families. Nice swimming pool with a dry and wet play area for kids. The Buds kids club is also fantastic for younger children.  Some slight negatives would be the aging wet area in the fitness centre. Nothing wrong with it all, includes a hot pool, sauna and steam room with extensive changing facilities. But it is starting to look a bit old and worn in places.  The other slight negative is that the hotel seemed very busy, and less personal to when we last visited. We were there about 8 years ago and things seemed more friendly and personal then, whereas we felt like we were just being processed in a very busy hotel on this occasion.  However, still a great place that I would return to.

This time I stayed in the Tower Wing. The rooms are rather small especially compared to the Garden Wing but they have seen a make over. Also, if you book the exec lounge it is better accessible. The rooms are equipped well, the bed is comfortable and the bathroom offers all necessary things. The lounge serves good breakfeast and evening cocktail and snacks. The gym is probably one of the best in Singapore. Certainly, there are cheaper hotels, but Shangri-La has a good value for money.

Review title: The hotel does have some good staff
Review: Hi must admit... this review would have been a lot lower if it were not for 2 staff; the doorman & assistant front of house manger the replied to my concerns.  My experiences at the Shanghai-La in Sydney have always been great, but the hotel in Singapore was terrible.  So why a 4 star “Very good” rating... because of the ... final two touch points from the hotel  were “Very Good”.  Let me explain, the doorman who was fetching our final taxi for us was the only person in the last two days that showed any empathy, he apologised provided great service  and made the whole family feel a little better, thank you.  The last touchpoint was from the response from a email complaint I followed up with citing all the issues.  This email  was also dealt with quickly and sincerely and I thank…

We’ve stayed at the Shangri La before but this is the first time we stay on the 9th floor of the new wing. The 9th floor is specifically for family’s. The adjoining room for the children is great, they have everything you need including washing machine and dryer in a specialised pantry. The hotel is super kid friendly, they have a massive indoor play area in the basement and it’s free if you stay on the 9th floor. They also have a great outdoor water play area.

The Shangri-la is best hotel in the city. The check in and check out process is good the rooms is big and bed was comfortable to sleep.  Breakfast spreads are awesome  The staff is very attentive  I truly come again  Thank you Shangri-la for a greatest experience

Review title: Probably the best hotel experience I have ever had - thanks to the staff
Review: My wife and I and 2 of our children stayed in the Valley Wing of the Shangri-La. The rooms of course were lovely and spacious but the thing that made this so really special was the staff. The level of service was exceptional by all. But it is more than that. The friendliness and care that was displayed was amazing and by the end I was wanting to plan another trip to Singapore so I can stay at this hotel and see everyone again!!!  The Valley Wing is a throw back to a different era of travel and a wonderful one. Don't stay anywhere else in this city.

This place has everything! The staff are always on high alert, and they have thought of everything. We stayed in Garden Wing - huge rooms, and Tower Wing - smaller rooms but great design. We were late booking and they told us we’d have to move rooms, which was fine by us. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay, and wish we could stay longer! We took the room only package, but the breakfast buffet looked awesome! The pool is extensive, and has life guards on duty all day. There seem to be plenty of beds and towels! The lobby bar is relaxed, with live music! We couldn’t find anything to fault anywhere.

Great hotel with tasteful bigger than average rooms and first class service all the way from the minute you step down on the red carpet that greets you at the entrance and throughout your stay. Try the buffet at the Line restaurant- great variety of international cuisine. If one was to nit pick I would point out that the location while central getting to the nearest shop is a 10 to 15 minutes walk

Review title: A good looking hotel in lush gardens, with a pricey tarrif.
Review: We stayed at the hotel for four days and found it a very convenient stopping off place.  The staff are universally very friendly and helpful and the hotel looks great and has lush gardens and a nice pool area.  The bedrooms are also nice (but our bed was as hard as a slab of Aberdeen granite). The main restaurant ("The Line") has a massive breakfast menu reflecting the cultural diversity of the country.  You can dine buffet-style in Malay, Chinese, Indian or western, and everything is tasty.  But beware - when they say breakfast is served until 10:30, that means if you turn up at 10:25 everything has been removed bar a piece of toast! In the evening they serve a variety of dining fares that can be as much as $98 / head. You can take taxis to and from Chinatown, eat there for…

Amazing amenities. However we got frustrated upon check in. There was along line in the front desk. We waited for our turn for 30 minutes. And when it was my turn to check in, they said that we still have to wait because the rooms were not yet ready.  They said it politely but was quire dissapointed because it was already 4 pm. We Waited again for 30 more minutes.  When i requested for a late check out (just an additional 1 hour) to compensate their late checkin i was declined. I asked again and they refused again. For the 5th time or 6th time they said yes but only 30 minutes extenson.

Have been staying in this wonderful establishment for many years & hard to fault in any respect . Feels like you are staying with family —-impeccable service , exquisite quality , large spacious rooms & the best garden setting in Singapore , All international standard amenities & service .Hard to beat !

This is second time in few month I have stayed in Shangri-la and my experience was not so great like last time. Last time I awarded to 5* now I cannot get on that level. Maybe is a singulare experience but... I have stayed 3 nights including the weekend. Hotel is great and location is perfect but this time service was not at level expected for price you pay for. At check in I waited about half hour to reach the desk. Seems some events, wedding were in place so very busy period. But only 2 desk open out of 4. Then I was inform that I have to wait for my room even was afternoon time. Not exactly time was given. I wait about one hour and a half. Nothing happen. I was start talking at reception and when I have asked for manager I got the key. I was not happy as I observed that other…

Superb hotel with lots of activities for our little champs.... Delicious buffet Need atleast 2 days to explore hotel. Best scenery view and nice place to capture good memories. Helpful staff. 10/10 gr8

Stayed for three nights on business. All very good. Made use of the gym which was quite spacious. Breakfast there was a lot of choice/ok, coffee machine was great I had the buffet dinner one night and managed to try several dishes. Staff were awesome and seemed liked they really cared/high level of service. Lobby was nicely decorated . Did not use the lobby bar but looked good. I did use the pool and had a wander around the gardens. I would go back.

Writing this review sitting in Shangrila hotel bed. Hotel seems to be largely catering to tours, events and families. It's a large family oriented Hotel on prime orchard road. Hotel is luxurious, thoughtful, with a decent mix of dated n modern flavour. Rooms are ok , with a separate nice view of the pool or the skyline. Breakfast was crowded and extremely busy during weekends may be. Good variety of food from different cuisine. My only negative is staff. They don't communicate clearly, don't wish you. Very very business like attitude. Could be more personal which gives a nice touch.

Review title: Wonderful first stay at the Shangri-la
Review: We booked a couple of rooms at the tower wing for a birthday celebration and was completely blown away by the level of hospitality and service provided. I liaised with Ms Foo via email, who was ever so prompt at replying and helped to arrange for the reservation. Alex at the front desk during check in must be mentioned as well. She gave us such a warm welcome and was so personable.   We had 2 tower deluxe rooms, 1 family deluxe room and 1 junior suite. The family deluxe room came with a little daybed by the window which the kids adore and love sitting at to admire the view outside. It was really comfortable too. Although they were initially disappointed that it didn't come with a bathtub (I was secretly relieved as that means I won't have to spend so much time preparing a bubble…

Hotel is located in a quiet and high-end residential area which is a 5-min walk from the main fanfare of Orchard Road. And it's very centrally located so you feel like you are right in the middle of town.   Hotel is perfect for families with almost an entire level dedicated to children, with a huge playroom facilities, complete with regularly held baking class - note even for hotel guests you have to pay to use the playroom and of course weekend baking class and on weekends you will be competing with what looks like many resident families who have come to use the facilities, so it does get busy. The hotel also has a great free-form pool and a water park and playground for children, which my 3-year old enjoyed greatly.   We stayed at the Tower Wing and the rooms are just…

We stayed at the Shangri-La hotel for seven nights on our first holiday to Singapore. It was very nice, modern hotel with excellent facilities. It was a gentle 10 minute stroll to Orchard Road and around 15 minutes by taxi to get to the marina area, so was a very handy base from which to explore the city. I would certainly recommend a stay there.

Review title: I want to Live in The Valley Wing
Review: What can you say exceptional from start to finish.   We stayed in The Valley wing and where you can choose complimentary Veuve Cliquot Champagne and a selection of extremely good wines all within your Room price. Couple this with afternoon tea and evening Hor‘s D’ouevres and it’s a winning combination.   Staff are excellent and go out of their way to help 10/10.  This was our second visit and will be our first port of call for futures stays in Singapore.

Charming lively helpful staff extremely accommodating of an unwell traveller. Would find it hard to stay elsewhere on basis of our last experiences.  Comfortable rooms, good breakfast. Attentive to all ages. Have stayed in different categories and all appealing in own way.

Review title: Truly 5 Star hotel, excellent service and location
Review: Celebrated my birthday by staying at the shangrila orange grove.  What a beautiful grand and elegant hotel.  Top class service.  We arrived very early and upgraded to the garden wing with pool views.  What a beautiful large room with sitting area and balcony.  From reception staff to room staff everyone was so polite.  Nespresso coffee in room was excellent and the pineapple tarts treat was yum.  Our 3 year old received a soft toy squirrel as we checked in which was such a sweet touch.  The pool was excellent clean and tidy.  Raymond the pool attendant was a joy.  Having worked here for forty years he was still smiling which means a lot.  When people left the pool he removed towels which meant no hogging of pool chairs and the area looked top class.  Great employee.  All good…

The device at the Shangri-la is first class and the amenities match that. My only issue was the breakfast arrangements,although there is an excellent choice of food the area is like eating in a airport, too noisy with children running about. There is always a que for coffee as the machines are constantly breaking down.overall it's a really good place to stay.

Just spectacular. 4 amazing nights staying in this hotel in a wonderful country. Where to start. Picked up at the airport by the hotel limo. On arrival at the hotel offered a drink and a relax in the champagne bar before being escorted to our luxury room.  Every staff member we came across were wonderful. Especially Khyria (hope spelling is correct) in the champagne bar who looked after us exceptionally, especially when we returned tired from our excursions. Had breakfast in the Summit Room and the Line bar. Both superb but very different. Summit Room more formal and private. Line bar is a help yourself buffet with tremendous variety. Swimming pool area is superb. Great to have a swim and relax with a book able to have a drink from the poolside bar. Had dinner one night at the…

Arrived late evening after flight from Borneo. Had booked a room in the horizon club. Lovely surprise when booking in as we was upgraded to a tower wing room. Used the horizon club for breakfast afternoon tea and the cocktail hour. Lovely to relax after day sightseeing in very hot and humid conditions. As in all Shangri la hotels we have stayed in staff  lovely and helpful. Would definitely stay here again wish had stayed longer than 3 nights as so much to see and do or relax round the fantastic pool and well kept gardens.  Many thanks to all staff at all 3 Shangri la hotels we stayed.  Amazing.

Review title: Excellent Staycation at Shangri-lah Garden Wing
Review: Wonderful choice for tourist, traveller or even anyone on staycation. We bought a promotion package and had an enjoable time at Shangri-lah Hotel. Located at Orchard and along Orange Grove Road, it has an excellent location - away from the busy main Orchard Road and yet short walking distance to shopping centres, etc. We chose the Garden Wing as there is a good children water and physical playround apart from the beautiful swimming pool, water features, indoor waterfall, gardens and The Orchid. It surely has nice restaurant with spread of local delicacies, Chinese Tim Sum, Malay Roti Prata, Indian spicy cusine and International Breakfast. There are numerous artistic pieces for your admiration too. Good place for individual and family. Check out the exercise program at the gym…

Review title: An amazing hotel for families vacation
Review: The best hotel to stay in Singapore for family vacations.  Spacious rooms, elegant decor, beautiful and lush green grounds and a play area thats a huge hit with kids.  Breakfast spread at The Line restaurant was excellent.  A special thank you to Khagendra Nayak for the excellent and authentic Indian cuisine experience. Traveling as a big group he ensured we didn't missed home cooked food at all.  Would highly recommend Shangri-La to others.

This hotel is situated out near the shopping area of Orchard Road. It is a very big hotel with three towers situated around a central lobby, restaurant/bar area. We stayed in the Garden Wing, which has a beautiful central area which is like a tropical forest with a walkway running through it down to the pool area. Our room was large and well equipped with a balcony overlooking the very impressive pool. Service was great in the hotel, although service in the restaurants and bar was disappointing in our experience. But although the hotel has a lot to recommend it, I wouldn't I stay there again for three main reasons. First, the room floors are hardwood rather than carpeted and so you can clearly hear people walking about in the room above. Being woken up at 6 am each morning by…

Not the Standard i am used to. Upon check in they didnt have my golden circle number and couldn't find it. Though I stayed in Manila many time and they always find it. I even told them I stayed there a month ago, but they still could not find it.   Then the room service... A sgd 42 burger came in a plastic tray, covered with clear plastic foil. Economy class food on a plane looks more attractive than that

Spend a week here at Shangri-La Singapore for business. This place is spectacular for stay, for its luxurious and homely feel. No wonder this place was always choosen for important events.  Had a little confusion over my reservation although I stayed here few times before. But that was resolved pretty quickly. I would say the best part of my stay here is the cleanliness of the entire hotel. Being very particular with cleanliness, this is why I appreciate my company for choosing this hotel among others. Bed is very comfortable that you can be sure of a good night sleep.   The hotel is just 30 minutes away by taxi from the airport and stone throw away from the shopping belt. Recommended to business travellers.

Went to The Line restaurant for dinner. It’s my first time to this restaurant. My god ! The choice of food and quality is excellent !  Enjoyed the ambiance, space and spread !  Which I have a double barrel stomach too taste all the great food.  Thumbs up for Miss Jia Min and Charlie for their attentive and hardworking service.

We have stayed at the Shanghai-La before and loved it. It never disappoints. The rooms are lovely and we had a pool view. Snacks and drinks poolside were excellent and the staff were always helpful. We treated ourselves to the Valley Wing for our last two nights and loved it. Everything one could wish for.

Review title: Valley Wing - What is there not to like?
Review: As I walked into the Valley Wing Lobby after almost 2 years due to change in business travel, I felt I have finally arrived home.  It is so comfortable to see the familiar faces of Swaran, Edward, Raja and Hussein at the lobby. They all came forward and greeted me with genuine warmth and I could feel they are really happy to see me again!  It is like coming home to my family whom I haven’t seen for 2 years...it brought tears to my eyes. A glass of champagne was handed to me to welcome me back as I was checking in. Kahlil was off on the day I arrived,  when he saw me the next day, he smiled with glee and handed me a glass of champagne before I even ask for it! At breakfast the next morning at the Summit Room, the breakfast team who were there for more than 5 years also gave me a…

Visiting here with my partner. We both enjoyed our staycation during weekend!  The breakfast was excellent the staff service was fenomenale. By the pool there is a squirrel jumping around the tree.   Verdict : Definitely will come back again here soon with my partner to spend another quality time

I stayed at the Valley Wing and as always the stay is exceptional as the service and food at the Valley Wing is exceptional.  Fortunately it was off-peak as otherwise the Valley Wing would be crowded with its regular guests.

As a work venu for 5 days it was amazing..even more spectacular as a guest..classic hotel and everything is tsken care of. Desk facing amazing views curtains that open electronically and even umbrellas and torches..excellent food multiple bars and restauraunts to choose from and the buffet will amaze.

Stayed at the Shangrila Hotel for 5 nights - mostly for a work conference using both the ballroom and the conference rooms on level 4.   Staff were very helpful and nothing was too much trouble.  I had heard about the breakfast at this hotel but it really was something to behold.   Anything and everything you could imagine were laid out for you to choose for your breakfast.  Service was cheerful and fast.  Rooms were well appointed and very comfortable.

Review title: lovely hotel but not ideal location for young family
Review: This was a lovely hotel. We picked it as the standard size room could accommodate my family of 4. One child slept on a pull out bed and one on the sofa. Room worked out great.  However location wasn't ideal for young children if planning to use the subway as it was a good 20 minute walk (with 3 year old) to Orchard station. After a couple of days we gave up and took taxis. There was an hourly shuttle bus to the station, but it was tiny and unless we were at the front of the queue stood no chance of getting on.  Breakfast was very good but very crowded and out of 4 mornings we were not once able to get orange juice as it kept running out.  Lovely pool and grounds.

Decided to have a 2 nights staycation with my family after reading about the new family themed suites.  My family has been heading to the sister property in Sentosa all these years for staycations especially with kids as they loved the kids friendly amenities and facilities there.  I decided to try the Shang's new family themed suite after reading about them.  There are 5 of such suites.  It can easily accomodate family of 5!  My kids were thrilled to the max with the room!  A nice looking submarine bunk bed is in our suite together with a king size bed in the other room located within the suite. Thus it's considered a 2 bedroom suite I'll say each is ensuite.  AS this staycation is to celebrate our daughter's birthday, we got a complimentary cake from the hotel.    Room is…

We went to Singapore for our 25th Anniversary and stayed in the Valley Wing at the Shangri-La Hotel and wasn't dissapointed. It is the most beautiful relaxing hotel with orchids everywhere. I wouldn't hesitate to stay there again, the staff are friendly and welcoming and can't do enough to make your stay special. We didn't try any of the restaurants there but really enjoyed the canapes. The breakfast was wonderful with varied things to eat you could have whatever you wanted and on saying that I would think the restaurant's food would be just as excellent. We also has a few Singapore Slings of course and again you could have those with varying degrees of alcohol you only had to ask. The outside area was a delight and the swimming pool was beautiful and great for all ages being…

One would never say the buildings are over 50 years old. The architecture and decor are fresh and inviting. Maintenance levels are remarkable. We stayed in the Valley Wing section of the hotel and the room amenities were superb. The bedside pedastal provided as usual a bible and refreshing the teachings of Budda however a copy of the Quran was missed.  My wife developed a reaction to the jasmin fragranced bath soaps and housekeeping without question immediately replaced with an alternate fragrance.  Of note on checking-in the gentleman at the front desk Mr Yong Long was quick in upselling us to the better appointed Horizon Club package. Will I return to the hotel, a resounding ...Yes!

Review title: Drank a can of tonic water already EXPIRED in Valley Wing!
Review: Stayed 3 nights (21-May check-in) in their Valley Wing which is supposed to be the best among the 3 Wings.  Conclusion: I would certainly look around other hotels the next time I visited Singapore.  This review is long as I mentioned both pros and cons in different areas.  For the expired drink, I reported to the front desk manager when I checked out on 24-May and provided him my room number.
