He promised to file my case, so I wonder why there was no response from the hotel.  The room is spacious and classic although some decor a bit dated. Bed and pillow are very very comfortable.  Nespresso, branded toiletry, turndown service were all good. Air-cond was too cold although I adjusted to 25 degree.  Services in general was of very high quality especially Raja in the Valley Wing…

Review title: Shangri-La- a hotel to stay  for mesmerizing moments
Review: A grand hotel at city heart of Singapore with lots of amenities. The hotel complex is just colossal. Swimming pool, Gym, Cafe, restaurants all are ready serve the its clients 7/24 with full of satisfaction. Staffs are exceptionally professional, friendly & smart. I love to be there many more times.

Just came back from a weeks stay in this beautiful hotel. We booked a room in the Tower Wing and got upgraded to one of the Junior Suite which a larger room, with a huge couch and table, equipped also a complete kitchen, cook top, microwave etc. It was was beautiful.  We also had access to their Horizon Lounge, where you have a private check in and check out, breakfast, afternoon tea and canapes and cocktails in the evening.   Being a guest of the hotel for a week we managed to try all the restaurants and outlets!  Nami - Japanese Restaurant - delicious authentic japanese food but i found it quite pricey!  Origin -Our favorite! We dined here 3 times! Must try the beef platter & seafood platter! Service here was impeccable!  Waterfall - Italian, and also another favorite! We…

What a disappointing experience we had over the holiday weekend at Shangri la Singapore. The bad experience started from check in where it took 1 and half hours for us to get our room. The excuse was they were experiencing high volume of customers. If that’s the case, they should realistically manage the customers’ expectations upfront and informed us ahead of time of this delay. When we checked in, we were informed that normal check in time is 3pm and it was already 245pm so we did not expect a long wait. This didn’t help when after multiple reminders (I was told 30 mins each time I enquired) were we only given our keys. They were not too apologetic about the delay either and just put the blame on housekeeping.  What made things worse was they then lost our bags and placed the…

We stayed here for a week at the end of our stay in Asia. The hotel is amazing and more. We stayed in the valley wing, it was a vacation to celebrate my husbands 50th birthday and our silver wedding anniversary. The staff and hotel went over and above to make our stay special. We had a celebration cake presented on our anniversary in the lounge by Raga and he made us feel so special. The quality of service is outstanding.  Breakfast in the senate room is lovely. The staff are really attentive, and even though the hotel and staff were in the process of potentially preparing for the stay of president of the America and South Korea’s head our service was hardly effected at all. They did have to move our room on the day before departure, but hey they made it so easy and went the…

The place is just beautiful! Nice foyer when you arrive, very nice room (heard some are not yet renovated though), the pool is very nice and the pool bar even better in the evening. Breakfast just amazing, very broad range of food - I actually loved the coffee place that is part of the breakfast buffet. The service overall is just totally outstanding!

Review title: Pretty hotel, but not centrally located
Review: I stayed at the Shangri-La on the tail end of a business trip. The service was pretty good in the hotel, but the room was lack luster for the price.  Old, outdated and not very clean.  Other drawback was the location, it is outside of the central business district and not very convenient for walking into town. This appears to be a place for families given all the amenities for kids, so it might be on point for that. Seems overpriced for the condition of the room.

Shangri-La is well known hotel chain and the Singapore hotel after twin renovation of it's garden wing and main tower has made the hotel look new again. It has three main wings and also the large service apartments and also the short / long stay apartments. The full complex is very large and has all the amenities. It is also well located just off Orchard road. All the restaurants like the Japanese, Shang Place (Chinese) the Italian one are great places to dine in but on the expensive side. The Chi Spa is fantastic and the pool is just great. Lovely property and great staff but the in room dining may take time to get the food orders.

Great location and a top class hotel.  Has been great for past 20 years.  Excellent staff and great service.  Rooms are very well appointed and very quick response to any requests for laundry or help of any type.  Pool area is a real tropical resort.  Great for business or leisure breaks,  highly recommend as one of the best hotels in Singapore

Review title: Father's Day celebration at Lobby Lounge Shangri-La Hotel
Review: Awesome food, awesome service by Mr Kannan, awesome ambience and with awesome family... Wat more do you need for Father's Day Celebration 🎉 Singapore's signature dishes are a must try. Nice greenery.

This luxurious hotel is great for staycation. The hotel is great inside and out, from lobby, to its restaurants, to the pool and its amenities, to inside the room. Lobby is very big and cozy. There are a lot of restaurants to choose from and breakfast is great, by the way, with different types of food to choose from. The pool is very big with kiddie pools connecting with the main so it is easy to switch from one pool to the other. The room is very spacious, very modern and techie with usb plugs for charging devices are plenty and available.  Oh yes, there is a playground for kids at the lower lobby that has a big discount for hotel guests.    Great great place for staycation. Perfect for family and business trips as well. Will be back again soon.

Excellent environment, friendly service .... Sure will come back again ..... I just wanted to say what a great time I and my family.. Everyone has commented on what a lovely venue .. Thank you so much ......

Review title: No Hotel for business people or couples - more like a kindergarten
Review: This was my worst hotel experience for a very long time. I think the Hotel wants to be a family Hotel. This means that if you do not want to have screaming children around you all the time, do never come here. Service also poor and breakfast experience was horrible. Even the horizon lounge so full that we could not get a table. Juices in bottles and coffee from machines which tasted so bad that we had to walk to Starbucks to get a decent cup of coffee. Very disappointing experience and never ever again. Compared with other luxury hotels in Singapore (St Regis, Fullerton, Raffles) a really poor experience. Staff let’s children scream and run around and bother other guests. Spoke to a Berman couple who decided to check out and find another hotel.

Review title: One of the best luxurious hotel
Review: My previous stay at a deluxe room was awesome. This time, I was provided with a standard room, which was also good. Service is great, even though check in before 3pm can be challenging if not inform beforehand, but the hotel provides good amenities for the guest to enjoy while waiting. The Line restaurant was among the best Hotel Buffett in Singapore, even better than the choices offered by the Fullerton Hotel.

Review title: Staff makes the hotel stay wonderful
Review: When I checked in, Alex Lee walked me to my Valley tower and welcomed me with excellent service and warm greetings.  Valley tower lobby is led by Edward Chew (Lobby Ambassador) and he takes time to know his guests.  He is assisted by Jade Han, Khair Kasam and Sara.  The room was perfect.  Enjoy your time and this hotel offers plenty of service.

Spent several evenings in the Lobby Lounge during my stay in Singapore. Excellent service and entertainment.  The staff, led by Katrina, were extremely welcoming, friendly and efficient.  The entertainment was provided by singer Tria Bascon, pianist Danny and bassist Paul. Wonderful repertoire and all requests accommodated. Very enjoyable and top quality performances greatly appreciated by the guests.  Will certainly return.

Stayed here from 18th -20th May. The hotel is rather pricey but it is lush, massive pool, massive rooms, air con etc. It’s everything you would expect from a Shangri-La hotel. The hotel is not far from Orchard Road tube station and all the shops. Would recommend for a stop over. Singapore is a great city.

Just spent 3 nights at this superb hotel and can’t fault anything about our stay. The room was luxurious, on the small side, but perfect if you needed to work, as it had a large fully equipped desk. We choose the Tower wing as we wanted to experience the Horizon club facilities and we weren’t disappointed. All the staff there were very attentive and the breakfasts, afternoon teas and canapés were lovely. I’m still missing the cocktails, they made a perfect Singapore sling. The gardens were beautiful, the pool was warm and the loungers and towels were readily available. The Shang palace restaurant was also wonderful, the food scrumptious and the staff, especially the manager on duty Wednesday 6th June was very obliging, many thanks, the swans were very tasty.  Finally a big thank…

Review title: Heaven for all families with kids!
Review: You have children and plan to travel to Singapore? Shangri-La is the place to be! The past years I had the chance to stay in almost all 5 star hotels in Singapore... yet Shangri-La is playing in its own league:  Check-In: Fast, efficient and still very personal... we’ve been guided all the way from the taxi, to the check-in counter and from there to the elevator. When we arrived in our room the luggage was already there. I wished it would be like this in all hotels!  The room / kids floor: Truth been told - the decor is not my cup of tea... to put it into positive words “very classic”. However they do provide litteraly EVERYTHING you would need for a baby / toddler / child! Whoever is in charge of the kids floor must have children for sure!  Entertainment: I’ve been to…

This hotel is large and has luxurious grounds, beautifully landscaped, with generous carpark spaces. It is well appointed for a wide range of events, from weddings to conferences. Their many F&B outlets provide a selection of good quality food. The main entrance is located on elevated grounds, which gives this hotel an impressive site, close to Orchard Road. You can relax over drinks in the lobby, listening to live singing and music. A great place for entertainment at different levels.

Oh where to start? On this visit to Singapore we decided to splurge and stay at the Shangri-La. Not in the everyday person Tower Wing but in the very special person Valley Wing. It is special indeed! Yes there are dress standards but that is only appropriate when there are special drinks including Veuve Cliquot flowing from 11:00 - 22:30 in the lounge. There is high tea & snacks &  reading glasses to go with the newspapers & very attentive staff in fancy dress. Our room was superb and the daily breakfast in the Summit Room was a delightful way to start the day. A delight that could only be improved if they served bubbly wine. And the pool and the complimentary massages were the best!

We had our high school graduation ball there yesterday. Everything was fine but I admit I am utterly disappointed when a 5 Star hotel is unable to serve one table at the time. I had at least 4 times to call the waiter to show him That food was still missing but they a started already the next table. Sorry Shangri la, I would have expected much better from you .

Review title: Requires improvement in Customer Service and Quality of Food
Review: Stayed in the newly renovated Tower Wing Suite which is to 5 stars standard. However everything else falls short of expectations. Check in staff did not brief benefits of the stay and what was included, and was standoffish. Children’s amenities were requested during booking and check in but was not there- I understand that room booked was not a family room as it was too small for us, however , hotels like Ritz Carlton will prepare stuff for kids regardless of room or package booked as part of Ritz Kids program. Shangri-La tries to be a family friendly hotel but fails even in this simple gesture. The food quality in the hotel has dropped tremendously. Room service was awful, food at The Line, the Horizon Club and Shang Palace was equally bad. For such high prices, the food…

I'd just like to thank the staff at the Shangri-la, Singapore for a fabulous short stay. Our rooms were immaculate and extremely well appointed and the hospitality of the staff was excellent. We loved the pool and gym and would love to return one day, a wonderful holiday.

This place is amazing for families I cannot get over how the family room is so fun for the kids with the tree house bed and the colours, every detail was thought of all the kids amenities are provided with some organic products, bathrobes and slippers even a foldable baby bath tub! There is a splash pad, soft play area, kitchen for cooking activities. The breakfast was lovely with so many options. Beautiful grounds as well. Love this hotel!

Review title: Great hotel in a great location -close to Orchard rd and shopping district
Review: First time visitors to Singapore and we were not disappointed. Stayed 4 nights at the end of May 2018. We found it very easy to check in at the Shangri-La. On arrival, we were warmly greeted and provided with some fresh juice -it was an easy process and they called my husband from the room (at my request) to come and meet in the lobby.  The room was as expected. Very comfortable and air-conditioned. I loved the toiletries. I had forgotten my toothbrush and was very pleased to find that there were toothbrushes and toothpaste in the toiletries included in the bathroom. So that is a big tick from me! I had booked a pool view which was very nice and the balcony overlooking the pool was a good size and the outdoor furniture was comfortable.  Buffet breakfast was included with the…

I stayed 5 nights at this beautiful hotel and had a great time to the point that I was actually looking forward to go back to the hotel after work. Facilities are just perfect , biggest Gym I have ever seen in a hotel and the Horizon lounge is fantastic. I would like to extend a very special thank you to Lynn at reception who not only made me feel very welcome when I arrived late at night but recognised me when I checked out 5 days later. Lynn was very professional and extremely helpful .... thank you Lynn !  I can only highly recommend this hotel, what an experience

Shangri-La Hotel is a luxury oasis from the moment you enter the breathtaking lobby.  The hotel offers 3 accommodation wings ranging from modern tower rooms to tropical serenity of the garden rooms and the luxurious valley rooms. This hotel is more like an urban sanctuary with beautiful lush grounds, huge pool, great range of restaurants, amazing Chi Spa and those gorgeous orchids throughout the hotel are stunning. In addition to this, the staff are wonderful and staying at Shangri-La Hotel is such a wonderful experience

Spent two nights here on a visit to Singapore with my wife and baby. The hotel is very nice. Just the lobby area is pretty breathtaking. The staff were very friendly and helpful upon check in and with some requests we had. The room we had was nicely decorated, big and had all the amenities. We stayed in a double bedroom and the sofa in the room turned into a bed for our baby. The bed was huge and very comfortable. The bathroom was nice too. The only small criticism was that the shower could have been more powerful, although it wasn't bad, just a personal preference. The room had a fully stocked mini bar and a draw full of goodies! We had a pool view room which was a nice touch. The pool was very nice and had sections for the kids. My wife had a massage here and she enjoyed it.…

On 28th May I made a returned visit to The Line at Shangri La which I do once a month. I was overwhelmed to be greeted by my favourite Italian Chef and Grace my favourite hostess. It was a surprise for me because these two lovable people are supposable on vacation but when they checked the reservation list they realised that I would be present on 28th May. Both of them cancelled their vacation to serve me. Ooh they really do me proud! Grace even posed a picture with me during the dinner. So sweet of her. I truly enjoyed myself that evening eating all the sumptuous food from appetiser to main course, finishing with desserts, not forgetting gelato icecreams. I went home feeling proud and loved.

Review title: An excellent staycation for my wife's birthday!
Review: We stayed 2D1N at this hotel for my wife's birthday and it turned out to be a wonderful weekend, partly due to the fact that we were upgraded to a Garden Wing suite! We managed to pack quite a lot in for the weekend - from lunch at the Waterfall restaurant (which was delicious as usual) to the always excellent buffet dinner at The Line, not to mention my kids running havoc in the hotel's amazing kids club.   Our rate entitled our kids to use the kids club for free and I can see why so many people were there - it's large and well equipped for kids to expend all their energy climbing, running, sliding, throwing, chasing and basically running wild. On top of this, our kids also did a cookie baking class which cost extra.  The rooms were well appointed and spotless so absolutely no…

I've had the pleasure of visiting Singapore several times and with the exception of one occasion always stayed at the Shangri-La. My last trip was three weeks, but the hotel staff, food, room service etc are just fantastic. If you're visiting Singapore and looking for a good hotel, this is the one to book.

Very picturesque, we had a pleasant time although there were some initial issues with the rooms but staff were friendly and helpful. A little expensive but worth the extra money if you enjoy the peace and quiet!

Warm, family orientated, yet discreet and sophisticated, excellent South Italian Cuisine headed by Andreano. A fantastic team from top to bottom. Andreano has created a restaurant which understands food from planting, growing, nurturing, harvesting, presenting and service. It is part of his family tradition because they are sommeliers, they are chefs, they grow olives and farm fresh vegetables. We have had Sunday lunch and weekday meals and dinners there many times over the years. We’ve had the most amazing family meal in their discrete private dining room with a very homely atmosphere. The quality has always maintained. We are not tourists. We live here for many years.

Redeemed my points with Golden Circle and had access to the lounge.  From the point of out check in, throughout the stay the experience has been anything but fantastic.  The reception team (Shawn) specifically asked if we were here for an occasion, just so they can find ways to make our stay more memorable.  The house-keeping Team is very detailed, they changed out soiled towels when they turned down the beds.  The concierge (RajKumar) was always ready to render help, in any way possible. No restrictions on the number of times I could enter and exit the carpark.  The gym staff were always on the lookout to clean the equipment once they were used and serving you with a smile.  Excellent amenities for the kids too!  All in all, exquisite experience. No wonder they are probably the…

Pleasant stay though there was initial hiccups.  Few miscommunications during check-in but generally staff is quite quick to respond. Location not very convenient though it is near to orchard road.  Bed is very comfortable.  Good night sleep.  Checkout was brisk.  Breakfast good variety n taste good. Will stay again n will recommend.

Over priced, Over rated....staff average. venue good, food average...I am not sure why it is called High Tea as I thought it represented an ordinary Buffet lunch.. Make your own sandwiches?  No pretty cakes ?  Ordinary deserts.

We stayed at the Shangri La for 5 days in May and it was a great experience. We stayed in the Valley Wing and it was quiet and exclusive, which was exactly what we wanted. The Tower Wing is where the main entrance to the hotel (and I believe, there are some banquet halls as well) and we found that to be bustling and noisy, with a lot of hotel and outside guests milling around. By contrast, there is a separate lounge and sit down area for the Valley Wing which was nice and quiet. We were on vacation and the unhurried pace was exactly what we wanted!! We found the staff to be extremely polite, helpful and willing to accommodate our requests as much as possible. Rooms were nice and spacious and well laid out, room service and house keeping was prompt and attentive. All in all, a…

Review title: There are better hotels in Singapore
Review: We spent a few days in Shangri La in Valley wing. The Valley Wing is very pleasant and the service at the champagne bar is very courteous and fast. Outside there are also nice tables where you can have breakfast. There, however, the service during breakfast is extremely incompetent and actually does not exist.  The women prefer to stand around in the air-conditioned room and do everything they can to avoid the heat. The service outside was a big disappointment! Also the choice at breakfast is extremely small and it takes a long time until something is served. I recommend having breakfast at Restaurant the Line. The pool of the hotel is beautiful but on the weekends an absolute nightmare. Full of small children, no free loungers simply incomprehensible. Two tennis courts are…

Spent a week at this hotel and would definitely go back.  Very nice rooms with all the necessary amenities and more.  Inside the hotel has a great bar/entry with high ceilings in an almost atrium like feel.  I was there for leisure and business.  Hotel worked great for both.  Staff and service in the hotel were top notch.  Everyone was very friendly and helpful with any requests or inquiries we had.

We stayed here for 3x nights, before going to Bali. Fantastic 5 Star hotel. Great location off the Orchard Road - near amazing shipping/malls. Easy to get taxis to explore the rest of the city, Marina Bay Sands / hawkers food / gardens by the bay / Chinese and Indian areas. We had a garden view room, big and superb views of gardens. Pool area is very special and breakfast is superb - one of the best in any hotel we’ve stayed in. Highly recommend for a short and luxury break.

Review title: Five Nights at the Shangri-La Singapore
Review: We chose this hotel because we wanted a resort style hotel in a location close to Orchard Road. So first to the problems we encountered. Several months prior we booked and paid for five nights in a Pool View room. On our arrival at check in we were told our room was not available for the first night due to overbooking. Staff told us they would put us in a Valley View room for one night then move us the next day. This was very inconvenient and stressful as it necessitated unpacking, repacking, moving then unpacking again. All very stressful as we only had five nights for a mini holiday. We were given a credit on our room account as compensation for the inconvenience. Still it shouldn't have happened in the first place. During our stay we were not able to view our room account on…

We were surprised by the extentive range of facilities available for families. There was Buds which was the kids playroom. It was big with slides and all. It was separated into two areas. One for younger kids and one for bigger kids. The pool and outdoor playground were also fun. This time we didn't bring our kids but we will definitely come again with them. Room is cosy and comfortable. Staff are always helpful too. The breakfast buffet was facinating with many choices.

The location of Shangri La Singapore is perfect. Its just off the bustling Orchard Road (within walking distance) but encompassed in green noise free area and surrounded mostly by residential buildings. The check in at the horizon club lounge was smooth. The rooms are spacious but a bit small when compared with other five star properties. The service is impeccable as a norm with all Shangri La hotels. The buffet at breakfast was sumptuous but had specific problems at the Indian Vegetarian menu. This was pointed out to the chef, who immediately noted down the suggestions and promised for a rectification. Its a lavish property spread over acres and if you are looking to be pampered go in for their Valley Wing rooms with club facilities. The rates as with most Shangri La hotels,…

Review title: Lovely resort but a little busy
Review: I stayed recently for a weekend during a business trip.  I have stayed previously so knew what to expect.  The location is great for Orchard Road, Dempsey etc and the hotel has a true resort feel.  It has a great pool area and the spa is very nice, although it lacks any on site facilities (its treatment only - no saunas, steam etc, though they have this in the fitness centre, a short walk away).  The Shang Palace is great for Chinese food, although the service was a bit lacking.  The room was great - spacious and well decorated and clean (save for some mould on my duvet, but the hotel were very apologetic and dealt with it well).  Staff were very friendly.  The only real downside to the place was that it is perhaps a victim of its own success and so is extremely busy.  The lobby…

Review title: A relaxing and comfortable stop over.
Review: My partner and I stayed in the Tower Wing room on the seventh floor with access to the lovely club lounge -Horizon. Our room was very spacious and very modern. The new renovation is obvious and ensured our stay was excellent. The large king size bed was very comfortable with a large bathroom including a great shower and bath. There is plenty of room for luggage and wardrobes for clothes to be hung. The large pool area and beautifully landscaped gardens added to the wonderful relaxing resort style atmosphere. The service from check in/out, lobby staff, pool staff and horizon club lounge staff was excellent. The Horizon club room was lovely with plenty of room and comfortable chairs including occasional lounge areas. The food and alcoholic beverage choice for cocktail hours from…

Review title: In room facilities - good, decor rather tired, average for a 5 star hotel
Review: The in room facilities were good and the 'office' resources excellent. Everything needed right down to paper clips. The outdoor facilities including the pool were also very good. The overall decor of the rooms and public areas of the hotel were rather tired and in need of freshening up.  Staff were outstanding in their helpfulness and general customer orientation. The horizon club was very pleasant although the selection for afternoon tea and canapés rather limited and therefore disappointing.  The location is a little away from tourist attractions however public transport is excellent so no difficulties were experienced.  Overall, a very good experience however would try another 5 star hotel next time we are in Singapore as it did not really have the edge to make us want to…

It is not only a perfect business hotel. Also for a relaxing day on the poolside it is a perfect location. Very central but within the extensive well maintained gardens it is another world. Various restaurants cater for about every taste.

The recently renovated Shangri-La Hotel in Singapore was an absolute joy to stay in. The spacious rooms and magnificent lobby were excellent just the beginning. The complimentary buffet breakfast was astounding in quality and scope. The restaurants on the premises were very good. The overall service was excellent

Rarely do I say it was a true pleasure to stay in a Hotel but I have just returned from a four night stay of pure luxury and indulgence at The Valley Wing of the beautiful Shangri-La Hotel Singapore. Whatever wing you are in the Hotel is a true luxury 5* property which almost feels like a resort due the huge amount of space and land it's on (swimming pool and gardens are gorgeous) so don't hesitate to stay here of the budget doesn't quite stretch to the Valley Wing. However, the Valley Wing really is the creme de la creme of the property. Large, luxurious, superbly appointed rooms equipped with all amenities you could possibly need or indeed wish for. Complimentary soft beverages from the mini-bar, turndown service, super comfortable beds and gorgeous furnishings gives this real…

I've stayed at a few Shangri-La's and I can positively say that this is one of the few brands that is truly hospitable - and not just at the face of it. The hotel is enormous, the way a five star should be - probably because it is a relatively old hotel and not your typical high rise. Though old, the refurbishment has been top notch and there is nothing that suggested the hotel's age.  The pool is huge and so is the buffet - right next door so feasting after a dip seems justified.

Overall a good experience. Would love to stay again and again. Staff wonderful. From welcome to seeing off, felt like family. Garden Wing One Bed Room Suite was very spacious and offers a view of the pool.

Review title: Great Hotel for business ang leisure
Review: We had 2 days workshop in this hotel and we had a very fun and productive meetings. The rooms and hotel atmosphere were fantastic. Staff services were also excellent. The hotel has alsogreat jogging track and exercise facility.

Where else but the Garden Wing of the Shangri-La Singapore? It was clear to me that when travelling to Singapore again after many years, I'd want to return to the beautiful, tranquil, tropical oasis, which is the Garden Wing.  Reality was to be different.  When checking in after two long flights across many times zones, I initially wasn't too pleased to hear that our reserved rooms in the garden wing were not available, and that we were to be moved to the tower wing. While I had never stayed at the tower wing before, my impression was that the rooms are small and I thought they could be dated.  Fortunately, I couldn't have been more wrong.  We were upgraded to a "tower wing horizon club grand premier room". - That's likely the room with the longest description I've ever stayed…

Spent 2 days here before setting out on a cruise to Myanmar.  Stunning hotel in extensive gardens with orchids galore - who need to go to the Botanic Gardens with this on display! The room was lovely.  We sank into the bed after a long trip from London non-stop with BA. (which by the way was also surprisingly good).  It oozed luxury and we loved it.  Excellent staff and the customary enhanced level of customer care from the entire team.  Would certainly recommend this hotel.  Free shuttle bus operates to the shopping district with further easy access from there via the metro rail all across the city.  Such a safe place to wander around.  Can't fault a thing about it.

If you like genuine Italian food then this is the best place in Singapore without doubt. The service is second to none, attentive yet discreet. Tony our waiter was always available and willing to help with anything we needed but without doubt the reason for this excellent restaurant delivering excellent service and outstanding food is down to he manger Andreano who being Italian understands what people expect. For the management of the Shangri La hotel please note that this manager is doing the hotel chain proud.   Want authentic Italian food ? Visit this restaurant,  you want be disappointed!!!

Review title: Enjoyed my stay although far from perfect
Review: I stayed 2 nights for business in early May. The hotel is very well maintained and I was given a room in the Tower Wing, which I'm told is newly renovated. Overall, all staff at the hotel was remarkably attentive. I took advantage of the complimentary shoe shine service and my shoes were returned that afternoon.   The gym is large and has a wide range of equipment in good condition. The pool area (pictured) is beautiful and allows for a relaxing experience.   Location of the property is likewise good. You're close enough to the Orchard Road high street area (quick 5 minute walk) but removed enough where you feel separated from the hustle and bustle.   However, there were 3 issues that I felt prevented me from giving my stay 5 stars:  1) both the sauna and steam rooms were closed…

good room friendly staff. concierge friendly friendly and reception great stay room was nice location easy to find.had a great experience. We had a deluxe pool view room which was spacious and had all the amenities needed to enjoy our stay. The Beach bar serves good fresh,y cooked food for lunch time dining

Just spent a couple of days at The Shangri la and had a great experience.  We had a deluxe pool view room which was spacious and had all the amenities needed to enjoy our stay.    The Beach bar serves good fresh,y cooked food for lunch time dining and there are plenty of sun beds available so no 'towel bagging'.  Breakfasts have a good choice to suit all nationalities.  I would definitely return for a relaxing stay in a lovely location

Shangri La The lost Horizon  I have been very excited to see the newly refurbished tower wing especially with my long association over (41) so many years.   My executive room is magnificent, it is stunningly appointed with the ability to divide  the living area from the bedroom with two stylish internal sliding panels.  The living area now boasts a small dining table along with cooking facilities ( I wonder just how many people avail themselves of this; myself, trust me, I don’t want to cook when I have access to so many wonderful places to eat )  The  bathroom is very well appointed with a choice of rainwater or standard heads and of course a bath, with two vanity units. I particular like the use of white marble flooring as it is much safer than high shine tiles.   Enough about…

Review title: ASEAN security took over the hotel for the event and made it a bad experience for guests
Review: The event that ruined our planned relaxing weekend head of government ASEAN event took of the lobby and every entry point, making guests feel like they were suspects rather than guests. Nice hotel but failed to manage this event and its private guests experience well. Even the swimming pool had security lurking around. If I had know this event was going to be held at the hotel and the subsequent effect it had on my holiday I would not have stayed at this hotel. The hotel failed to inform its guests prior.  The hotel is nice with nice gardens, expensive restaurants and lobby lounge and the cost for a room way over valued. The breakfast restaurant by the pool felt more like a busy café in a shopping centre. I had to wait for 10 minutes to get a table. Then another 10 minutes to…

Thank you to the wait staff and chef Heidi and her team for an incredible 3 course meal at Origin. The meal went from strength to strength. I was overwhelmed along with my friends with the attention to detail. It was great meeting the chef and talking with the staff about Singapore. A restaurant experience not to be missed. Thank you

The location is top, the service is excellent, the facilities are really good!! I travelled with my 2 toddlers and we stayed for 3 ninths and had an amazing time. The kids club is really good , the breakfast wowwww.

If you are looking for a tropical oasis to stay at when in Singapore then look no further.  This hotel is beautiful, staff are efficient, friendly and nothing is too much trouble.  A good choice of dining options to suit all tastes and budgets.  Beautifully set in 15 acres of manicure tropical gardens- bliss !!

Review title: Sophisticated elegance but fell short in some places.....
Review: We have become fans of Shangri-la hotels recently and our recent stay here in Singapore did not disappoint in terms of the hotel elegance and sense of refined luxury and service. We stayed in a Tower Wing Horizon Club Grand Premier Room for 4 nights. It was one of the newest renovated rooms on Level 10. The room was beautiful and incredibly spacious, with a separate kitchenette and dining area. The house keeping service was impeccable. The Horizon Club was a real treat and a lovely sanctuary to visit in between our day's activities.  What had let me down were: (1) The Line restaurant was crazy busy and felt out of keeping with the rest of the hotel feel. It felt like a busy food court and our coffee was served with the coffee spilt all over its saucer. I'm willing to oversee…

Review title: Beautiful Resort Property Close to Shopping!
Review: Capped off a business trip with the husband by staying our last two nights at this resort. The grounds are absolutely beautiful with a picture perfect pool, gardens, and a gorgeous lobby! AND they give you an Orchid on the way to your room :) First and most importantly, EVERY staff person was helpful, friendly and professional-couldn't have asked for better! Our room ( Garden Wing) was large and beautiful with lots of wood trim. The bed was very comfortable and the room had built in night lights. It had a very well stocked honor bar area with wine glasses, wine opener, plate, knife & Nepresso machine. The room had plenty of outlets and USB charging ports.The bathroom was like having my own private spa with a great rain shower-head and soaker tub.  I loved the detail of the small…

I stayed 2 days with my husband at this hotel... everything was impeccable: rooms very spacious with a very nice view, very big pool, personnel very friendly but what I think was the best is definitely the breakfast.

We stayed here for 2 nights and our experience here was excellent. Loved hanging out around the pool and orchid area.   We stayed in the Horizon Club Grand Premiere Room on the first day so we were escorted up to the 24th floor lounge for check in. The lounge is beautiful and conducive to do work at. Check-in staffs were polite and professional. Room is very spacious and the design was very well thought. It is more suited for business travellers than families. It does not have a balcony but it offers a nice view of the city from the day bed and the work desk.   Our 2nd day stay was at the Garden Wing One Bedroom Suite so we had to check out and waited at the lounge before the suite was ready for check in. It is also very spacious and we loved the balcony overlooking the pool.…

Review title: Started off shakey but finished strong.
Review: Having been to this hotel for decades and having been a regular whilst living in Singapore we decided to return to this hotel for a recent vacation.   Arrived to a foyer in chaotic state and to slow service at the reception. Had booked 6 nights in Horizon Club and was eventually checked in there. We are Golden Circle Members and Platinum Amex and booked under Amex Fine Hotels and Resorts program which includes a room upgrade on arrival. Which we initially did not get, although rooms were available.  We were also disappointed with the changes in Horizon Club with a huge number of families with small children with several children not under the control of their parents, running around, two nearly running into me from the same family. Add the downgrading Of Champagne to the cheaper…

Stayed one night in the valley wing, only wish that it could have been more. A superb hotel in every way. Great swimming pool, super rooms, delicious food. The staff were helpful and friendly, nothing was too much trouble. If I should go to Singapore again this is definitely the hotel I would stay in

Review title: A perfect end to our holiday
Review: We were fortunate to spend two nights in the 'Valley Wing' of the Shangri-La. The property and the amenities were of the highest standard. The staff were totally professional and hospitable with a particular mention to Vanessa on reception and full marks to Raja who produced a fine 'negroni' cocktail. The breakfast buffet was a delight and the dinner that we enjoyed in the 'Origin Grill' was superb. Without doubt it will be our destination for our next Singapore visit and we would highly recommend the 'Valley Wing' of the Shangri-La to others.

Simply perfect. I genuinely can't fault a single thing about this hotel.  It was the first place we stayed on our honeymoon. The first night, with grand plans of heading out for a lovely meal at a fancy restaurant, we liked it so much we stayed in!  We upgraded to a slightly bigger room and access to the Horizon Club. Definitely worth the money getting access to the club, especially for the drinks and nibbles between 5-7!  It's one of the fanciest places I've stayed, and I'm so glad that every part of the experience with them was flawless.

We decided to stay at Shangri-la to celebrate my daughter's birthday. It was a good stay for the family. My daughter enjoyed herself at BUDS. Only thing is when it got too crowded, the parents were all also standing in the midst of the play area watching their kids and chatting at the same time. Imagining the kids running around with parents standing in the midst of the limited walk area... May be a danger hazard. Other than that, my girl enjoyed herself! The staff at BUDS were really friendly. Kudos to angeline! She remembered my girl even on the second day and she said hi! The bake studio offers free 'moulding' sessions during weekdays for kids to help  Prepare the dough for breakfast. My 4 year old enjoyed it! The room was spacious and clean. They prepared the bed for my girl…

Review title: Fabulous Hotel and Wonderful Staff (Particularly the Valley Wing)
Review: Arrived here on a lovely Friday afternoon from Cambodia for a three day stop-over before returning back to UK. Upgraded to Valley Wing and never regretted it!!! The champagne bar with afternoon tea and evening canapés, wonderful staff who worked tirelessly to ensure your glass was always full and a wonderful lounge to simply relax in and be utterly spoilt. Despite the fact my wife took ill on the Saturday morning, nothing was ever an issue, the constant flow of hot water, lemon and honey to providing a doctor who managed to get her back on her feet after 36hours was a testament to the levels of service they provide and the standards they maintain for all guests. All staff members on Valley Wing Reception were fabulous. It is our intention to return here as soon as possible so…

We had three nights in Shanghai-La Hotel, Singapore. We will like to come back. Beautiful hotel, excellent rooms, excellent breakfast, very clean, very friendly staff.  It is situated a little outside the centre of the city which we liked. Access to the centre is easy. We stayed in the top floors and had lovely view over Singapore.  The last day before leaving for the airport was spent in the garden by the pool. Lovely and relaxing. We had lunch in the outdoor restaurant before leaving for the airport. But service there was very slow, so if you are doing the same, I would recommend you to do that in good time before you have to change clothes and leave for the airport. This was the only disadvantage.   I highly recommend Shangri-La Singapore. An excellent hotel.

Stayed here for 3 nights , it's top class , staff are very nice .special thanks to farah and her colleague ( forgot her name ) who welcomed us . Coffeeshop is great with a big spread. Room was tastefully done . Swimming pool area is big like a resort style . Will surely consider it for my next stay .

My wife and I stayed several times at this property 40+ years ago and since then with our near yearly visit to Singapore we have tried many other hotels including the fantastic Marina Bay Sands. This time we had 3 days to fill in before heading off on a cruise. So why not relax and enjoy what we remembered the lush grounds of this hotel. At Shangrila properties we are now lazy and book the Horizon Club rooms. A little more but worth it at our stage of life.  Immediate check-in on level 24 and we were allocated a great room. The beauty of this type of room is the availability of a good breakfast, a great weight gaining afternoon tea and enough wine and nibbles at sunset. We took two guest to this level at 6.00pm and the cost was S$80 per head but well worth it for the peace and…

Review title: Great first stop on our South East Asia Tour
Review: We stayed in the Valley Wing which is essentially a 5 star small hotel within the larger Shangri La Hotel. Service and room were excellent. The main hotel which is much larger is fine but much noisier and more larger group focused. Central for pretty much anywhere in the city.

The shangri la is always a reliable brand. The Singapore Hotel is truly special. Excellent for business/conferences, this hotel features various restaurants and cuisines, excellent conferencing facilities, lovely pool and very helpful staff. Cannot be faulted!

We recently stayed at the hotel for three nights prior to a cruise and would be happy to stay again the next time we visit Singapore.  We upgraded to a garden room and as it was our honeymoon they gave us several goodies.  We had breakfast outside of the Waterfall restaurant two mornings which was really lovely,the selection of food and the service was very good,however it was closed on the third morning and we had to go the main restaurant and queue for a table,it was very very busy and service and food was not up to the usual Shangri-La standards.  We enjoyed drinks in the lounge which were the usual price for a five star hotel.  But normally its the service from all staff which makes this hotel group stand out from the rest.

Review title: Real good hotel in great location
Review: Very comfortable hotel offering many amenities of quality. Restraunt choice was very good and we enjoyed the whole experence. Well planned out lounge areas and the pool was well enjoyed after traveling through the eastern ports.

Probably one of the best hotel experiences we have enjoyed. The service was amazing. The room had everything you could wish for. The Valley Wing was an oasis of calm and we will definitely return. Such an enjoyable experience. Champagne and canapés high quality, interesting breakfast menu.

Amazing Resort - This well travelled family was blown away at the beauty and service at this amazing resort.   Grounds - Garden lovers should book this resort you wont be disapointed because the grounds are pretty special, Resort is decades old and clearly they have developed some amazing garden spaces over that time. It really is an Oasis in the middle of the City.  Tropical gardens with every kind of flowering orchid you could imagine, waterfalls, rock pools and plenty of fish. Pool was also set in this area and blended into grounds quite nicely.  Room - Great room lots of space that easily accommodated three in the room. Deep bath and large shower . We stayed in the Garden Wing that has views over the pool area from a nice balcony.   Service - Outstanding.   Only negative for…

Stayed for 4 nights here in mid April as a family holiday with two kids in a deluxe premier club room. The room is wonderfully spacious and really useful for the kids to have a space to eat/play/move around. Having recently been renovated the bathrooms particularly were big and very comfortable but everything about the room was really very nice. And unexpectedly there was a sink and microwave in the room which was so perfect for me to wash the baby bottles etc.  It’s unusual to have to pay for the kids club when you’re a hotel guest I found (only free if you’re staying in the ‘family’ rooms) which is a bit limiting. But that’s the only negative about the hotel.  The kids club is more like a indoor play Centre than a typical kids club so I didn’t feel comfortable leaving my…

Absolutely amazing from the moment we arrived to the time of our departure. Loved everything about this hotel. The staff, the service and the food. The valley wing is the most prestigious place to stay, glad we chose this place for our first stop of our honeymoon...luxury at it’s finest. Thank you to all the staff for making it memorable.

Stayed here a couple of years ago. Only stayed a couple of nights as a stop over to Europe. Great location, close to China town. We got upgraded to a honey moon suite was amazing and the extra room was great with our young son at the time. The staff are amazing and the club lounge was great. Would definitely stay here again for sure

Don't know where to start?! From the moment we arrived to Valley Wing, until we checked out was just like 4 days in heaven! The Valley Wing itself is fantastic and the staff is likely the best hotell staff in the world. I can't recall all the names, but to mention a few; Vanessa and Aeisha in the front dest; always smiling, relaxed friendly and helpful. Our new French friend, Dominique who made our breakfasts memorable.   We had a slight problem with our room which was taken care of in the best possible way, thanks Vanessa!  Can't wait to go back - this is for sure my new favorite hotel in the world! This is the place to stay when in Singapore.  Thanks to all of you who made our stay amazing!

Stayed here recently for my 30th birthday, cannot fault the hotel.  Amazing room . good food, huge gym and large pool.  Didnt hear a peep from neighbouring rooms and staff were lovely .   If im ever in singapore i shall be back .

Review title: Perfect Hotel for a visit to Singapore
Review: We stayed here for one night before heading off on a cruise, I wish it had been longer. The hotel gardens are amazing and it has a good sized pool, there is a health club and sauna/steam room but I didn't manage to use them. We were booked into the club level rooms and on entering the hotel we were escorted to the club lounge to check in. We had a lovely room in the tower wing. The staff were excellent and very helpful. The food and wine in the club lounge were of a high standard. I would stay here again and would recommend it.

Review title: first5 time to this amazing city`
Review: this is an amazing Hotel ..Set in the city with its own Orchid garden huge pool the lobbies are amazing and the staff incredible  Stay in the Valley Wing they teat you like Queen and King   great food amazing staff  Rooms are beautiful and the views great also go to the Spa best i have found with the best Tea i have ever had

A great staycation for family with young children.  Fabulous!  Room - family room is spacious enough. I love the day bed. Much bigger than their picture show. Fridge space is good to stock food for the kids. Love the desk which could be lowered. Become a playstation for my toddler. Housekeeping is great. Good work to all staffs. Thank you.  Family floor - this is very helpful for me who struggled with a kid and a baby. Washing machine, dryer, hot water, high chair, bath toys, etc.   Buds - great to keep the kids busy.   Pool - love it. No soaking in cold cold water.   Staffs - friendly and helpful. Thank you.  Overall, best staycation I had.  Food - a little disappointing. Many choices at buffet but nothing fabulous....

My husband and I have just returned from spending three memorable days at the valley wing of the Shangrila Singapore. This oasis is located in a beautiful and convenient part of Singapore.  The decor is elegant and the garden outlooks particularly attractive.  The characteristic  which distinguishes this hotel is the professionalism and friendliness of its staff. We highly recommend this hotel.

Our family of four recently spent two nights at the Shangri-La Singapore. Overall it was very nice but for the money we spent I'm not sure we'll return. The location is nice - quiet and safe but it's a treck to even pick up some essential snacks/supplies for the kids. And you wouldn't visit the shop in the lobby as it's outright exorbitant - it looks good though! Check-in was pretty slow but it's not that big a deal. The Tower Wing room was way too small for us so we paid extra to get a Garden View room  which suited us more. The staff made up a bed and put some groovy teddy bears for the kids which was nice of them.  Pool is really great and breakfast buffet is plentiful. My husband and I had Afternoon Tea in the Rose Verandah which was just lovely, probably not as special as…

Review title: Amazing hotel set in magnificent garden
Review: Yes.. another Shangri-La Hotel review by me.. can’t get enough of them  This hotel is set within acres of beautiful land escapes gardens , a truly delightful relaxed setting   You have the choice of three wings .. Garden Wing, Loby Wing and the exclusive Valley Wing  If the budget allows it.. I highly recommend the Valley Wing for true indulgence   The Valley wing has its own separate arrival area and the lobby is truly beautiful  When we arrived we where greeted by friendly smiling front of house staff and they could not have done more to make our check in more simple. In fact we arrived at 9.30am, was told our room was infact ready, and we where invited to have breakfast as well.. with a breakfast menu which includes lobster, crayfish and caviar and many other wonderful dishes…

Check in was a breeze and we were served by the lovely Cory who was such a pleasant front office manager. Breakfast tends to get crowded at the Line with long queues. Otherwise we had a lovely stay to celebrate my son's birthday. Highly recommended for families with kids.

Stayed at this hotel for 4 nights after our Thailand holiday and before flying back to the UK. Expect so much more for the £250 plus we paid per night. Don’t get me wrong, the rooms are nice, gardens beautiful and lobby grand, but in my view there was a general feeling of apathy that ran right through the hotel. There were numerous niggles from the outset which we would have let go, but they all added to a sense of dissatisfaction. We had to complain about service at both The line restaurant and Waterfall where a basic order took 50 minutes to arrive and on one occasion was stone cold. We really expected so much more from this hotel chain, needless to say, we won’t be staying at any of their other hotels around the world

Loved this hotel.  Stayed in the Valley Wing.  Food was delicious and plentiful.  Decor and furnishings very nice.  The room was spacious.  The grounds are luscious.  Loved the concierge, front desk, Valley Wing servers.  Valley Wing was very quiet, probably not somewhere I would stay with my children, who are quite well behaved.  Although I did see children and love travelling with my children, I don't feel it is the best setting for children.  They would enjoy the Tower Wing more and I believe that there are more activities for them in the Tower Wing.  If you are trying to call a taxi or uber from the Valley Wing, do so early, as it took about 30 minutes - 45 minutes on two occasions to arrive.  Gym was nice.  We didn't eat breakfast in the Valley Wing restaurant, but rather…

Have stayed here before, Hotel and service is fantastic, from  check in to check out, hotel have got everything correct, good location to orchard Road shopping district, staff are great, restaurants fantastic, pool area is ok, Rooms are very clean and decorated very tasteful,

The hotel has a dining for 2 tasting experience in the garden, in an Orchid covered structure. The setting is unbelievable as it's intimate yet close to the hotel. Thanks to Stephen for his brilliant services and for making the evening so special. The menu is customise to suit taste and fresh produce, while the wine pairing is top class. The chef Mirko is a genius both in skill of cooking and explaining each course. I can say in absolute truth that it was the best few hours ever at a dining table. Needless to say I will be back.  Thanks to Thomas for facilitating at short notice, well done guys I am overwhelmed.

We checked in to the Shangri-La Hotel, Singapore after a long day travelling from Seam Reap, on arrival that took an hour though customs at Changi airport, we arrived at the the hotel and we were greeted by a friendly young lady at check in but as she was asking us questions, at the same time another staff member interrupted us asking for our passports and credit card, as this was happing another gentlemen came across and offered us a welcome drink, just a bit confusing and overwhelming. The check process was excruciating as there electronic sign-in wasn’t working and the two staff kept on laughing to this fact. The girl then escorted us to the lift, pushed the button and said enjoy your stay, considering that we had booked a grand club lounge, this was very impersonal. The club…

While the Shangri La is not the newest hotel it's still one of the very best.  It's in a great location and the service can't be beat.  We especially appreciate the service in the Horizon Club.  Andrea was especially helpful.  I'd definitely go back and would opt for the Horizon Club.  The Shangri La represents what all great hotels should be.

Review title: Sooooo lives up to it's name
Review: I can't think of anything bad to say about this hotel or its staff. We stayed there in Jan and again in March. The location is good, convenient to shops but not in the city. The lobby is very interesting, the rooms are impeccable, the pool, waterfall and gardens are a delight. The standard of food is excellent, and the elevators do not keep you waiting. The staff are efficient, polite, welcoming,informative, and above all, friendly. We had membership of the Horizon Club which is well worth the money; the food and drinks are mouth-watering, and there are views over the city from the lounge. Just perfect.

beautiful hotel ! this was indeed a 5 star hotel conveniently located near copious shopping malls on Orchard. This hotel was recently renovated in May 2017 and I feel in love the moment i stepped into the lobby. The front desk was efficient and seamless. We got to our room in the new Club wing and it was very sleek and comfortable. The room was a bit smaller than I thought but i loved the glass closets and the shower was perfect (especially after a humid day in SG).   The restaurants (Orgin, Nami, and Lobby Lounge) were all amazing and the service was impeccable. My favorite that I tried were the Steak tartare at Orgin, Wagyu and Sea urchin fish at Nami, and the chili crab at Lobby Lounge.  The breakfast buffet was also a dream come true with 16 different stations including an…

Hello  Thankyou for having my family  A lovely hotel, I did not think it is as good as the one in bkk. Most of the staff were friendly but only after they knew I was a diamond member. The staff at breakfast on the first day were very rude, I had to go directly to the head chief to ask him what the standards are expected of there staff. It was really bad, it was like the staff did not want to be there. This was at 6. 30 am in the morning. We were quiet shocked infact, we didn’t feel that we were in a shangrla. But on the second day it got better.  The gym is first class for a hotel. Pool area only fair.  The kids club is top class and the staff in there were of high quality, best through out the hotel.  There were also some issues, but staff did address them as best as they…

Stayed here for 4 nights with my family (ages ranging from 5 to 65) and had a wonderful experience. The staff were excellent and couldn't do enough to help you. The gym, pool and kids area were all first class. My only criticism is that at times the breakfast service was slow because the hotel was so busy.

FIRST RATE OPERATION --It is old and has been redone but without losing it's charm---this is the first Shangri-La built and the concept has done well--This place is very business and family oriented so it gets a little frenentic but we love it. We always get premium rooms and the Horizon club to make best use of the facilities.  My favorite is the S L in Hong Kong  becuse the premium rooms are on the same floor as the Horizon Club.

Review title: Outstanding service at the Valley Wing
Review: 7 star service from the beginning and cannot praise highly enough. All the team were first class and a special thank you to Raja and Vanessa making our time extra special. Scrumptious food and quality drinks. Fantastic large suites with everything you would need.

We stayed for 2 nights at the beginning of our holidays.  We chose the Garden Wing with a pool view as we wanted to enjoy sitting out on the balcony.  As expected from the Shangri-La, everything was excellent from the service to the facilities, pool, gym, restaurants and lounge bar. The staff are always friendly and helpful.  Knowing it was our Silver Wedding Anniversary trip, we were treated to flowers  and a cake - a nice and welcome touch.  Thank you

Stayed here for four days prior to starting a cruise. A beautiful hotel but very pricey when it comes to buying drinks and restaurant prices. We found it much better to enjoy the many restaurants Singapore has to offer.

Review title: First time back since the lobby renovations
Review: This is the hotel that tries very hard to impress, and very rarely fails to knock your socks off. This was my first visit since the lobby was renovated, and it was such a case of WOW for me that it was almost sensory overload. The lobby bar, the reception area, even the 2 turned tree root boles that stood guard on the front door were just inspired. The Bell Captain recognised me and we had a chat whilst we were waiting for a taxi, and his smile, his pride at my obvious enjoyment of the surroundings was so nice to see. One small hiccup, (certainly not the hotels fault) someones child had defecated in the pool, and we were asked to exit the pool whilst they shock treated it. I guess such a beautiful hotel will attract its share of careless parents...  Again, so well worth the…

I loved this hotel. Most 5 star hotels in Singapore are in a concrete jungle and swimming pools etc. are usually on the roof not exciting. However this hotel has wonderful gardens, orchids to die for, lovely pool area and plenty of places to sit in shade and lots of options for food. I would definitely stay again.

Review title: Great oasis a short walk to Orchard Road.
Review: Stayed recently for work and having stayed in other hotels in Singapore this is my new favourite. Big, plush and well laid out. Friendly check in staff and a great hotel room. Big, clean space with both a bath and separate shower which is rare in hotels these days. Big king bed with a great lounge chair and good desk space. Add in some free bottles of water which are a must in Singapore and the room was great all round. Pretty good wifi as well. Breakfast has an amazing range of options for all types of cuisine and a quick omelette counter.  The gym was huge with a great range of walkers, treadmills, pin machines and free weights. Plenty for me and one of the better hotel gyms I have been to. Very popular so get there early to make the most of it.  Large pool (didn't use it) and…

Having had quite high expectations for our stay at the Shangri-La in Singapore I was quite disappointed by the average customer service and tired rooms in the garden wing.  Please also be aware if you are in a rush for breakfast don’t have breakfast at the hotel.  I found it quite fitting that the restaurant the hotel provides breakfast at is called the line buffet because that’s where you will spend most of your time... standing in a line waiting to be seated! (Please see photos).  One highlight was the kids club, my daughter enjoyed it very much and the facilities and staff are amazing.  All in all I would describe it as an adequate stay but I won’t be returning... there are much better options in Singapore.

Review title: Beautiful Compound, lots of greenery and amazing staff
Review: We were warmly greeted by the service staff and served complimentary grapefruit juice. Loved the compound with pockets of greenery to walk around. Even though they were operating at full capacity, there were still many empty spaces that we can walk about in. Many different restaurants to choose from. They also have a children's BUD program that would work well for families with kids. The garden wing which we stayed at was clean and spacious. Although the rooms do look quite dated. The gym was large with a squat rack and lots of other equipment. We visited in the evening ( which was rather crowded ) and then the next day in the morning ( much much emptier ). Swimming pool was crowded but still had pockets of space to chill and relax. They also had a Koi pond and we enjoyed seeing…

It has been more than 10 years since I lasted visited this hotel but it was nice to find that much is the same in terms of service and amenity but also that the rooms have been updated very stylishly. It is well located to the Orchard Road shopping district and offers convenient shuttles. The pool area is large enough to not feel crushed by the fight for lounges. All around, it met every expectation.

Review title: IF YOU WANT FIVE STARS THIS IS FOR YOU.
Review: It is a very nice hotel with friendly staff.  However it was not my cup of tea you do pay premium price for everything.  Stay away from the $95 dinner it's not worth it and there is better value in in one of its restaurants.  We stayed two night on the way over and one night on our return.  A friend had organised the trip and had previously phone the hotel to ensure our booking were there.  On our return at 4pm (check in 2pm) our rooms were not ready and after waiting for a while they offered free drinks in the lounge which we took up.  Our rooms were finally ready at 5.15pm and they had upgraded us to other rooms. Probably the only ones they had.  When checking out the next morning I discovered the complementary drinks had been added to my bill.  This was an embarrassment for…

Review title: Excellent family resort in the middle of Singapore
Review: Shangri-La Singapore is an excellent option for family travel. The hotel has an excellent pool with a nice shallow area for young kids whilst also having a deep section cordoned off for adults. There’s a wonderful kids club (additional cost) which has wonderful indoor and outdoor play areas (including a water park) and cooking / drama / art classes). The buffet breakfast has a wide selection catering for Eastern and Western tastes and the in-room dining has excellent kids options. The hotel isn’t overwhelmed by kids either, there’s enough space for all hotel guests and the rooms are amazingly quiet. For a family friendly hotel, we did not hear any children either above, below or around us.  The hotel service is top notch. We were impressed from the moment our taxi stopped at the…

Review title: Simply perfect - this is a luxury hotel
Review: This is very rare I give a rating of five  This stay has been just perfect and even when I have had small issues they were perfectly handled.  The hotel is not cheap but it is worth the cost.  Service is perfect.  Facilities are exceptional  Executive lounge food and drinks are over the top.   The only real issue is that, if you are a bit lazy, you may not want to get out the hotel and explore SINGAPORE. You feel so good at this Shangri La and there is absolutely everything that you do not want to go.

Review title: 1 star at check-in... 5 stars with dining experience hence had to rate at 3 stars
Review: For the hotel reference, our confirmation # 141169241 for 2 nights Garden Wing room Staycation package on this Easter weekend. All stated clearly in the reservation email from Shangri-la itself  (not booked via 3rd party!) - Check in 2pm, King bed, breakfast for 2 for 2 days, $100 dining credit and late check out 4pm.  From arrival, here is the list of very fundamental things that you would expect from Shangri-la, a prestige 5 stars hotel, that HAD previously brought many beautiful memories for me and my husband.  But, all went wrong, spoiling our mood completely at the start of our anniversary staycation.   1) We arrived 2.40pm on 29 March and waited 15mins in the check-in queue, we are next in Q. There were 5 ladies serving 5 customers  at front desk but each took 10-15…

Good food, good service and most of all it is so value for money. Restaurant manager Mr Andreano recommend few of their popular dishes and my guest loves it. If you are looking for good authentic Italian food, Waterfall Ristorante Italino should be the place to visit. no regrets.

Review title: Best Italian Restaurant is at The Shangrila Hotel Singapore t - Waterfall Ristorante Italiano
Review: Waterfall Ristornate Italiano is one of the best Italian Restaurant I ever try. I went there with a group of eight and everyone loves the food. The restaurant manager- Mr Andreano Carbotti had arranged the menu according to our liking and taste . Service is excellent and most importantly the price is very reasonable.  I strongly recommend this restaurant for those who loves good Italian food and need not have to burn a big hole in their pocket. This is a very relaxing restaurant and the environment is very cosy.  So do visit Waterfall Ristorante Italiano which is located at The Shangrila Hotel Singapore.   The

The beautiful grounds and pool were the drawcard for us for a girls weekend, but I would come back for the service. We stayed at the Valley Wing where we were looked after by Raja and Aishah who were delightful and very helpful. Service was amazing. We had originally booked into the Horizon Club, but upgraded to Valley to include the Champagne Bar which was fantastic. The breakfast buffet at the Line offered an amazing array of international foods, but we could have chosen to eat at the quieter, more serene restaurant in the Valley.  The Line was very busy on the weekend. The rooms were very generously sized. The decor is very traditional, and the clientele older, but I would splurge for the Valley Wing  if you get the chance.

Bit far out but the Hotel overcomes this disadvantage by providing excellent facilities, food and service. The Horizon club is well worth the extra spend and nothing is too much trouble for the friendly staff. Have stayed before and will return.

We had a girls weekend away in Singapore and could not have picked a better place to stay. The Valley Wing was amazing, Rooms, bathroom and views were fabulous. The pool area is an oasis of calm. Stayed in many other hotels in Singapore but this one felt like a true resort.  Breakfast buffet was delicious and vast though the fit out was like a canteen and didn't quite fit in with the rest of the hotel. The shuttle was a bit hit and miss. It didn't always come at the stated times but still it is a good service to offer. The highlight for us though was the club lounge. Champagne and great selection of wines available. The food was average but the service particularly from the fabulous Raja and Aishah made our whole trip. They just made our stay feel like a dream. Thank you Raja…

Have visited numerous times through work, but stayed on with my Mrs. for some extra days before travelling on. Fast check in & out, welcoming, professional and efficient staff. Always willing with suggestions on where to eat and visit. The rooms are well presented and clean, with good connectivity i.e. plenty of USB ports for charging. Pool is amazing as too is the choice for breakfast. I often travel globally for work, but this has to be one of the nicest lobby’s of any hotel.

We decided to spend our 'cotton' wedding anniversary at the hotel.  From check in at the Horizon Club to check out, everything was done professionally and with a BIG smile. I cannot fault this place. Ms Janice Ang (Manager), Ms Rachael Wong and the rest of the team on the 24th floor did a suburb job of attending to our needs. The room was nice, room service quick and good. We never saw the room service crew, but bed were made and room cleaned.  The pool was big but not really for laps. Still we had a nice swim. Dinner at Orginsand Grill was great but that will be under my restaurants review. We wanted to try the 'Line restaurant' for breakfast but there was a line so we decided to have it at the Club floor. Breakfast was nice good range of local and western dishes. Overall very…

We had a superbe stay, as always, only that this time there was a little crisis involving hospitalisation of my 93 year old mother. The Valley Wing employees supported me in every way they could and gave me strength during a challenging time far away from home. When my Mum returned, the warmest welcome back you could possibly imagine was rendered to her. We truly were touched. This was not just professional customer service, this was genuine care !!

We recently had a staycation at Shangri la and stayed in one of the family rooms. This is one of the friendliest and most exciting places for families with kids. It comes with organic kids toiletries and an entire floor which caters mainly to family suites with 24 hours complimentary access to central, shared Pantry.  They have also got a huge indoor playground- Buds with slides, ball pool, sandpit, shooting areas.   Our check in was pretty quick and in house staff was quite helpful. You got to check their swimming pool with hot jacuzzi and trust me it was so relaxing.  We thoroughly enjoyed our meals at Waterfall restaurant and Buffet at Line with a  wide range of spread. Would definitely recommend it especially for families with kids.

Review title: Does what it says on the tin.
Review: Good hotel. Slight issue with the drainage system in the shower, but this did get rectified.  The selection at breakfast is outstanding, and a real credit to the hotel.  Check out service was very efficient. All round a good stay.

This hotel has everything you could want: excellent facilities, attentive staff, attractive rooms. However, it is location challenged. It is a long way from any of the major attractions in Singapore, except perhaps the botanical gardens. There is no shopping or restaurants close by. They have also closed their shop so you can not buy any souvenirs onsite. Orchard Road is a good walk away from the hotel and in the heat and humidity not something you want to do frequently. It seems to be primarily a business hotel catering to meetings so the location may not be a problem for their customers. As tourists, we would have hoped for a hotel closer to the major visitor spots.

We had an Italian dinner. Service was lousy to say the least. I had veal masseter and my wife linguine frutti di mare. Well. Wine was okay. The garden outstanding. The bar in the main lobby: good music, good Singapur Sling for $ 25.-/each.

Review title: Nice Hotel with a very good service.
Review: I've been in this hotel in March with my family and we've got very good service when checking in. The person who helped me very much during our stay was Mr. Swaran Muru. He is assistant Front Office Manager and very helpful. And I have to mention the person who present me to him but unfortunately I don't know his name. Maybe Mr Swaran can do that when reading this comment:)  Thank you for everything and take care Swaran.

Wonderful facilities, great bedrooms, nice pool area, great lobby staff, helpful and welcoming. Great location, just neat town, but a bit in a quiet street. Improvement needed in the service around the pool and at the Italian restaurant

We had a nice stay at the Shangri-La, but it should be nice for the price! We went with our 2 year old and chose it as it is billed as family friendly with the newly opened BUDS play zone. Although this was good we were disappointed guests still had to pay an additional $18 to use it and that only one adult per child was allowed, meaning we couldn’t all have fun together. The pool was nice with a little children’s play area. The breakfast was great, with loads of choice of western and Asian foods, freshly cooked eggs etc.   We stayed in the Valley wing, the room was nice and spacious and had a good view of pool and gardens. It was good that along with this we got complimentary cocktails and snacks at the bar. However as we weren’t allowed to take them to the room it made it hard…

Stayed in the Valley Wing at the end of a six star cruise. Some of the other cruisers were there. By common consent this is possibly the best hotel any of us had ever stayed at. And this was a group of wealthy  well travelled people. Cant recommend it enough.

My sister had pre arranged dinner for my birthday and she was assured of a surprise arrangement at the end of the meal. Dinner was good but when she tried getting staff's attention... it was to no avail and when she finally got their attention, she was presented with the bill to pay. After it was signed ....with much ambarassment my sister had to ask about the birthday surprise. The staff simply wrapped a piece of cake and handed over for takeaway. The expectation was set by restaurant staff at point of booking but not delivered. Family felt the birthday dinner ended unpleasantly and the surprise planned was not fulfilled. It did ruin the celebration mood. Dissappointed.

I stayed on march to traveling, i thing is a Great hotel, prefer location, all staff very helpfully, nice room, nice all the food . Overall is perfect, we will miss moment special in hotel, i loved it and i will back so soon.

the hotel is expensive but i can say that its worth it.  well repainted. good AC and excellent wifi connection. breakfast is good. at night the dinner its a little noisy because many people are talking in a loud voice..business people but its ok. as usual shangrila hotel is an excellent hotel.

This is our first visit to the Shangrila since its refurbishment and although I liked the new , I much preferred the old. Something of the style has been lost in the refurbishment process That said , its the people that make the real difference at Shangrila and the staff are as good as ever they were, they haven’t been refurbished 😀 Its well situated , well appointed and well run  We look forward to our next visit

My wife and I stayed at the Shangri-La from the 1-3 Feb. On arrival at 0800 after a long flight from the UK I was asked to confirm that my check in and room details were correct. My booking was for a Garden Wing Deluxe pool view with balcony. I was told that the room was not ready, which I fully accepted and was asked to return about midday, I checked again at midday and then again at 1pm, the room was still not ready. I was then informed by a member of staff that no rooms of this type were available. I pointed out that this booking had been made months earlier and had been confirmed on arrival as stated, I was then informed that the booking had been made by a travel agent, to which I asked what difference does that make, no explanation was given to me and were greeted with…

Review title: Spend a bit more, get a lot more
Review: It costs more to stay in the Valley Wing, but the extra cost is more than repaid by the sheer luxury.  Check in....................private check in for the Valley Wing.and a personal escort to the room. We asked for a late check out and it was arranged instantly,no hesitation  Room....................faultless. Vast room and bathroom. Good, quiet A/C and good Wi-Fi Excellent toiletries, lot of towels. Wide choice of teas in the room including a Nespresso machine..............................even a printer for a laptop!
