Food....................The breakfast selection in "The Line" is good but reduced from what it used to be.  The A La Carte menu in the Summit Rom is faultless and the service impeccable. The complimentary champagne, cocktails and canapes in the Valley Wing lounge…

This was the second time my wife and I stayed in the Singapore Shangri-La Hotel’s Valley Wing. As before, everything was excellent. The staff were, without any exception, absolutely charming, the room (and the bed) were extremely comfortable, the breakfast in the Vallet Wing’s exclusive restaurant was all that one could possibly want. Afternoon tea, drinks and canapes were all included and were very welcome. There was nothing that could be faulted and we would, most certainly, stay there again. (Singapore makes a very welcome stopover on the long flight between Europe and Australia/New ZeLand.)

Review title: The best hotel I have ever stayed in
Review: I have been to the Shangri-La many times over the last 30 years, and always rated it very highly.   A recent visit confirmed this view.    One of its good features is the Horizon Club, open to some privileged guests for breakfast and pre-dinner drinks     Part of the charm of the Club was the attentive staff asking whether one would like a second cup of coffee or second glass of wine, always in a quiet but friendly manner. In the last year, some "designer" has wrecked this.   One now has to get one's own coffee from a sophisticated machine - after about four visits one gets the hang of it, but it can't smile or comment on the probability of rain, although the coffee is good, as fresh beans are used. But the real foolishness lies in the machine which dispenses wine.   No further…

Review title: Good Start to the Day at Shangri La
Review: My family had breakfast at the Line this morning with my little baby girl. With my daughter with us, we needed special orders for plain porridge without any seasoning etc etc... we are grateful that Mr Sham, a staff serving us was efficient, polite and always with a smile! 😁 A good start to the day at Shangrila 👍🏻

I really enjoyed staying at Valley Wing. Afternoon tea and champagne with piano playing at the lobby lounge was a real treat. Breakfast had good spread and dinner buffet at the line was decent. What really made this hotel stand out from other 5* hotels in Singapore was their management. They genuinely care about guest experience at the hotel. Even there might be some minor issues during your stay, they gave no excuse but address to them to make sure guest satisfaction. This is the hotel I always want to re-visit.

Stayed at the Valley wing.  Everything is beyond perfect.  Tiny details to nurture and excite are always there.  Like the bon bons next to the bed, that are clearly made in house and designed to be different.  The spacious rooms, the delicate canapes with drinks......I could go on....my suggestion is to stay there!

Review title: Best Hotel in Singapore! A must stay!
Review: I come to Singapore on business and pleasure often and the “Shang” (as locals call it ) is by far the best hotel. The staff is extremely attentive and polite. Special mention are bellhops Elvis and Bani, and manager Jonathan Sim. Rooms are very clean and modern. The grounds are amazingly lush, it’s like leaving in the middle of a tropical rain forest. The breakfast buffet is amazingly good and one can find a wide range of local and classic western food. I love the gym which is well equip and one never has to wait because they have so many machines. Did I mention that they have great live music at their lounge off the hotel lobby?  I will definitively recommend anyone looking for a leisure or business hotel.

After a long flight from Sydney it was so lovely to treat ourselves to a few nights in Singapore before heading to the Maldives. We are Golden Circle members and had very high expectations of Shangri-La Singapore and they were met and exceeded. The foyer area is visually stunning, the check in service impeccable and we were upgraded to a gorgeous room where they had roses, a cake and card greeting us a happy anniversary.   Everything from the furniture, marble bathroom with separate tub and rain shower head to the beautiful bright pink flowers growing on the balcony and the HUGE corner balcony overlooking a small forest of trees and part of the city skyline was just outstanding.   Very Convenient location for tours and about an 8 min shuttle ride to the ultra expensive Japanese…

Second stay here, this time in tower wing with club floor access. Again this is an outstanding hotel, spotlessly clean, helpful and considerate staff. Food and beverage excellent. The pool area is one of the best attaches to a hotel we have stayed at.

we stayed at this great hotel and had a fantastic  week as we had flown the grand kids in from the gold coast there was so much to do for them and yourself s Hotel was very clean and breakfast superb ,

We had chicken rice at the lobby lounge whilst having our meeting."EXCELLENT" Tid bits are extremely top! And i think they give small kuih with coffee or tea Shang rila Singapore lobby lounge are truly above in service esp the staffs are so courteous and wonderful The beverages and foods are wonderful Parkings are easy and thumbs up Can't wait to return!!! 😀😀😀

We stayed for 6 nights in the Valley wing at the end of a 8 week amazing holiday in Australia and NZ. The service from the staff in the valley wing is nothing but perfect !! They greet with a smile and so eager to make every moment of your stay perfect. The breakfast in the summit room is amazing. The pool and restaurants are very nice as well. Hopefully we will return for another holiday in this amazing hotel.

It has recently undergone a refurbishment. Now offering itself as a kid friendly destination - complete with massive playground next to the pool and a kids corner on some floors (where you can grab stuff like bassinets, diapers and milk bottles.   The disadvantage of this hotel is that it’s rather far from MRT stations. It’s on a quiet street and the grounds are enormous, but you need a cab to get to most places.

3nights stay at the end of star clippers cruise , the luxurious spacious room was a fantastic ending to our holiday . The staff are so caring and courteous making you feel like a friend visiting their wonderful hotel . Beautiful quiet setting yet so near the hustle and bustle of orchard road  a good base to explore Singapore .

We so enjoyed our last visit that when we decided to spend a few days in Singapore on our return from Australia this was our only real choice. The gardens and pool are such a great feature of this hotel and since we last visited in 2010 there has been a great deal of renovation to the other wings. Valley is rather special. We requested a room overlooking the lovely gardens so were disappointed on arrival to be shown to a City view room. However, in no time at all we were then shown to one on the garden/pool side which was perfect. Standard of service for breakfast was on some days not as good as previously (we were there at the very busy Chinese New Year time on each visit) and one had to remind staff that not all things ordered had appeared. Always dealt with charmingly but not…

Used this hotel on a stopover while travelling to Australia. Great location within walking distance of Orchard Rd shops and restaurants. The pool area and fitness centre are excellent and the rooms are spacious and luxurious. The restaurant facilities are good but all of them are pricey.

This is the second time my wife and me have stayed at this hotel in the last 4 years and can highly recommend. The quality of the rooms and service are first class the location is ideal for local shops and restaurants if your visiting Singapore I would advise staying here

Very well located with an amazing playground for the kids ( in and outdoor ) , the pool side is amazing as well with decent Italian restaurants on a side - really enjoyable stay - booking is a must as it is quite successfully booked

Luxury or 5 stars will always be subjective based on your own experiences in hotels and cruises.  Shangri-la Singapore is really transitioning from a luxury hotel to a new city style resort and this is changing all the three wings.  I have stayed at this hotel often and most times in the Valley Wing but over times have stayed in all three wings.  Most of the Shangri-la Valley Wing Staff as others have mentioned are good really good.  They are engaging and service orientated and appear to be really genuine.  Remembering that often Shangri-la Singapore is one of the most expensive hotels in Singapore its worthwhile looking at the product rather than the staff.    The Valley Wing like the rest of the hotel is transitioning to the new city resort style operating model.  The dress…

Shangri La is a very nice high end hotel. It is located in a quiet area but quite close to the busy Orchard road. The grounds are big with nice gardens. There are some good restaurants especially their chinese one.

Review title: What to say?  It's the Shang
Review: We stayed here before.  This time over Chinese New Year in a Garden View room.  Not sure they are worth the premium over Tower rooms but I've always wanted to stay in one.  The room, service, cleaning, food and facilities were perfect.  We went to breakfast before 8 am and it was not crowded.  As always breakfast was fantastic, incredible choice of excellent quality.  Only the coffee is awful which seems to be the rule in SE Asia so stick to tea.  There were queues for breakfast around 9 am, common sense tells you it doesn't make sense for everyone to come at the same time when there is full occupancy.  They did open up extra venues for breakfast.  We didn't fancy fighting for the buffet dinner over CNY (or paying a premium price) so tried their Italian restaurant The Waterfall.…

We stayed 3 nights in the Valley wing. The standard of service and the quality of food was exceptional. We particularly enjoyed the breakfast which had a wide variety of food on offer. Canopies and champagne were also very welcome at 5pm! The front desk were extremely helpful in suggestions on how best to utilise our time during our brief visit to Singapore. Our room was beautifully appointed and spotlessly clean. We would recommend the Valley wing if you want a little more quiet and attention.

Not to be missed ,stayed in a suite with our 4 children.The children were never short of activities.Great pool and customer service,immaculately clean ,food was delicious especially room service .will return soon

Review title: One of the best hotels ever
Review: We used it about 4 years ago but imagine it will be still as good as when I went there We stayed for 3 days while we were moving into a house near there  The food was amazing and many many many many choices  The pool was spacious and room keeping was excellent  The views were great and it was right next to the beach Also the sights around were excellent and would cater for any family that went with many activities to do anywhere  There was an elephant show with model elephants which was nice and the docks were nice with the yacht club overall the excellent stay and would go there any day

We stayed in a Valley Wing Room for three nights prior to embarking on a cruise. What a superb start to a vacation.  We were met at the airport and whisked into a separate wing of the hotel where we were checked into the hotel in our room by Nora, the Valley Wing Client Services Manager.  Thanks to Nora we immediately felt comfortable and welcome. The hotel is fabulous throughout however the Valley Wing is extra special.  An exceptional sanctuary within which to relax and feel special.  The staff in the Valley Wing work extremely hard to meet your every need and their attention to detail is first rate. Breakfast in the dining room in the Valley Wing and evening canapes and drinks in the Champagne bar there was perfect.  Special mention to Hari who really is an asset in the wing,…

Convenient location and extremely kids-friendly. They have just renovated the rooms as well. Very, very nice. The new play room for kids is huge with an indoor jungle gym, cooking station for kids, etc etc. Friendly staff and great take away coffee bar with lots of yummy snacks and treats and gifts for bringing home. I loved it!

Review title: A to AAA then leaving with a AA (hotel, activities, Castle theme room)
Review: We spend 9 days in Singapore for 2018 CNY celebration. Traveling with young children (less than 2 and 4 years old), we spend our holiday in different hotels. 2 nights at W Sentosa Cove, 2 nights at Ocean. We Suite, 2 nights at Shs6, and 2 nights at Westin. Overall Shangri-la is my most favorite in this trip, followed by Ocean and W, than Westin.   We had 2 amazing nights here at the Shangri-la.   Though Shangri-la is a bit of distance from Orchard road, but for our 3 days and 2 nights here, we stayed here (except for one of the lunch we had nanny taking care of kids while we were out to Odette for lunch). Shangri-la is just too much fun for the kids.  We arrived around 2, but finally checked in after 4:30pm because the castle theme room was not ready. There were 5 theme rooms…

Shangri-La Hotel is one of the best hotels in Singapore. Truly friendly staff, excellent service and amenities. Supurd restaurant with a wonderful beffét.  It truly feels like home away from home. Considering that it is situated in one of the worlds mega-cities, it's absolutely fabulous that you have such a beautiful pool area and that it is so quiet.

Review title: Shangri-la Valley Wing is like a fairytale
Review: Shangri-la Valley Wing is the best hotel in the world. The service and hospitality are outstanding and not comparable to any other hotels in the world. You are treated like kings and queens! The breakfast is world class. I especially like the start with a delicate fresh mango cut in nice pieces. The rooms are spacious and extremely clean. The beds are superb. Nothing can beat their service and hospitality. Everyone is so helpful and caring whatever your needs are!!!  I just love to return to this hotel and it is like coming home!!! I just love it. More than highly recommendable.  Jan Vatsvaag

Just a great hotel with impeccable service from the moment you get out of your taxi until you leave, they really do know how to run hotels, we have stayed at a few of theirs and they all offer the same great level of service. Rooms, breakfast simply divine although breakfast can get a little chaotic with everyone walking around the buffet getting their own food. On the first night suffering from jet lag we opted to eat in the Lobby bar area, I cannot recall exactly what the dish was but it was what turned up was basically a couple of poor looking chicken thighs in a watery mixture. Anyhow I turned it back and opted not to eat anything else. It was poor in my opinion. Next night we ate in the Italian waterfall restaurant which was very good, hopefully I can post a separate review…

This is a pleasant hotel, though slightly hard to locate. Staff is the best plus point about the hotel, they will remember your name even if they only met you once. Shangri La is a notch above the rest. Loved our stay here.

Our experience at the Shangri-La was exceptional in every sense!  For ease, we had arranged a van airport pick-up through the hotel. It was easy to find the staff member upon exiting customs and our vehicle was ready as soon as we were. The only fault here is there was no bottled water in the vehicle.  Upon arriving at the property, two registration attendants greeted us curbside and presented our 2 year old with a flower for his birthday! They then escorted us directly to our room and checked us in IN our room! #SERVICE  We had a garden wing pool view room (980). I had specifically requested a corner room as I heard the patios were much larger - indeed it was! We had a ton of space outside, with two chairs, a table and private lounger. The room itself was very well appointed…

I only stayed one night. The service was second to none. I think they checked on me three times to make sure everything was going good. They have a buffet that is on par with los Vegas. The next time I pass through here I will try to stay here again.

Great staff, great rooms. Breakfast is unbelievable....be prepared to be stuffed to the rim! Toothbrush, toothpaste, shampoo, conditioner, body wash, towels, hair bands, hair dryer, coffee machine, ear buds etc etc all provided in room. Concierge very helpful...ask them to get taxi for you...it’s easier! Nice pool too if you have time to relax! Lobby is beautiful.

I just had another wonderful stay at the Valley Wing at the Shangri La with my husband and two kids (9, 11). it’s expensive but the quality of the rooms and the inclusions make it worthwhile for a bit of indulgence. The breakfast in the Summit Room is wonderful, such good service from the staff, they make you feel like royalty. The on tap Veuve and excellent canapés and afternoon tea food is lovely. Nora the VW manager runs a very tight ship and made sure that she reached out before we arrived to see if we needed anything. Everything we asked for was done perfectly with a little extra added on top. Our check in was smooth. The staff were generally excellent with the exception of one grumpy older server who ignored us when we sat down for evening drinks (maybe because we had…

We were in the hotel in 3 rooms with my family with 6 children . We love the hotel , the pool , the service .   The buffet breakfast  was fantastic , but we avoided because we book the room without breakfast and paying for it separately was very expensive .  Excellent hotel for vacations and for business

Review title: Very nice hotel. Good location. Best Hotel lobby I’ve ever seen.
Review: For sure a top hotel in Singapore.  Location is not as central as a few other properties.  However, a pleasant 10 min walk to the MRT station. Horizon club very nice with excellent food selection for both breakfast and evening appetizers.  Note , they mention a dress code for the Horizon Club , business casual , however they do not enforce this policy.  We saw many people who clearly did not adhere to the dress policy.  Too bad they let a few people ruin the atmosphere of the Horizon Club.

I stayed at the Shangri-la on a recent trip to Singapore and enjoyed my stay. I got in late after 40 hours of traveling and incredibly slow immigration at the airport. The cool pink grapefruit juice they gave me at check in was refreshing.  The room was very comfortable with a firm mattress which was great for my back. The hotel is also very quiet, I never heard any sound from another room. I was there the week before Chinese New Year and the decorations in the lobby were beautiful.

As is typical the lobby area of the Singapore Shangri-La is simply spectacular!  At night there is live entertainment in the lobby lounge adding to the ambience.  The rooms feature a bay window design and are generally spacious.  There are 5 restaurants on the property. The grounds are spacious with a large pool and tennis courts. The location is close to the Orchard Road shopping area, but is a mile or two away from the major tourist destinations.

Review title: Excellent Attitude - Making you feel at home
Review: We stayed for 1 night at Shangri- La at Orchard in the Tower Wing. Greeted warmly during check in which make you feel at home. Room size was good and room were very clean. Rooms were refurbished. I cannot say the same for Line and Shang Palace as they do not seems to be attentive or service oriented especially during breakfast when there were plenty of guest in the restuarant.... Hotel offer bus shuttles to Orchard shopping during the day and also to major offices in the morning as well. It is about 10 mins walk to Ion Orchard.

The hotel is well located within a 15 min walk of both Orchard Road and the Botanical Gardens.  We understand that the hotel underwent a major refurbishment in 2017,  and it definitely sparkles!  The staff were very customer friendly, professional and very helpful.  The gardens around the hotel are lovingly tended and orchids abound.  The swimming pool is a feature in itself.  The rooms are well appointed with tea and coffee making facilities, a fabulous shower and a very comfortable bed.  A lot of choice for places to eat in the hotel, for breakfast, lunch, afternoon tea or just a snack.   Thoroughly recommend.

Review title: Arrogance and complacency does not make a 5 star hotel
Review: My family (two adults, two children) recently spent one night at this hotel taking advantage of one of their "Family Fun"-packages. Well, what a disappointment! The hotel recently opened their newly refurbished "Family Rooms" and a quite wonderful kids' club area (which our kids loved). Sadly, the family rooms are not so wonderful, unless you consider a "family" two adults and only one child. We booked a staycation with two children (8 and 10) and found - to our surprise - when we checked in that one of our children was expected to sleep in the same bed as the parents. This is NOT pointed out on the website and the family rooms are basically marketed on the basis of false advertising. The rooms are too small for an extra bed and the hotel did not attempt to move us to a…

Amazing place to stay you have a pool and beach on your doorstep  I suggest getting the room with the view  The buffet breakfast has so much option  Great for kids as there is so much for them to do  I really enjoyed my stay

My wife and I were travelling back from a business trip/holiday in Australia and stayed here. We were checked in by Janice who was delightful and very helpful. She was a fantastic representative for the hotel! Our room was excellent and beautifully fitted out. The grounds are lovely, especially the orchid area. Plenty of places to eat and drink. We really look forward to coming back again; a perfect choice when you visit Singapore! Thank you.

This is the jewel in the crown for the Shangri-La  hotel chain regarded as one of the worlds finest hotels in the world there are 3 sections to this hotel recommend the Garden Wing as all rooms have a balcony staying in this hotel is not cheap but as most people know Singapore itself is not a cheap destination to visit.

Review title: Beautiful lobby lounge and attentive service
Review: We enjoyed our afternoon drinks at the lovely lounge with the amazing service crews. The chair is so comfortable and those sunlight give it some adding points. Best lounge I have been so far.  Oh they have wine inspired tea selection as well, tasted superb!  Definitely will come back again.  Thanks for the lady manager kamika, her service teams for their hospitality.

Great hotel with nice rooms. The lobby is very nice with some nice artwork. Staff are friendly. Rooms are very large and very comfortable. Pool area is very relaxing. Breakfast is pretty good but ambience of restaurant is a little out of place with rest of hotel.

Review title: Total Joy at The Shangri-La, Singapore
Review: Another fabulous stay at this wonderful hotel.  We have been visiting here for years and just love returning.  We usually stay in the Valley Wing these days, but have stayed in all 3 wings over the years and always great to see so many of the staff who have been there for years. As mentioned there are 3 separate wings, all are quite lovely, but the advice really is to research each of them to see which appeals as all offer something very different. Lots of options for families with younger children too. We were delighted to see the new Tower Wing following the major renovations.  Somehow they have managed to incorporate exquisite modern design on a grand scale without losing the serenity and that special Asian essence of the Shangri-La.  The new Lobby is wonderful.  We tried the…

Review title: OK hotel with advantages and disadvantages
Review: I stayed for business about one week in the SL SIN.   1. Service Checkin was average, took some time until it was my turn despite the queue being quite small. Room was not ready but I waited in the lobby and was picked up when room was ready. That was ok.  The service throughout the hotel is good and comparably attentative.  The room service is ok but not outstanding. Despite my numerous reminder that the hair dryer was missing, they failed to provide one. Cleaning was not always without issue, but in general ok.   2. Room Bed, linen and pillows are good.  I booked a king size and was provided twin bed room - a bit of a disappointment.  The bathroom is of decent size and was nice.  Best working spot with desk in front of the window overlookin Singapore.  3. Facilities I used…

Review title: Still a great hotel but breakfast queues need addressing
Review: Stayed here for the fourth time and thoroughly enjoyed it. The hotel pool area really feels like an island resort which considering the location in the centre of Singapore is special. Service Is as expected with Shangri-La and amazing.  The only low point was the breakfast queuing system. It is really broken and the management need to fix this. Waiting up to 30 minutes to get a table is unacceptable especially when approximately half the tables are empty. There simply aren’t enough staff to organise things promptly for guests. It didn’t use to be this way so please fix ahead of my next visit.

One of the best hotels I've ever stayed in. Beautiful rooms and the service can't be beat. The spa was lovely and the pool amazing. We loved the food, especially the in room dining! We will definitely be back!

We always like stopping over in singapore for a few days on our way home to and from New Zealand. This time we spent a few nights at the shangri la in orchard. It’s a good location, walking distance to major shopping centres but also far enough from The bustle or orchard road. The newly renovated rooms are nice and there are plenty activities for kids. The only problem we had was the internet in our room, we had no signal from our bedroom, only in lounge area on the otherwise of the suite, I alerted staff about the problem but it was never resolved, I eventually gave up asking but in a way it was good as I got a lot more reading done.

We stayed in the Valley Wing of the Shangri La hotel and as soon as we arrived we realised we had arrived in luxury!  From being greeted by Vanessa and delivered to our room to being waved goodbye by Nora, the Wing Manager, we had a fantastic experience.   Breakfast taken in the Summit Room was a beautiful start to the day, afternoon tea was available,  but we didn’t indulge, but we did enjoy the very professional care of Rajan in the Champagne Bar in the early evening with vodka martini, Champagne, gin and tonics and, of course, the famous Singapore Sling. All created to perfection.  This hotel and in particular the Valley Wing offers impeccable service and attention to detail.  Our only criticism is it is very expensive to eat in the hotel restaurants..

Review title: We found our new favourite hotel in Singapore
Review: We stayed as a family for several days in a Tower Wing Horizon Club Grand Premier King room.  Pro's:  1.  Amazing service.  We arrived off an early flight from Europe (8am), our transfer was waiting for us, and at the hotel we were whisked to the club lounge to have drinks and eat while staff checked us in.  Seamless, which is rare (and extra appreciated) when traveling with kids.  Check-out was similarly stress-free, and we were allowed a late check-out.    2. The staff at the club lounge were fantastic.  They helped organise a nanny.  They helped cleaning baby bottles and warming milk.  Nothing was too much, and they did everything with a smile.  They made the stay for us.  3. Club lounge itself was great - lots of food at various times of day, and a decent breakfast (and…

We recently booked a 2 night staycation at the Shangri La Orchard for my birthday, but also for something different to do with my 3 year old Daughter and 9 month Son. As a Diamond member we have stayed in many of the Shangri-La locations around the Asia region, and like them this visit did not disappoint. The newly refurbished Tower Wing and kids club (Buds) had just opened and we booked one of the 5 family themed rooms (Space) which was amazing. So as well as a deluxe room for Mum and dad there is a second bedroom attached for the kids which includes an accessible tunnel between the two rooms, as well a kids area to play and eat plus lots of kids amenities. Each theme is different and our one being the Space theme had a spaceship bunk bed which my daughter absolutely loved! …

There are a lot of good hotels in Singapore. What stood out for us with the Shangri-La on our recent stopover was the welcome. We've travelled plenty with the kids, but the journey from Frankfurt to Singapore didn't go as smoothly as usual. Our 7 year old was unwell on the flight and then sick in the taxi on the way in. There was a part of us that just wanted to get home to Australia at that point.  That all changed the moment we arrived at the Shangri-La. A lovely gentleman greeted us and introduced us to our designated representative. It was only 8am, so we were expecting the normal offer to use the facilities until our room became free, but no - they took us straight to a smaller room that was free and allowed us to use that. What a huge difference it made, to be able to sort…

Review title: Shangri -La ( Valley Wing ) is possible one the best hotels we have stopped in .
Review: We do emphasis the Valley Wing , everything was 5 * from the Doorman in the traditional uniform ,Receptionists ,Food /Beverage Staff, >>>so welcoming and professional in their execution of their duties .The suite was huge ,with all the comforts of a 5* luxury Hotel PLUS ++  We only had breakfast which was excellent .If using this hotel as stopped over , the pool area , sun loungers etc , was great place to recharge your batteries after a long flight . They had a policy of NO  children under 12 when we stopped , so check first , cannot wait to return

The welcome we received on our arrival was wonderful and we were accompanied to the Horizon Club Lounge where the check in process was easy and relaxed. We had stayed in a few Shangri-la hotels before, but this was the first visit to this particular hotel. We stayed 16 nights in the Tower Wing Horizon Club Deluxe Room.  We were belatedly celebrating our wedding anniversary and were treated to a lovely surprise cake in our room. It really made our day. Thank you so much. The room was pleasant enough but on the small side for a long stay. There was nowhere to sit other than on the bed or one small uncomfortable desk chair. After a few nights we asked for some comfortable chairs to sit in but as the room was so small we were told they would not fit. We were moved to a corner room…

Exceeded my expectations! Clean beautiful large rooms, The bed sheets and comfy pillows are to die for! Turn down service with chocolates on the pillow. Quality bathroom toiletries. Staff very helpful as is the doorman and other door staff. I cannot fault any if my recent experience at this wonderful hotel.

We were so happy to have spent our holiday in Shangri-La hotel. Overall everything was on point from the beginning until the end of our trip. Although there are many visitors staffs touch is still personal and you are warmly greeted when you arrive.  Our room was at the tower wing. It was new and spacious and had a nice view over the city. Next time I would book a room from the garden wing because it's so special. Something to improve would be a pillow menu and slippers to use at the pool area. And maybe to remove desk from the window because it's blocking best view.  Service was excellent. Concierge was helpful in any questions.  There are many restaurants to choose from. The Line is a buffet restaurant but you definitely have to try its variation of different foods and tastes.…

Everytime i visit Singapore i stayed here and when i moved stayed in the residents plus i keep coming back for weekend stays and the lovely line resutrant. Service, food, facilites and location to orchard road makes it unbeatable.

Review title: Obviously a 5 star hotel but is it worth the money?
Review: I stayed for 3 nights in the newly refurbished tower section of the hotel and while it was obviously really nice I'm not convinced it was worth the money.  I had no complaints about the room as they were amazing and the general decor and finish of the hotel are top class.  However, the location is a bit out of the way and the most disappointing thing was the quality of the breakfast.  It seems that they think that quantity mean quality in Singapore as I found this at other hotels.  To be fair to them it's because they need to cater to a wide variety of cultures.  However, most of the quality was at best average.  Compared to the 5 star hotels in other countries I've been to it was the quality that you would expect to get at a 3 star hotel.  For example:  - There was no fresh…

Stay here over the weekend 20-22/1/18 to celebrate my mothers birthday. First impression is great , really meets the standard of shangrilla. Our check in was handled well by mr jacky at the reception, he even showed us all the way to our room.  Our room was really immaculately clean and nice . A birthday cake was sent by mr sya after check in really nice gesture . Great view from room . Only let down we had was there was water leaking from the toilet ceiling occured over 3 times over hours interval even after maintainace had done something. Event was promptly handled by maintance ( we we given a $100 dining voucher as apology for the trouble ) . Our room was changed and this was handled by ms rina and kim ( sry hope its the right name) the process was smooth and professional .…

Review title: Its still an amazing place to stay
Review: Shangri la Singapore is among my favorite hotels in the world. Always like the great service, the swimming pools, the food and more. This was the first time I stayed here since the renovation of the tower wing. We had a Tower Wing horizon Club Grand premier room, which gave acces to the Horizon club. The club is certainly worth the extra money you pay for it with nice food and drinks. With my little child we had during cocktail hours club acces from 5.00-6.30. From 6.30-8.00 small children were not allowed, which I can understand. Although it was pity for us. The service in the club was very good. It was only pity that they didn't service anymore real cocktails anymore except Singapore Sling. But there are plenty of bottles of drink so its possible to create your own cocktail. …

It is my second visit to this hotel. Since last time it has been completely refurbished (I loved it the first time!!!!!) The Deco is very modern but still traditional, very classy. The large bed is extremely comfortable (I won t start on the linens !!!!) the room spacious with view on the garden and the pool, the bathroom very luxurious. The location is super : a little away from downtown so quiet but you still can walk towards shops. The staff is really nice and efficient. I highly recommend it as all the other Shangri-La.

Best indoor garden I have ever seen! I would suggest booking the indoor garden side rooms with balcony. Room service exceeded expectations with the beautiful table setup. The staff was very welcoming.

Review title: A resort experience close to Orchard Rd
Review: We initially booked connecting rooms in the tower, based on internet reviews that said they were freshly renovated etc. After the first night, which felt like a business trip in any high rise hotel, we moved to connecting rooms in the garden wing. These were perfect for our family get away in Singapore city. Fresh air and a usable balcony the rooms were spacious and well fit out. Plenty of storage to unpack our clothes. Our room had a small couch and coffee table inside. The kids room had a small table that was perfect for room service dinner. Our children loved the buffet breakfast, water park with wet and dry play areas, large pool with deep and shallow areas, child sized robes and a teddy.  The location of the hotel was great for Orchard Rd shopping and to get back and…

Review title: Still a lovely place to stay
Review: Shangri-La Singapore has maintained its quality throughout the years. Service standards are high and the room I had at the Garden Wing was ever so comfortable. Blissful sleep - very comfy mattress, lovely lovely pillows. Spacious bathroom, lovely amenities. Breakfast buffet is excellent.

Review title: Vacation hotel in the middle of city
Review: Shangri-la is centrally located with only 5 min walk to orchard road. Still a hotel in a silent area with excellent pool area for relaxing morning before shopping in the afternoon. Rooms are spacious and nice. Balconies really nice. Nice buffet BF even if busy. Don’t miss the teppanyaki, not open now but is coming back. Good choice for a stay in great singapore.

We had 4 days in Singapore before travelling on to Australia. The hotel was fabulous in every way from the Staff, Rooms, Gardens, Pool and location. The staff were very helpful and attentive and even for the size of the hotel with lots of functions going on around the hotel the food was exceptional from Breakfast, Bar Snacks to Dinner. We had every bit of luxury you needed. Hope to return soon.

This hotel is so lovely. We have stayed many times and our most recent trip did not disappoint. The quality of the accommodation, restaurants and the friendliness and professionalism of the staff is excellent. The service in the Valley Wing is exceptional. The staff are friendly and accommodating. Even the booking process was smooth and easy.   I laughed when I read reviews from people suggesting children should be banned from the Valley Wing (as though some sort of illicit substance). The way the staff treat families and young children are what sets this place apart. Kids enjoy feeling a bit special too. I remember staying here when I was younger and as a result, I don’t intend to stay anywhere else in Singapore.   This hotel is exceptional and sets an extremely high standard.…

Review title: absolutely stunning, service like no other!
Review: My girlfriend & I have traveled the world and this was BY FAR the best service we have ever received staying at a hotel..EVER! We stayed in the valley wing and we could no fault a single thing from the room, the food and of course the amazing staff. I had just flown in from Thailand and was sick, but throughout the night it got worse to the point i was bed ridden, the staff arranged a doctor for me that hands down was the best doctor i have ever met, within 24 hours he visited the hotel 3 times for a check up and I had gone from bed ridden to almost 100%, without his help, and the help of the staff I would of been stuck in bed for days. i couldn't be thankful enough to the Dr and staff and Shangri La Valley Wing. We now will only ever stay here when in Singapore!

We began our month-long visit to S.E. Asia with a stay at the Shangri-La Hotel in Singapore.  It met and exceeded our expectations.  1. The service was warm and beyond accommodating.  Special shout out to Lorielle and Cory Ann part of the front desk staff the met our needs superbly and consistently.  2. We enjoyed breakfast at Line Buffet every morning.  3.  Book the Garden Rooms if possible.  4. Pool staff (Ramesh especially) are on it.  Be sure to claim loungers early. 5. Orchard Rd. shopping close by; you can walk to it.  One last note; keep a sweater or jacket handy if hanging out in the lobby...they keep it pretty chilled there.

Walking into the entrance lobby our first impression was "Wow!"  Lovely warm welcome, really good room with large balcony overlooking the city.  This hotel provided everything we needed and more.  We had a late evening snack in the bar which was excellent, the breakfast was good with a huge selection of dishes.  Our only complaint?  we should have stayed longer.

Review title: A resort in the middle of Singapore
Review: We thought we were just booking into a city hotel.. but were surprised this Shangri-La is actually a fabulous centrally located resort. The pool is fabulous, the service excellent and the garden rooms were great.  Highly recommended for families. The buffet is also an experience!

Just came back from a wonderful 2 night stay in the Valley Wing. The accommodation was exceptional as was the service provided by all the hotel staff. We were very well looked after with special mention to Iris and Edward C. This was our second stay and not the last. I would highly recommend this hotel.

First visit here since the recent upgrade of the Horizon club and a number of other upgrades including the lobby lounge.  The Shangri-LA have done a excellent job at upgrading the hotel, it was well overdue. Now time for some feed back from our 5 day stay.  From the collection at the airport in the Hotel Mercedes ( and very nice it was and the driver was too ) to the check in at the Horizon club nothing to fault their. The rooms are far better than last time, and we really liked the new style. They do however seem smaller and the positioning of the bed at a angle was little strange. Other than that room service was 100% the cleaning girls 100% also. The new Horizon club is a vast improvement and a great new layout. This time round it was all self service for drinks  alittle like…

We flew into Singapore with the family but had a series of business meetings to attend during our visit. We chose to stay at the Shangri-La because it was one of the very few hotels with nanny services. Our 7 year old and 2 year old were looked after well whilst we attended our business meetings during the day. The hotel is beautiful and has a number of excellent restaurants, lovely gardens and walkways.

Review title: all and more, except those bloody entry cards
Review: everything is perfect, the greeting, the rooms, the service, the wifi, the people, the gardens, the food, the high tea, the facilities, even the coffee. and then there was the outdated card to open the doors like every other hotel. wiped it when i put it near my phone, lost it by the pool, and my boys one didnt work twice. Why can they not use the smart phone entry. saw it in a cheap hotel in sydney, it works every time. Tap stay. (no it wasnt that bluetooth system i used in hilton either) Look into it and make it really Shangri La. Make me a happy guest, just one little improvement and life for this guest would be seamless... Apart from that , No disappointment here, ENJOY its worth it

Review title: One of the Better Staycations We Have Had
Review: This was one of the better hotel stays we have had locally.   Our stay got off to a bright start. Hilary, Carol, and Nurul, who helped us with the check in, were all friendly and helpful, and went out of their ways to make sure we were comfortably settled down in the room. With two young children with us, their efforts made a big difference to us.   We stayed in the new family suite, and it was great. The setup in the room visibly pleased the older child, and kept her entertained for many hours. There were also amenities in the suite which were useful for the demographics of the clients it is intended to serve. These include a full-sized refrigerator, cooking stove, kiddy working desk, children’s bathrobe, children’s bedroom slippers, and even a supply of diapers etc. They also…

Review title: People are just... wonderful. Everyone of them.
Review: I asked the driver of the car. You look so happy. He said 'what is there in life to feel sad about, Sir'. I was wonder struck. Everyone in that City Special appears happy and contented to me, every-time I visit there. Perhaps, to me, who reads & sees troubles, terrorism, misery, racism and such negative emotions pervading our societies, this place Singapore offers a breathable air of change.  And to top it all, the turning at the beginning of Orange grove Road into This lovely Hotel sends a very positive signal into one's heart. And mind. The serenity is all encompassing, the staff is welcoming, the food very nice and rooms particularly in the Garden wing)  are soft and very comfortable.   I love being there. It really feels one is home. Very efficient room service.

I previously stayed at the Shangri La in Bangkok and was amazed by the comfort, quality of my room and the staff’s attention to detail.  The Singapore property offered more of the same. Lots to choose from in terms of restaurants, magnificent premises surrounded by beautiful gardens, etc. The buffet breakfast was fantastic in terms of quality and selection.  My only complaint is that the bed in my room (Garden Wing) rolled away from the headboard when I leaned against it, which made reading a book and answering emails in bed a bit frustrating.  Everything else was perfect.

Review title: A tranquil haven in the city
Review: I recently spent 4 nights at the Shangri-La Hotel, Singapore staying in a Garden Wing Pool View room. From the moment I stepped into the Arrivals Hall at Changi and was met by a hotel representative, through to departure, I was treated exceptionally well and was treated to the full 'Shangri-La' experience.   On arrival the hotel, I was greeted by a very friendly and professional staff member who took me straight to the room and checked me in there. I thought that was a fantastic touch. The room itself was immaculate, spacious and had a nice sized balcony to relax on in that glorious Singapore heat! (having come from a cold and wet London!). The bathroom was big too, with a deep bathtub and a separate walk in shower with a rainfall shower head. Very invigorating after a 14 hour…

This is a very nice hotel. I upgraded to the Valley Wing and I highly recommend doing so. The rooms are very large (you can ask to see one before committing) and the lobby is very quiet. They have a lovely room where they serve a fantastic breakfast buffet. At 5:00 pm they serve canapés and drinks in the lounge--and it's free! The quality of the spirits that they offer are very top shelf.

Prime location but bit of a walk from center of town. Old style luxury. Excellent and well trained staff, very attentive. Pricey of course, but comes with reliability and consistency of a comfortable stay.

It's difficult to know where to start. The room, the lobby, both staff and appearance, waiting staff, food, the room (again) and the grounds. All of these were just about perfect. Breakfast was great, both choice and quality. The only downside of the holiday was that as we were only there for 3 days we didn't get the opportunity to sample all of the breakfast locations available.  In case it sounds like I have rose tinted spectacles, one oddity. There were crumbs on the bedroom floor when we moved in. They were still there when we left. This didn't fit with the rest of our experience but possibly indicates that we can all constantly look to improve.

My wife and I spent 2 days in Singapore prior to a cruise. We chose the Shangri-La based on prior reviews. I do not believe that we could have made a better choice. Our garden room was large and immaculately clean. Staff are unfailingly polite and efficient. While few would call the rates inexpensive, I feel that we received value for money.

We stayed here for three nights en route back from Australia with our 3 year old.   The hotel looks amazing and the staff are superb. Parts of it has recently been refurbished and look great. The swimming pool is super and great for kids.  My only complaint would be the pool bar which is a bit scruffy looking and with service which is not up to the standards of the rest of the hotel. Chairs and cushions are dirty and it’s not an inviting place to have a meal.   We stayed in the Valley wing, which is worth the extra cost as everything is included. Breakfast, afternoon tea and champagne every day as much as you want. The room was amazing, large and comfortable.   The service was the best of our whole trip, especially the staff at breakfast were super.   Would definitely stay here…

The beautiful Shangri-La has a magnificent hall and beautiful grounds with a swimming pool. It is set in a lovely area which is very green and calm but at walking distance with the super busy Orchard Road. We stayed for 4 nights with our teenage daughter and took advantage of the pool a few times. What was really special was the atmosphere for Christmas. The decorations were stunning, on Christmas Day we received a gift of a stocking with a teddy bear and a big chocolate Santa. There were carols sung by a wonderful choir, and there was a huge Christmas lunch and party for children.  The staff is exceptionally kind and helpful and all the services are slick and unassuming. It makes for a very relaxing stay in a very luxurious environment that however manages to feel cosy and at…

Review title: A hidden jewel in fast pace Singapore
Review: the Shangri-La hotel in Singapore is a great example of hospitality and should be an example to other hotels. arriving in the lobby of the hotel you are greeted with a warm welcome by the staff and accompanied to check in. the staff's are by far the kindest i have seen in a hotel so far. the lobby welcome you with its grand  high ceiling and big pillars which gives the guest a sense of luxury. if i had to rate the staffs i would give it 11 out of 10 thats just how kind they were. I was given a flower which just makes guest more welcomed in the hotel.  i stayed in the garden wing and which was just jaw dropping. the rooms were very comfy and homy  just wanna make you feel to live there. Each room had a balcony in the garden wing, theres the pool view and the city view. The…

1. Corner balcony room overlooking the pool was perfect. Spacious and clean. Bed was superbly comfortable and pillows / sheets were perfect. 2. Restaurants are all very good. Italian by the pool was really nice. Breakfasts are superb. Great choice for all tastes, I had a full English with finishing touch of a Prosecco daily! 3. Xmas dinner wasn't great. Just a regular buffet with many guests wearing shorts and T shirts, while I donned a suit! Paled into insignificance compared with the Mandarin in KL. 4. New Year's Eve party with live music was very good. 5. Staff were extremely friendly and helpful throughout. 6. It's a short walk from Orchard Road, with the ION Metro and Tangling. I walked loads overall to see the sights and earn breakfast! 7. Gym was exceptional and the…

We stayed for three nights in a newly renovated (May 2017) Horizon Grand Premier room which was perfect for us. There is a small kitchen area, a large table and sofa, a desk, a day bed, a walk-in closet and a very big king sized bed. We were 2 adults, 2 children and an infant. The check-in was amazing with the head of housekeeping welcoming us and offering us a stroller and a diaper disposal bin for the baby. The hotel is just beautiful with an impressive lobby, a great pool area, a beautiful garden, an outdoor play area for kids (that our older kids loved) and several good restaurants. Since we stayed in a Horizon room we had access to the Horizon lounge on the 24th floor for breakfast, afternoon tea and drinks and canapes. This was very nice and peaceful instead of having…

We stayed in the hotel over festive period (New Years Eve) and really enjoyed it.  From the moment we walked in to the hotel we were taken to an enjoyable journey. Smooth check-in/check out.  Nicely designed room, especially liked the dressing table, very clean.  We really enjoyed the lounge in the lobby, beautiful design and atmosphere, live music band, nicely composed menu with local specialities (chili crab is a must).  New Years eve party was amazing, the mood was festive from the morning, when we saw all the preparations, happy staff, followed by the great night with lots of dance. Kids club was not opened yet, but they expect it in Jan. However we found the concierge service found it a bit difficult to recommend places for dinner in town. I would highly recommend Shangri…

Review title: Really is Shangri-la , an oasis of calm, relaxation and indulgence
Review: Excellent experience as it has been on previous visits. Staff so welcoming and really look out for anything that they can do to help your stay. Friendly pool staff and blissful foot massage whilst at the pool. Spa good and relaxing. Just missed the oysters and prawns that we’d previously enjoyed at the superb Line breakfast. This truly is an oasis of calm in the busyness of Singapore.

Review title: Simply unrivalled, a perfect experience and example of what a 5* hotel should be
Review: Quite simply one of my favourite places on Earth.  From the friendly welcoming staff to the impeccable food and drink. The rooms are exceptional, service is unmatched, every member of staff knows how to make a guest feel welcome and like an old friend.  You will not find a better hotel, if you can stay in the valley wing for the best Shangri La has to offer

Review title: Please get rid of the kids in the Valley Wing!
Review: Love, love, loved the room, the service and the beautiful grounds.  The Valley Wing proves that a properly designed and maintained hotel (this one from the 80’s) from any decade is timeless. So many thoughtful conveniences in the room and very friendly and accommodating staff.    Regretfully we did not know that the “no kids” policy had been abandoned at the Valley Wing.  Families with scads of unruly and noisy kids dominated and ruined the experience in the Lobby during both of our stays - before and after a cruise.  This is no place for small children.  I think that a policy of 12 years old and above in the Valley Wing should not be too much to expect.  I don’t understand why the parents of loud kids want to be in such a staid environment.....they get dirty looks and the kids…

We had a great experience at the Shangrila hotel.   The staff was so courteous and our room was terrific.  The buffet breakfast was outstanding.   The only disappointing meal was at Nami Restaurant on the 24th floor.   We were expecting so much more.   It was expensive and definitely nothing special.  Other than that one bad meal, our stay was terrific.

Review title: A great stay with excellent staff and a good location for a 3 night stay
Review: Quick check-in and although our Horizon Club room had a few minor problems (whistling AC unit, loose door latch) this was attended to immediately which was impressive. Breakfast was a great spread to cater for every palette with the Hostess remembering our name each morning! Great breakfast service with no complaints, the best pastries and egg!  A special mention to Concierge Johnny who recommended the best Chilli Crab we have ever tasted ever! Thanks to his care, we enjoyed our stay immensely and saw the best Singapore has to offer in the time we had (Little India, Arab Street, Gardens by the Bay, Senotosa) as well as relaxing by the pool, even though getting up at 7am to save a good pool bed was recommended by the Lifeguard :) Overall cannot fault the attentiveness of the…

This was our first return after major renovation that completed in mid 2017. We stayed in Garden Wing which is not renovated. The private of Garden Wing is no longer there but the staff at main desk were nice and professional. First disappointed experience started when he informed that the Waterfall cafe closed due to low occupancy. This show that the hotel is interested in their bottom line more than what the customers want. The breakfast at Waterfall gave the peaceful experience and more attention to guests than at The Line. In my view, if it is the standard, it has to be there in whatever the hotel occupancy is. This is a short change of promise! The housekeeping standard for our room was poor and can see dust in many areas. Shang Palace has improved the food quality with its…

Nice place, comfortable stay, great pool but experience spolied with mixed service and kids club and spa being closed. Also kids activities were not very well communicated. And lounge very busy indeed

The amenities for the 2 Deluxe rooms that I booked were very generous. As an added bonus the scenic view from our panoramic window. Hotel staff are very friendly, pleasing, and accommodating. I am personally impressed with its Front Offjce Manager Cory Wright. Love the trees and other plants.

We travel quite a lot, but when in Singapore we always stay at this hotel as the service and staff are exceptional. The hotel itself has excellent facilities, beautiful grounds and pool area, and is quiet but within walking distance of the main shopping areas. The refurbished rooms in the Tower Wing are very nice. This stay was memorable as the staff welcoming us - Carol Peng and others - were extremely kind and efficient, and put a congratulations note and carrot cake in our room upon arrival - it was our wedding anniversary. All the front desk staff (including the ever-smiling Cory) were helpful, and the concierges were really knowledgeable - thanks Johnny, Ono and others. At the end of this trip my husband became ill (upset stomach) and within minutes of hearing about it,…

Review title: Customer Service As It Should Be
Review: Shangri-la gave me the best experience from the moment I stepped in the hotel to the moment I said goodbye thru the window of my taxi. The service was consistently good and was never short on little pleasant surprises. It has simply been a great experience.

Review title: Sublime Week at the Shangri-La Singapore 2017
Review: Cory & Lorielle we so gracious and made our stay very special over Christmas 2017. The accommodations were perfect, the pool area a welcome respite after a day of exploring this remarkable city. Ramesh at the pool is the host extraordinaire taking care of your every need.  Everything about the Shangri-La was perfect. We felt so welcomed at our home away from home in one of the best locations in Singapore, just 2 blocks from the heart of Orchard Road, yet secluded from its frenetic energy. The Shangri-La is a perfect refuge from this vibrant city after a day of shopping or exploring this multicultural island state.  We look forward to returning to the Shangri-La in Singapore very soon.

Review title: Old worldly charm property in Singapore
Review: Close to Orchard road. Large spacious rooms. Lively lobby. Plenty of dining options. Large pool . Soundproof rooms and great sleep on the comfy beds.  It lives up to its luxury statement.  Minibar is fully stocked. Great view from higher floors.

Wonderful and relaxing 2 nights stay at Shang. People are friendly and hotel is very family oriented. Breakfast at the Line was fantastic! Spoilt for choice. We had a poolside party and ate at The Waterfall. Nami restaurant was really great as well as Shang Palace.

Review title: Wedding weekend steeped in attention at the Valley Wing
Review: Stayed with a whole bunch of family and a few of us opted for the Valley Wing and more than a week before our stay, the Valley Wing manager was already taking care of us. I was going to be staying with my mom who was particular about her religious dietary meals and i was concerned about the  many meal options from the afternoon tea to the breakfast, how we were going to cope and the manager delivered on everyone of my concerns. The attention that we got during our 3 day stay was nothing short of special and people just seemed to know what and when we needed things. The only dip in my experience was when they insisted that i took my cocktail outside just because my leather sandals were not covered - and of course i must say that my sandals looked nicer on my feet than the some of…

Review title: U know you are in good hands at Shangri La
Review: Check in to their newly renovated horizon club premier room but the design of the room is such that the table is blocking the narrow passage way??! my baby girl bumped her head and then the 2nd time nearly hit the corner of her eye. They quickly changed us to the one bedroom suite at the garden wing. Melisa from horizon club guest service and a tall Korean lady from front desk were really helpful to help escort us to view the room and even sent the charger which I left in the previous room to us. We were impressed by their services. They can't do enough to make us feel better. We had our breakfast at line which offer one of the most extensive spread I've seen. Horizon club lounge was great too. Self serve alcohol drinks at cocktail hours and high tea with light snacks. Hope the…

23-27 December 2017. 3 bedroom   I wouldn’t bother! The rooms are poorly laid out, old and out dated, not what you would call clean, not worth the cost. The staff are great, the food is good, but just not what you would expect, very disappointed.

The horizon club offers a stunning view of the skyline. But if you cannot enter, just pop over the the Japanese restaurant next door and you can get the same view. Beautiful property which allows you to explore the property its garden and pool. Rooms are large and spacious.

Did a staycation with my partner from 23-25Dec 2017. As it will be my mum last Christmas Eve celebration due to old age and illness. A very special thanks to Front Desk Guest Services Agent : Ms Carol Peng.  As we are checking in 6 rooms on 24Dec 2017, after listening to my explanation with regards to my mums last Xmas, she patiently and did her best to accommodate 5 rooms on the 7th level. She even allocate a handicapped room for my mum. Thank you Ms Peng. Also thank you to the Line Restaurant Supervisor Ms Berlinda. She made an exception to arrange and reserved 2 tables for me and my family (19pax) on Xmas morning breakfast. Thank you. Also many thanks to the Housekeeping Manager Mr Tommy Tang. He personally delivered the 2 buckets of ice for our champagne 🍾 and also with the…

Review title: As always wonderful to stay at the Shangri-La
Review: First time here at the Shangri-La in Singapore and we were not disappointed. We stayed in newly renovated rooms which were a bit small but are not as old fashioned as some of the Shangri-La Hotels. The smell is the same ( I love it!!) Unfortunately our room was not so clean. I found black hare here and there ( bed, chair, shower) and the back of the door was very dirty.  The lobby is nice, serves cake in the afternoon, snacks in the evening and some wonderful drinks from the bar. We were not able to make a reservation at the Italian restaurant :-(  Breakfast was plentiful. BUT: we we were sitting outside because it was very noisy and crowded inside. This could have been fine if there hadn't been 2 men at 2 different tables sitting there with NO shirt on! I am sure if these two…

Pricey but definitely worth it in terms of amenities, cleanliness, luxury feel and comfort. Deluxe room was huge and gorgeous. Breakfast buffet was the biggest and most diverse I've seen in my life. Great for a business stay.

The weekend stay was booked last minute - yet the reservations staff were able to assist and help with our special requests (for a firmer bed and extra pillows) - extra points for service.   The room in the refreshed Tower Wing was what you'd expect at a 5-star establishment and did not disappoint amenities wise. To nit pick, the apples in the room had probably been there for a while and were a little squishy - needless to say we gave them a miss.  The pool has a ton of deck chairs so you have no problem finding one - unless you insist on a pool view. The organic free-form pool is also large enough to accommodate the young swimmers and more serious ones. The pool staff will close off the pool when there is thunder and lightning and are strict about it for your own safety.  Room…

Looking for an Oasis in the city to celebrate my anniversary and Christmas eve, I checked in on 24th December to their Horizon Club Grand Premier Room in their tower wing.   Checking-in: upon checking in, I was rather surprised I wasn't given the option to check-in in the club lounge. I requested and the counter staff obliged. She kindly offer to send our luggages up to the room, including a Christmas gift I got for my partner which was a designer potted plant wrapped in a paper bag. Leaving our stuff at the check-in counter unattended, she escorted us up to the lounge.   Bad experience with poor service recovery: As the package came with a set lunch in their Japanese restaurant, Nami, we had our meal before heading up to the room. When we got up to the room, we were shock to…

Went for a staycation for one night with my husband and son.  We stayed at Tower Wing and room is spacious with nice bathtub in the toilet. Love the bed and many different types of pillows catered for different people. Only complain about the room is the water in the shower is not strong at all. Breakfast at The Line was fabulous too with many choices and I have to totally forget about my diet. We also enjoyed swimming in the pool but felt the water was not that clean and clear that day. On the 1st day, not sure if there were any problems with their lifts as out of 5 lifts in Tower Wing, only 2 seem to be working and we have to queue and waited for a long time to go up to our floor. However we still have an enjoyable stay as Shangri La hotel in Orchard still felt like a resort…

Review title: Only there for one night but will definitely be on our go back to list.
Review: The hotel was beautiful. Reception staff very professional, friendly and helpful. The room was great, very spacious and well  appointed. Next morning we went to the buffet breakfast and the choice of food was amazing . Unfortunately I have a health problem and cannot eat food with added salt but I still had a great selection of fruits etc. when checking the grilled tomatoes and sauteed mushrooms was told salt had been added so I told them not to  worry . About 10 minutes later the chef arrived at my table with specially cooked tomatoes an mushrooms

Hotel was absolutely first class ... the facilities, food, decor, amenities and more importantly the staff. Located well, just off Orchard Road and easy access to the shopping areas and restaurants. Special mention to Ivan Poon, young manager with a really bright future, customer service and communication par-excellance ... T.H.

Review title: Good proximity to Orchard Road, Great pool and Beautiful Scenery
Review: Good proximity to Orchard Road, Great pool and Beautiful Scenery. The only thing is the rooms are pretty far from the morning breakfast. The same thing about the carparks. Rooms are clean and spacious but old.

Located a short 10 minute walk from Orchard Road, I enjoy this hotel as it is located in an upscale residential neighbourhood so you don't really realise how close you are to the main shopping area of Singapore. Being tropical, it can be a bit warm to walk to Orchard Road but there is tree cover for most of the way. Before arriving at ShangriLa, check which block you will be staying at, Tower, Garden or Valley as that will dictate which area the taxi will drop you off at. All are interconnected but where you get dropped off at will dictate how long a walk you have.  I was originally booked into the Garden Wing, which is nice as every room has an outside  balcony but was upgraded to the Valley Wing which does not have a balcony but has a more old world feel about it. The hotel…

Our room was large with a Hugh window. It had automatic drapes that closed when you left the room and you can also press a button ton open or close them. The housekeeping service was excellent. Nice big bathroom with a walk in shower. Breakfast was included with our stay and it was an outstanding buffet. Any taste was covered, You could get eggs cooked to order or noodles or just about anything you could want. You are in walking distance of lots of shopping (a couple of long blocks) or restaurants I would go back..

Great rooms . I stayed in a room that had a huge bed with several pillows across the width of the bed. Great service and an excellent Chinese restaurant in the hotel . The pool was large and located among beautiful scenery. Close to central Singapore

This was not our first stay at one of this group hotel and we were very pleased to see that the standard was consistent to what we remember. Location is ideal as it is only a short walk to Orchard Road shopping area which is excellent. We found a lot of the shops were below ground on several levels and it is quite easy to become disorientated. The breakfast which was included in the room rate was very good and a huge selection was available   We ate in the Italian restaurant on site which was very good and the coffee shop served a good cappuccino.

The best part was that the hotel toiled was filled with l'occitane aroma. Hotel room was huge, with huge windows and King bed. Buffet selection was awesome. I didn't tried the lunch and dinner buffet.

Location quiet far from the main street, but easy access to marina bay, can walk by it. One of the famous hotel in singapore and price worth for it !!! Design interior very nice and inspirative with the unique.

I was very surprised when I reached as I have stayed here several times and the enhancements were amazing. I didn’t know about the renovations!  The level of service was exceptional, from breakfast to room service.  Highly recommended.

Review title: Divine stay in Singapore at the Shangri La Apartments
Review: I have had the most pleasant stay for the past many months at the Shangri La Serviced Apartments, next to the Shangri La Hotel on Orange Grove. The place is impeccably maintained and the amenities are extremely convenient for a short or longer stay. The location was everything I had hoped for. Staff is extremely courteous. A special mention must go to Yoke Kieng, the caring and so generous lady who took care of my apartment and was a wealth of resources as I got settled in Singapore. She was always available to genuinely provide advice to me and my family and I am very grateful to her for her professionalism and top service level. Also a special thank you to Jamaliah for a support and warm welcome. All the Best to Laura and the wonderful staff at the Shangri La Apartments!  nd

Our family recently checked into Shangri-la for a staycation to attend a cousin's wedding. My bro-in-law remarked, "this is how a hotel should be".  We love the attention showered on us the minute we stepped into the lobby for the check-in until we reached our rooms. The Garden Wing rooms were of good size with a pool view on the room balcony. We were surrounded by greenery. Yes, I know infinity pool is the fashion. But this is one of the few hotels that has a big swimming pool on the ground floor. The beds were comfortable. Rooms were clean. Breakfast's spread is big. Too bad, my limited capacity couldn't savor everything. The Line was really crowded in the morning for breakfast. Enjoyed every moment of the experience.

Alas the wait is over and waiting for this moment of the new opening of Hotel's Tower Wing after total few months of revamp and renovation in the rooms, receptions, and Horizon Club Lounge, etc. True to  its brand and expectation, it's a great make over. The room is modern, chic and clean which particularly like the high floor view, layout and amenities. Equally impressive the club lounge's ambience and layout and foods being served during breakfast, high tea and evening cocktail. Also glad to hear that club lounge is operating 24 hours except no concierge after midnight. This is certainly the plus points especially when one returns late to hotel and need a chill out, The most outstanding was the great service by the relatively young team of staff and they were Melisa, Grace,…

The Shangri-La hotel in Singapore is a landmark hotel in Singapore.  It’s very large footprint means it has the largest space of any hotel for its facilities.  The buffet is the largest and best of any hotel in Singapore and is an experience in itself.  Thank god for the huge and well equipped gym facility otherwise we’d all get very fat from the food honestly the best hotel gym in singapore.  The rooms are well sized and the there are several towers with different configurations.  Valley tower is my favourite and they work very hard to please ... a second home in Singapore.

Review title: A little oasis in the city
Review: Fabulous weekend staycation in the Garden Wing. Lovely room with big well appointed balcony. Pool is excellent more like a resort with plenty of sun loungers around the beautiful gardens. Great value weekend including discounts at the in house restaurants which served very good food. It is a bit of a hike to Orchard but there is an hourly shuttle that takes you to Wisma  Would highly recommend and will stay again next time in Singapore

Review title: Stay at the refurbished tower wing
Review: A well thought through refurbishment of the tower wing, the rooms are still a decent size for Singapore and are modern, the bed was rather comfortable. We enjoyed our stay, however I felt that the buffet “the line” was not as great as it used to be. The pool was exceptional and the food at the lobby lounge restaurant was exquisite local hawker cuisine. We will certainly come back for a short stay again in the near future.

Review title: Luxurious oasis in the heart of Singapore
Review: The Shangrila never disappoints, we always choose to stay in the garden wing everytime. Great location for shopping and relaxing. Kids love it and are treated like little VIP’s. Latest renovations have updated the look and feel.

Great experience, great attendance and very friendly atmosphere. The Japanese restaurant is beyond great, lobby lounge service and attendance beyond excellent. One of the best hotels ever stayed in. The lobby lounge at the tower very relaxing with great views.

Excellent stay ....  Mattress extremely comfortable , room is really quiet and good in size . Amazing breakfast and coffee shop in the lobby . Room service menu quite extensive .  The staff is doing everything to make our stay memorable !

Had a great time staying here. The hotel is beautiful inside and out . Lots of facilities, lovely pool and the staff are extremely helpful . Can’t really fault the Shangri- la, if you come to Singapore you have to stay here .

The lobby is majestic and the room that I got, the executive suite is truly exceptional. After long day spent walking around Singapore, my tired feet was happy to be coming back to comfortable and clean sheets. Their breakfast in the morning has a variety of food to choose from.

Not like other hotel in Singapore, this hotel give you a smile for your journey & stay which they give you hospitality experience & customer centric. You'll feel very welcome since you enter the lobby

It was a great experience to stay in Shangri-La Valley Wing. An ideal place for business stay or couple staycation with excellent choices of food and beverages provided throughout our stay. The afternoon tea and champagne bar with canapes session was great, especially in the Horizon Lounge where the ambience was good and the staffs were polite and attentive. However, it is not recommended for family with small kids.

We stayed at Shangri-la for 3 nights. There was an initial mixup with our room but the staff dealt with our problem & compensated us accordingly. The front office manager Swaran Muru was fantastic. The food in the buffet restaurant was amazing. The chef Mirko was amazing. He cooked us extra fresh veggies & some prawns for my son's noodle soup, even peeling them for him. Outstanding customer service! The staff were all great & Raja in the valley wing cocktail bar also deserves a special mention for providing great customer service. We will definitely stay again.

Review title: Such a Disappointment - The New Shangri La Lobby
Review: After more than a decade being a regular guest a the Shangri La, what a disappointment to see the old lobby being revamped for the worse on many aspects: choice of cuisine is now mostly "local" and offers cheapest cookies, overall ambience, heterogenous cheap looking furniture, beautiful china replaced with some basic tableware - just every aspect is a form of deterioration.   Why do we need a bread-shop (!) in a 5-star lobby and there is not hotel boutique anymore? Even the uniform of the staff is harsh on the eyes, the off colours and standardised cheap "jewellery"..what an aesthetically and displeasing experience!  Nothing against the art itself - but too dominantly placed; candles in water as the highlight of the lobby? What criteria led to these decisions - this is not a…

Sometimes, all you want is a little peace and quick getaway but do not have the time for an overseas trip, staycation is the way to go.   Shangri-la continues to suprise me with the incredible service from the point you check-in. Momo, the hotel receptionist was prompt with the check-in service, walk my family up to our room. Oh! Along the way, she picked two fresh stalks of orchid (national flower), handed one to my son and me. The sweet scent together with the kind gestures instantly melted some of my stress away, and this was the start of an amazing day.  I am grateful to be a Golden Circles Jade member as I was also offered additional fruits, chocolates and other goodies. We were even offered a little squirrel soft toy for my little boy which he could bring home.    During…

Stayed there in September with family. Had a wonderful stay. Great Staff, great location and amazing views of the city.Amazing gardens around the hotel. City center and great for shopping lovers. Would love to go back

I have just spent thirteen luxury nights here. The staff cannot do enough to help you and the rooms total luxery with everthing thought out for you. The food all very good too. If ever you get a chance to stay here please do as you will not regret it.

Great Business Hotel. Amazing grandeur and Ambience. Courteous staff and great amenities. Hotel to pamper yourself. The staff are very attentive, professional and eager to please. Rooms are very nice.

Review title: One of the best hotel in Singapore
Review: I have stayed many hotels at Singapore and this is the best experience I have ever had. The room at Tower Wing is newly renovated and the service of all staffs are excellent. I have also visited the newly renovated Horizon Club and it is fantastic too. The environment, quality of food and drinks, and the services of staffs are fantastic. If it is a must to find out a little mistake from the perfect environment, I would say it would be better if there is "fresh noodle cooking" in the breakfast at Horizon Club.

Review title: My favorite hotel when I travel
Review: When I travel to Singapore if I can I choose all the time Shangri la hotel, the staff are very professional, the rooms are big and very clean. The atmosphere is perfect. The price is not cheap but the quality have the right balance.

Shangri-la hotel experiences are always memorable.  We reserved two rooms as we were with two teenage sons.  We forgot to request for adjoing nor next door rooms.  What was waiting for us were two rooms neither next door nor on the same floor. In addition, the hotel was pretty much packed as they had several weddings and events occuring during the same weekend. The front desk staff went out of their way to figure out what they could offer, and voila! We ended up with two rooms next door to each other on the 5th floor.
