I couldn't thank them enough for going out their to make us feel safe and comfortable.  And this kind of quality service consistent in most of Shangri_las around the world.   The rooms were clean, comfortable but but needed improvement in the bathroom.  Breakfast…

Review title: Truly a paradise in  the city
Review: A great experience got me and my family. We love staying at the Shangri-La.  The staff were very attentive and eager to please. The hotel decor, after renovation, exudes a classy feeling. Will be back again, no doubt.

Définitely the Best hôtel in terms of refinement and quietness in Singapore, dream pool with  its quasi Italien restaurant . A dream stop in a business trip. High class service, hence high quality guests

Review title: Outstanding service made the stay that much more enjoyable
Review: I have had the privilege of staying at many top hotels throughout the world, however, I have NEVER experienced such outstanding levels of customer service as I did at a recent stay at the Shangri La. From the moment we exited our taxi, we were pleasantly welcomed by Nicole from front desk and she was excellent in making us feel most welcome. The room was well presented, (we stayed in the Garden Wing), it was large, clean and modern. The food was tasty, both in the restaurant and at the pool, as well as room service. Every interaction with a staff member, from concierge, to pool staff to restaurant to gym staff was a pleasant experience. Clearly they have been exceptionally well trained and they really seem to care about making the guest experience a good one. The location is…

Dear Sir or Madam,  I am writing to you today to express my disappointment with our one night stay at Shangri-La Hotel, Singapore.   We knew Singapore was the original Shangri-La Hotel and because of the history, and having stayed or eaten at other Shangri-La Hotels (Bangkok, Kuala Lumpur and London), we decided to stretch our budget and book a room for our final night in Asia. My issues are:  •	We waited over ten minutes to check-in and we were not even acknowledged. •	Check-in was friendly but slow for a 1 night stay (24/11/17). •	Twice my partner ordered Cabernet Sauvignon (Red) and was bought Sauvignon Blanc (White). Mistakes happen, but the staff were argumentative and rude. •	When it rained we took shelter outside the Waterfall restaurant. The cushions were taken away…

Shangri-La hotel, apparently inspired by the James Hilton book (Lost Horizon) is meant to be an oasis, nestled in the rushed and busy Orchard Road area. It should offer a calm, relaxing, reinvigorating experience, all laden with that extra touch of luxury. Its rooms are nicely appointed, the Garden Wing (one of the three wings) has nice balconies to stand and soak in the views of the pool and the gorgeously landscaped gardens, and one can hear the man-made waterfall that cascades down to the restaurants. We meander through the steps hidden amongst this waterfall, our path leading to a pond with tortoises and fish galore, all rushing towards us with their mouths open, as if needing much required feed. The reaction of the fish pretty much sums up our "romantic special occasion"…

I’m not sure how anyone cannot give this place 5 stars, from brilliant door men, to welcoming reception staff (who show you to your room). Fantastic breakfast options and quite a few restaurants around the building.  Room was massive and staff really worked hard to keep it clean and tidy

Stayed 3 nights, predominantly as a break and a chance to see Singapore on our way back from New Zealand to England, and left wishing we had given ourselves longer. Arrived on a Saturday evening to a very busy hotel, due to a St. Andrews night celebration and were advised our room had been upgraded from Tower wing to Valley wing! Breakfast Sunday morning initially appeared very chaotic, with a long queue waiting to be shown to their table. Fears quickly disappeared, however, as the staff are extremely efficient and we were quickly shown to our table. Choice of many cuisines, reflecting the different influences in Singapore. Valley wing is brilliant, with it's own reception, lounge and entrance away from the rest of the hotel, will be booking this when we come back.  All staff…

5 phone calls and completing their review email and still not having any acknowledgment of the points I raised I am left with this option  Okay what are my gripes  1/. The room smelled damp the whole 3 days we were there my opinion it had not be used for a while or the air-conditioning had not properly been serviced 2/.Very cheap toilet paper which disintegrates on use  3/. Though we paid the extra for the horizon floor and the use of the horizon lounge you have to help yourself totes and coffee, normally you are asked what your preference THIS IS A FIRST FOR IN MY EXPERIENCE WHEN STAYING IN A HORIZON ROOM 4/. No menu on the table for breakfast you again have to serve yourself from a station THIS IS A FIRST FOR IN MY EXPERIENCE WHEN STAYING IN A HORIZON ROOM 5/. Part of the…

We visited during November and were immediately welcomed to the hotel. We had booked the Valley Wing and were shown our room which was old style but sill clean and neat. We were also given an orchid on arrival alongside champagne. The plus side of the Valley wing was that drinks and food were liberally offered. However, the hotel shares with the garden wing and the tower wing and the swimming pool serves all three areas. The pool area reminded me of something from Spain and we were not that impressed. People had left towels on the sun loungers to hold the spaces which was ridiculous for a hotel of this calibre to allow.  We enjoyed the breakfast and service was friendly and attentive. It was a shame it was rainy season as we would  have wished to enjoy the pool area (where free)…

Visited Singapore from20th till23rd Decemer .stayed at Shangrila hotel on orange grove. Courteous service,eager staff to help you  & excellent breakfast,nice bed & good view- what else do you need as business traveller ! Breakfast is very good suitable for all nationalities.  Indian breakfast was almost like home.worth the penny you spent there

We had three nights here enroute to NZ from UK.  After the 13 hour flight it was an absolute delight to be welcomed as we alighted from our car, then handed over to a customer services representative who handled our registration.  We were then taken to our suite and shown the facilities.  We were upgraded to a garden balcony room with a view of the lovely pool and gardens.  The room and facilities were excellent.  However the level of customer care from all staff  throughout our stay was exceptional.  The Shangri la is recommended as a hotel to stay at.

If there's one you can say about the Shangri-La chain of the hotels is that they never fail to impress and Shangri -La Singapore is no different  The impressive lobby takes your breath away as soon as you step into the hotel The Pool and gardens are just beautiful and what I loved is despite being in the middle of a fast paced busy city you feel like your on a island resort. I stayed at the newly refurbished Tower Wing but had the opportunity to look at the rooms in the Garden and Valley Wings, All 3 are very different in their own way but you wont be disappointed which ever one you choose. Great Hotel , Great facilities , Great service you wont be disappointed!

Arrival was very warm and welcoming, caring staff, very clean lobby, passageway and rooms, hotel’s ambience awesome with lovely fragrance of freshness as we entered. Staff very well trained and never miss any guest request. Loved my stay.. will come back soon. Very highly recommend.

Stayed over for a few days on route to Australia and didn't want to leave. Perfect location for the main shopping area. The hospitality is second to none and the breakfast buffet is incredible. The gardens are truly beautiful with many tropical flowers including so many orchids. If possible stay in a suite in the garden tower.

Great place for stay. Breakfast buffet selection is the best I have ever seen and I've stayed in many countries and hotels! The pool is like being on a tropical Island and rooms are just fantastic. Highly recommended though it's not cheap.....will be going back there next April.

Being my first time in singapore and my first time at Shangri-La property it lived up to expectations!  There a few moans on here about refurbishments however you are given ample notice and realistically we were out all day exploring singapore so it didnt bother us.  We were on the 18th floor so got an amazing view of the city. The hotel is about a 10-15 minute walk to the nearest MRT which again was quite a nice walk however taxis are plentiful and the average cost to the shopping centre was about 7SGD.  Being a travel agent i will recommend to all my customers and would love to stay again.  Many thanks!!!

Been in shangri-la for 4 days and loved each and everyone of it. Out of the 4 days I had to eat out on one day and that was a mistake. The food is delicious. The room was cosy and came with a view. Room service was prompt. Housekeeping excellent. Thank you for being a home away from home.

This hotel is very well managed. The staff  are very attentive and helpful and everything is done with good grace.The lobby and bar areas are spectacular. The breakfast was very comprehensive and well presented.We didn’t eat any other meals there but they were available. The hotel is set in beautifully maintained gardens with an attractive orchid house.It’s a little out of town but taxis are plentiful and reasonably priced.We would highly recommend this hotel.

Just spent two nights at the renovated Shangri La Hotel Singapore. Receives aan upgrade when checking in. What a difference. The room was completely up to date. As always a nice stay. Beautiful view from the 24th floor. Also the Horizon Club received aan upgrade.

A most wonderful place to stay at. Definitely would stay there again. Service was excellent and hotel was very clean. It is walking distance from the centre. Although I didn’t swim but swimming pool looked amazing. They seemed to do water aerobics in the morning for who ever wanted to join in. There were restaurants and coffee shops in the hotel to suit individual needs. Truly loved the place .

Review title: Lousy Concierge with no sense of customer service
Review: Shangri La had never failed me in all the countries that I had stayed with them but this was totally disappointing!   I was celebrating my wedding anniversary and my wife birthday yesterday at Chi Spa. We had a 1.5 hour massage which I partially paid via my Golden Circle points. After paying the final bill at Chi, I requested for a complimentary car park coupon which I was given one by the Spa counter.   Then when we were exiting the car park, the complimentary ticket machine read my coupon as expired. I took a closer look and it was indeed expired 2 days ago. Hence i parked my car and headed to the concierge at the lobby instead of going all the way down to the Chi Spa which was 2 floors down  However, I was totally shocked by Mr Rajagopal Rajkumar (Chef Concierge) who refused…

I don't like the scent of the lotion, shampoo and conditioner. I remember the room I stayed is average, small and dim. The highlight is the bar on top floor of the hotel. The hotel is located in a residential area and there's no shops around the hotel.

We opted to stay at the Shangri-La Singapore for a few days at the end of a cruise.The hotel was just the haven we needed after a hectic trip. Attentive, helpful staff, great places to eat, together with beautifully landscaped gardens made for a memorable experience.  A shuttle bus operates between the hotel and the shopping venues in Orchard Road, although it is an easy walk if you prefer. A truly stunning location.

stayed there for 2 nights, nice room but a bit small, maybe because it's a corner room. great breakfast, plenty of foods serve on the breakfast. did not try the swimming pool, but looked quite big with resort style pool.  over all, its a a pleasant stay, although a bit far from MRT station, but the hotel provide free shuttle bus every hour to orchard  and takashimaya.

Review title: Drilling..beware, they'll ask u to pay more for the inconvenience
Review: They checked me in, with my baby in my pram next to me..."sorry for the drilling that is going on daily 9am-6pm, but if you pay extra we will put you in another wing where it's nice and quiet for your baby". Seriously asking me to pay more so my hotel room is quiet?? Drilling (and general banging) went to 7pm most days vibrating the floor (and as a result the baby travel cot). Terrible stay after hoping for a relaxing break.

Review title: Is this the best hotel I have ever stayed in?
Review: My wife and I stayed for a mini-break and were blown away. It is like a resort hotel in the middle of the city and beautifully renovated. The staff were amazingly friendly and helpful. The bedroom was very well appointed, super view over the city and very comfortable. But the gem was the Horizon Club lounge on 24th floor, fabulous personalised breakfast and stupendous canapés in the evening. Cannot be faulted and I definitely go there again.

As usual shangri la hotel did not disappoint. Nothing is too much trouble. Setting and quality of finish great. Only downside was it was a bit of a walk to nearest train station. However taxis were readily available too. Relaxing and even given some beautiful flowers shame I could not take them to our next destination in New Zealand ( bio rules). The cakes in reception are a work of art see Spider-Man here and tasted delicious too.

Stayed at this hotel sometime back but wnet for dinner last week at the main restaurant.   Was pleaseny surprised at the widespread menu. Had confit salmon, wagyu beef for some highlights. Plenty of ice cream and frozen yoghurt and many more desserts.   However lacked seafood in the main spread like crabs and prawns n calamari. Only cold dishes were there which was a miss.

This hotel has billing issues. The staff charged my debit card TWICE on dining bill, without me knowing.  Payment was in order at the cashier.  However,  in the background, the staff charged the debit card for the second time.  Worst of all, the hotel refused to refund the overcharge in timely manner. This hotel must have been run by a mafia.

I have been to many nice hotels and along with other Shangri-La's. This felt like an older hotel that is not being up kept. Room was small and just average. There was construction happening while we were there  from 9am-6pm and a lot of drilling so if you were in your room it was not peaceful.  The service made up for the average room as everyone greeted us and helped make our stay great. It was my birthday and the left a cake with 2 Tiger beers in the room which was an awesome surprise.

Stayed here with my partner for 4 days en route from Australia to the UK. Greeted cordially on arrival and escorted to reception. Check in was quick and friendly. Our room was spacious and very comfortable. No noise disturbance at night. There is a buffet breakfast in the restaurant. There were plenty of choices both European and Asian and the food quality was very good. We found the bar offered a reasonable selection of meals  which worked out a lot cheaper than the restaurant in the evenings. The staff were all professional, courteous and friendly. All we spoke to were fluent in English. The hotel is located in a quiet area within easy walking distance of the famous Orchard Road shopping area. If choosing to walk, it is very hot in Singapore so ensure you take water with you -…

Stayed here for business and found everything about the hotel to be spot on.  The room was comfortable, the temperature easily adjusted, the amenities thoughtful, everything worked; the restaurant buffet was exceptionally good and I don't normally enjoyed buffets but the selection of types of cuisines was terrific - only complaint was that at breakfast i couldn't find a good raw muesli nor yoghurt - but the fruit was beautiful!

Review title: Valley Wing: one of the best hotels!
Review: After almost one year of constantly forgetting to leave a review, here finally our take on our wonderful stay in December 2016. We stayed for 2 nights in the Valley Wing (booked the Valley Wing Splendor package) and were a little concerned about the Tower Wing renovations that took place at the time we were there...impact on other wings, closed areas, more guest in the Valley Wing to accomodate Tower Wing guests, etc. Before we arrived the Valley Wing senior staff put us at ease and asked if we were celebrating something special, which he did, our wedding anniversary. Imagine our great surprise as my wife was greeted with a beautiful flower bouquet on arrival of the hotel limousine transfer! We were then escorted to an upgraded suite (had booked a deluxe room but given a…

Review title: Not as great as previous stays
Review: I have stayed here a few times over the years and usually have nothing but rave reviews. This stay had me in a room where there was a sewer smell in the corridor. They even put a large atomiser in the corridor to try and decrease the smell. There was no note or apology given for the smell. It was a nauseating smell. The breakfast was as good as always.

Had a short stay for work. Room was very clean and comfortable. Forgot to bring swimmers - ugh - as the pool looked very inviting. Bring an appetite as there are so many breakfast options at the buffet! Staff super polite all of the time.

Best Hotel stay, Food, Service and Rooms ever. A Great Hotel to Explore Singapur. I enjoyed my stay and will be back as soon as possible. Very Nice Area with best in class Service. Come and See. Dream

This is the third time we stay in Shangri-La in our trips. It is excellent hotel in terms of everything. I strongly recommend it. After joining the Golden Circle membership, the hotel upgraded my room to a suit. That was an experience I will not forget.

The staff in this hotel were exceptionally helpful and friendly. Our room was well designed and the bed was very comfortable. A short (but hot) walk to the shopping on Orchard Road. The hotel runs a free shuttle bus every hour to the shopping and subway station. A convenient way to deal with not being within a close walking distance to the subway. A 10 minute walk to the Botanic Gardens (but you may want to save your energy and take a taxi in the heat). The property is beautifully landscaped with an outdoor pool.

We stayed in the Valley Wing and it was beautiful, the executive wing and the views from level 24 are phenomenal! The reception staff made us feel at home and were helpful with every request. The Valley Wing staff were wonderful especially Carlio (Valley Wing waiter) but on occasion the staff were slow. It also, at times, seemed difficult to cater for a child who is a fussy eater eg we wanted to order hot chips into the Valley Wing afternoon tea/cocktail hour and were not able to... however the room service kids Bento Box was wonderful especially for this fussy eater and would recommend it! We spent a lot of time by the pool and were never approached by a single staff member to see if we needed anything. For the price you pay and from our experience at numerous 5 star hotels the…

Stayed at the hotel with my family for 3 nights. Undoubtedly the hotel has an excellent infrastructure and reasonable variety of offerings on food etc. The hotel customer facing staff however are not very polite as may be expected from a reasonable hotel in similar class.

Stayed at the Shangri-La for a business conference. Had great meeting facilities and the hotel room was comfortable and modern. The food was excellent and the staff were courteous and professional - everything you would expect from a top class hotel like the Shangri-La!

Review title: High tea at The Rose Pavilion , Shangri La
Review: One of the most fascinating and relaxing places . Sit comfortably in modern luxury and enjoy a high tea of Asian delights as well as western foods . Children are welcome. While you are there take a stroll behind the pool and revel in the beautiful collection of orchids .  Spend some time sitting in the lobby sipping tea or coffee , listen to piano and enjoy the beautiful green wall of exotic plants , service is fantastic truly a lovely serene place to be

Review title: Very nice hotel, and very expensive as his custom for Singapore
Review: Traveling for business, I was torn between staying at a Marriott and the Shangri-La. I chose the Shangri-La and was not disappointed. The room was well-proportioned and quiet. There was an adequate bar in the room if you chose to have a $15 martini or $9 Snickers bar LOL. Then again the $12 beer in the lobby lounge was a little overpriced too. The espresso coffee machine the room was free and a nice treat. There were also plenty of electric outlets for use. In the hallway, I thought it was interesting there were fresh apples everyday just as you got on the elevator. The bar in the lobby had a live entertainer singing each night. And the breakfast buffet was extremely large and one of the best I've experienced. All in all I would stay again - but of course only on the company…

Hotel accommodated request for early check-in/check-out after arriving on Int'l flight on 12/21/16.  Even Hilton had their nose out of joint and refused with basic attitude - pay for 2 nights or we don't care !!!!  Shangri-la also arranged for SUV in advance.  Hotel has arrangements with other hotels to have reps meet guests as soon as you get off the plane !!!!!  Gentleman was professional and courteous - walked to Immigration and had SUV waiting as soon as I got thru.  Ride was approx. 30 mins but SUV was very comfortable so had a chance to catch my breath.  Hotel again accommodated early check-in/check out on return visit on 2/8/17.  Hotel arranged for taxi late evening for return flight.    Rooms very comfortable.  On return visit, room was on ground floor with a small…

In more recent times I consistently choose to stay at the Shangri-La in Singapore for business and family holidays. Set on spacious grounds with much greenery it is an ideal setting to hold a business meeting or relax with the family. Whilst the main tower wing has recently been completely renovated I prefer staying in the more tranquil setting of the garden wing. Rooms are generous in size and overlook a small garden. Service levels are consistently high. The gym and wet area is a favourite. Gym is large and well equipped for all types of workouts. The Shangri-La in Singapore remains my first preference when visiting Singapore.

We was visiting Singapore & originally going to stay at the Raffles Hotel but this was being renovated and was advised to stay elsewhere, so glad we did! We booked the Valley Wing room at Shanghai-La for our anniversary. We received a suite as an upgrade. Room & staff were fantastic, very attentive. Couldn’t have wished for a better hotel to stay.  Breakfast was included but we didn’t realise that drinks, high tea, canapés & drinks were included, a very nice surprise. Breakfast was excellent we tried eggs, lobster & caviar, again the choice is superb. As Deepavali Festival was on while we was away, we was asked if we would like to attend, again a brilliant tour round little India, learning about the culture, again we expected to pay for this & this was included.  There’s a…

Well we have just been at the Shangri-La as we were organizing an economic forum there and the support we have received from the hotel management and staff was above and beyond. They spared no efforts to help and facilitate our needs and whatever cannot be provided by the hotel they made all efforts to outsource for us  As for the hotel itself its amazing, great rooms and service, very clean. The food and really good and the staff well you will always be greeted with a smile  Good job

Review title: Excellent first class Five stars hotel
Review: The recently renovated Shangri-La Hotel Singapore is a prefect and excellent place to stay, location is very convenience, just  5 mins drive to famous shopping area, they provide free shuttle bus to/from Orchard Road!   The room is very comfort and well decorated in modern and classic style. All fixtures are very details, which you need what you want!   Breakfast is superb, you can get almost all choices from east to the west!   The lobby bar is a great place to enjoy afternoon tea, evening cocktails or night drinks.   Staff is professional and friendly enough!   If you wish to enjoy the real first class hotel, Shangri-La always the first choice!

If you are driving, park at the garden wing. There’s no covered walk-way from their main car park to the hotel. Here to attend a gala dinner at the Island Ballroom. Good quality for their appetiser, soup and the highlight is definitely their dessert. Not so much for their mains.

I always have high expectations when we stay at the Shangri-La and it never disappoints! The check-in was easy, rooms are complete and breakfast was awesome! It is not a quick walk to Orchard but that is also an advantage. I see Singapore outside the window and yet it feels we are at a secluded resort. Love it!

Great hotel with everything you want and need from a luxury hotel - A little pricey and not very central, but lots of facilities and great staff. Lovely poll gardens and public areas. Rooms have everything and more...

This hotel is very well suitable for families. Pool has areas for all, sunchairs on real grass ground floor, free ice cream every day and centrally located which is great for all sorts of visits. Rooms in renovated Tower Wing are reasonably sized and have connecting doors. Breakfast in The Line has many choices, but has a cold ambience and is noisy. Coffee and Tee are sub standard. Breakfast at the waterfall is much better, though less variety.  An extra compliment to the staff. Reception and especially Concierge are very attentive, know you after a day or so. Johnny did always reach out to us proactive and made us fell home. THANK YOU!!! Kumar did a tour pre Divali to Little India with passion and knowledge we truly enjoyed.  Thank you to make our stay special.  Kirsten and…

Staying here at Shangri-La on a business trip. It’s an old hotel which has been renovated and it’s beautiful if you especially want a taste of old Singapore. The employees are wonderful, treating everyone as being very special. Plenty of variety with restaurants and poolside catering.  I am staying in a Garden room which also has a balcony - great to step outside away from the air conditioning for a few minutes and listen to the many birds. Shangri-La is in park-like surroundings with waterfalls and trees which makes it very peaceful.

We hadn't stayed at the Shangri La for five years but going back was like renewing old acquaintances. Check in at the Horizon Club was smooth and the female staff are very welcoming. Evening drinks and canapes is very popular while the breakfast caters for all tastes. The Tower wing of the hotel has recently been renovated. We had never walked through the grounds on previous stays but this time we had a thorough look around. Don't miss the Orchid "house". Beautifully kept surroundings and larger than we thought. Only problem was we had to change rooms to get one with good bench space for our cases which open out like a book. World Class establishment.

Spent a couple of days at the Shangri-La last week while on business in Singapore. The hotel is beautiful, staff very friendly and efficient and the rooms spacious and well-appointed. Breakfast was a master class in how to pander to every taste from healthy to hearty to downright gluttony - nothing was left out. In the evenings we ate outside and chose the healthy options menu which was diverse and very tasty. It is our second visit to the hotel this year and I would definitely recommend it for both a family holiday or a business stay. Well situated to visit the sites it is an excellent choice for a holiday.

Review title: Nothing but the best from Shangri-La Hotel, Singapore
Review: I've eaten/stayed at top hotels all over the world; but this one, is the best. The breakfast (complimentary when I stayed) is the world's best. 18 (I think) different countries' menus available from all over the world. I can't recommend this hotel any better than 7 star! (OK, I exaggerate, but it's superb!) The Singaporeans KNOW how to make you welcome. I don't think you'll find better - anywhere in the world.  HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!

Very, very nice place to stay for business of pleasure. Look forward to returning to the Shangri-La after a long day. The people are great, food is excellent and the health club and pool are one of the nicest in Singapore.

I stayed at the Shangri-La Hotel Singapore for a work conference in September.  The hotel is wonderful, as it is executed like a beach resort, the lunch buffet is amazing, but it is also a fantastic business hotel.  What made the hotel experience fantastic and to another level was the assistant front desk manager, Ivan Poon.  Ivan was warm, friendly, effiicient and very professional.  He took care of everyone's needs at check in and put a personal touch to the check in process.  It was so amazing to see that Shangri La has high caliber staff like Ivan.  Well done!

Great hotel with heaps of children activities, food is expensive however, great service though, lunch menu is average, this is more of a family hotel and bit noisy for a romantic getaway, rooms a nice

First time here, for sure not the last time!  The whole concept in the Valley Wing is luxury all the way. The rooms are great, very large and I have never experienced a room this well equipped, especially if you need to work a bit.  Highly recommended.

My family and I had the pleasure to stay in the Valley Wing and our stay was simply one of the best trips we have ever done in Asia. The newly opened Valley Wing is a bit of a hidden gem as you are treated to an exclusive lobby area which provides a private dining area for breakfast followed by afternoon high tea and canapés - to compliment this, there is also a very high quality drinks package. Suffice to say the service mirrors the beautiful ambience and it’s rare to say the service was faultless - simply put, nothing was too much trouble and the staff were excellent.  We will be definitely returning !

He came, he saw, he stayed and this is how it went down....  The story of Shangri-la is probably quite well known, based on the iconic 1930's novel penned by James Hilton, called Lost Horizon. In the story, a disparate group of people find themselves stranded in a fictional sanctuary called Shangri-la. It is here that the lead character finds inner peace, love and a sense of purpose in this most mysterious of utopias, whose inhabitants are permanently happy and enjoy unheard-of longevity.  This sense of longevity can almost certainly be applied to the Shangri-la Singapore as it is the luxury hotel chain's first property, opened all the way back in 1971 and is an anchor of the Shangri-la hospitality experience world wide. Visiting a five star hotel is always exciting and it is…

We had a very enjoyable trip and stay in the Shangri La. The staff were very helpful and friendly. I must especially thank the manager and staff of The Waterfall Restaurant for being so accommodating and making meals for us that were not on their menu. We really appreciated that.

We arrived at the Valley Wing of the hotel, after a none stop flight from Manchester. We were greeted with such warmth. I was given orchards on getting out of the taxi. Even though it was only 9.00am our room was waiting for us. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff. They seemed to know what we required before we did. The attention to detail was exemplary. What more can I say. Only sorry that we were there for only 4 days. Will be staying longer next year.

Review title: A gem in the midst of a concrete jungle !
Review: We spent a couple of nights here during the weekend. Check-in was fast, given a welcome drink which was nice. Parking is complimentary for those driving. We took a shuttle bus to Orchard after a sumptous breakfast. There is something for everyone, and we sat outside which was rather relaxing and calm. Room was rather ordinary as we stayed at the Tower Wing, no view. Overall, we were quite satisfied with the service.

Good place to stay with family.  Good service, nice room. Excellent breakfast option including Indian, Indonesian and other countries food. Lots of variety. Nice ambience. Near to shopping malls. Value for money.

Arrived, exhausted, at the hotel at 6am to be told that our room would not be ready for at least another 4 hours as the hotel was very busy, not the best of starts.  Also, slightly disappointing, was the fact that the main entrance was undergoing renovation, so had to make do with a small entrance and reception area. When the work is finished, it will look very imposing, took a peek behind the screening ! However, when were finally got to our room we were more than happy with it. It was spacious, clean and tidy, although the view was not the best, we had the biggest balcony ever.  Overall, the staff were efficient and spoke excellent English and the hotel was spotless.  We were on a B&B basis and the buffet was the largest I have ever seen, catering for all tastes and all…

excellent and friendly staff great Horizon club room good food excellent massage at spa the location is just perfect all the staff were friendly and helpful the service in the Horizon Club, restaurants and Spa were excellent

What fabulous customer service we received while stay in the Valley Wing at the Shangri-La Hotel in Singapore.  From the meet and greet at the airport to the arrival at the hotel they made you feel like you so welcome that it set a prestige of our whole vacation.  So relaxing and enjoyable, we never had to ask for anything.  After a day or so the staff knew what one preferred and whatever it may have been it was waiting for us. Looking forward to our stay at the Shangri-La in London over Christmas

Review title: The Very Best of Singapore- 5 well deserved stars!!
Review: This hotel is outstanding in every way.  It is an urban oasis- beautifully landscaped and elegantly decorated.  Thoughtful touches, fabulous amenities, excellent service- all expected of this grand hotel- but it the amazing staff that makes the difference!    We were in Singapore for the Formula 1 Grand Prix- staying at the lovely Shangri-La for 6 glorious days.  Arguably this event is perhaps brings the largest crowds to Singapore filling all of the city's top hotels, restaurants and venues, however the staff at the Shangri-La made us feel like we were the only guests.  We never stood in line, they answered the phone on the first ring when we called for anything with the staff often reaching out to us offering help before we could ask. They anticipated every need and tended to…

Review title: When only The Best will do!
Review: Our 2nd stay in the Valley Wing of Shangri La Singapore was even better than the first . The luxury, privacy, exceptional service and spacious rooms with every little homely touch taken care of, is so worth the extra cost.  Love Love Love this place can't wait to visit again

We stayed at Shangri La hotel on my visit to Singapore. We booked a room in Valley wing. There are three wings namely Tower wing, Garden Wing & Valley Wing. Out of this three Valley wing is the toppest & costlier than the rest. The service provided by the hotel was excellent, they address to the smallest issue of yours very politely. I had breakfast at the Line restaurant, the food was very good. They have a big swimming pool, a small water fall(created), Chi Spa, A Gym & a big vast lawn to laze around with good open bars.  The room was big & spacious, they had provided free wifi throughout the hotel, you can connect to wifi where ever you are in the hotel. They had provided free soft drinks in the mini bar, they also provide High Tea, Coffee, Snacks, Cocktails & Mocktails in…

It was a great experience for me and my wife to stay 3 nights at this fabulous Hotel. It's 20  minutes walk from the famous orchard St. A truly five star experience. The breakfast was awesome. The bed was super comfy and the staff were very kind and attending.

Review title: Superb hotel with friendly service staff
Review: The staff are very friendly. We were warmly greeted & welcomed in the lobby area by one of the friendliest service advisors by the name of Peter (with glasses) . He made our stay by taking the time to talk to us & finding out what we wanted to experience whilst on holidays in Singapore.   Being our first day, we must have looked a bit lost as to where everything in the hotel was.    Peter personalized our experience by actually walking us up to the horizon club on level 24 to show us the facilities there & then giving each of our 2 children a bottle of fresh juice each from the bar fridge. We were simply amazed at this service!  Over the course of our 7-8 day stay, whenever Peter saw us, he would always greet us with a smile and see how we were doing.  On two different…

We stayed here at Easter and then came here again for a special birthday celebration. This hotel never disappoints - all the staff are amazingly friendly and helpful, the rooms and facilities are wonderful and spotless and we will be back!! The location is also only a few mins walk to the top of Orchard Rd. The coffee shop in the lobby offers a great selection of bakery and coffee takeaways. All the staff were wonderful but a special mention goes to Rosili who works in the gym (hope I have spelt his name correctly) - so friendly and helpful. Thank you all at Shangri-la, I had an awesome birthday! We will be back!!

My wife and I had the opportunity to return to this beautiful hotel for 3 nights recently. We had booked a Valley Wing room and on arrival we were upgraded to a Valley Room Suite.The suite was amazing with a separate bedroom, dressing area, large bathroom,separate lounge/dining area and a second smaller bathroom with a shower and toilet. The suite was very clean with all the amenities you would need.The beds are very large and comfortable with beautiful linen.The bathrooms had Aqua di Parma toiletries which were great. There was a fruit bowel provided along with biscuits to go with your tea or coffee and little chocolates. All of these were checked and replenished regularly. The afternoon teas and evening canapes at the Valley Wing were wonderful. The food and drinks served were…

Charming staff, Buffet the best in town.  Rooms have everything a traveller could want. A sumptuous place to stay.  It’s not cheap ! The only thing that didn’t thrill me was the noise at the pool. Plenty of noisy children during our stay which isn’t conducive to peace and quiet.

Our first visit since the renovation, will admit first impressions, not great! But this was a personal thing. (We loved the old) After advice from Management we left our opinion until we had truly looked! After our third walk through, we get it! It is a beautiful space and everyone involved should be very proud of the outcome.  Another lovely holiday at the Shangri-la Singapore 🌺🌺🌺🌺🌺🌺

There is a lot of business travellers throughout the hotel, we stayed in the tower wing which seemed to accommodate more for business travellers, would recommend upgrading to the garden wing if you are staying for leisure. Service is as you would expect from a 5 star hotel, it was my birthday during our stay and they left a complimentary birthday cake and bottle of wine for us for when we returned home from the day! Breakfast was of a good standard, swimming pool is a very good size! Overall good hotel for a 2 night stay in Singapore!

This hotel is after hospitality at it's best. The staff are very friendly and will go to great length to provide you with anything you're after. The garden wing rooms are very spacious and have a nice lay-out. The hotel caters for large groups too and are known to host conferences without other guests actually noticing the uplift in visitors. In the rooms it is very quite, you have no idea is the rooms next, above or under yours are occupied or not.

Stayed only for 1 night. The hotel lived up to the name and fame. Beatiful room, huge pool in the garden, excotic flowers everywhere. Bathroom is huge and well equiped. They offer a free shuttle service every 20 minutes the bus takes you all the way to downtown main shopping area. Will use the hotel again in the future.

I have just returned from a business trip on which I was fortunate to stay in this beautiful hotel.  I have stayed in many great hotels over my life but there were a few things about this one that elevated it above most.  They might seem a bit random but here they are: 1.  Power points - they were everywhere in my room - in the desk, by the bed on both sides, and extra as well as USB points.  So tired of hotels without enough points to charge my devices. 2. Master light switches - proper ones that operated all of the lights - no getting up to turn off a desk lamp 3.  A soap dish - minor grumble I know but many hotels don't provide a soap dish for the counter.  This one did.  Thank you. 4.  Floral displays in the public areas - just gorgeous and very interesting.  Love the huge…

My husband and I return here every time we visit Singapore.We are always drawn back here rather than try anywhere else and have never been disappointed. The hotel is breathtakingly beautiful, the grounds an array of colorful exotic plants and trees. From the moment we arrive at the Valley wing our stay is five star all the way. Beautiful spacious rooms with immaculate decor, it is impossible to find fault. We last came in April 2017 so sorry for a delay in my review!  Every afternoon they serve afternoon tea then a little later canapes. My champagne glass is always full thanks to the wonderful staff who go above and beyond to ensure our stay is most memorable. In particular I would like to thank Raja, Jergan, Elisabeth and Hari for taking such great care of us. Little things…

Shangri-La Hotels never disspoints, the Paris Shangri-La, Jakarta, Bosphorus, Tokyo, Sentosa, Surabaya, Hong Kong Island, Kowloon, I've tried quite a number of them, and this Singapore one sticks out as the top 3, after Tokyo and Paris. The serenity, the tranquility, the nice ambience, the beautifully decorated gorgeous yet grand interiors, the scent of the rooms-hallways-lobby, the level of staff's dedication and level of food choices and quality (especially the lobster barbecue-my favourite), have always been beyond expectation. I would always at any given time, recommend Shangri-La Singapore. The only backdrop for all this greatness, is that the Loyalty Program doesn't meet the high standard as the hotel property and services offered. I had a couple of missing stays in the…

We returned to the Shangri La to celebrate our Silver Wedding.  Had a suite in the renovated tower wing with access to the Horizon club.  We used the Horizon lounge for breakfast, afternoon tea and evening drinks.  All the food was of the highest standard and the level of service was 'above and beyond'.  Particular note must go to Angela who's attention to detail and customer service was fantastic, taking time to talk about our day and share her local knowledge.  We used the "Line" restaurant but found it a bit busy - although the food choice and quality was excellent.  The Waterfall restaurant had a lovely ambience with great food.   The pool area was as lovely as we remembered from our last visit, although poolside bar service was a bit slow at times.   We ventured into the…

We stayed for 4 nights and everything was faultless. On arrival we were upgraded to the Valley wing and there were some lovely extras as we were on honeymoon. The breakfast had a large variety and was very high quality. Rooms were spotless and attention to detail is high, for example the elevator carpets were changed daily and embroidered with the day of the week. Staff were all very friendly and helpful. Would happily come back and recommend to friends and family visiting Singapore.

Nice hotel with free wifi, swimingpool, fitness center, everything is professional & perfect here. If you have children, it is suitable for staying. hotel location is very convenient. highly recommend.

Review title: amazing warm abode in midst of tropical greens
Review: The moment u step ur greeted by huge lobby filled with warm smiling faces,free wifi and a hospitable staff.The rooms are well lit ,clean and toilets are dry ,beds are comfy,room service is prompt.The best part is majestic spread of lavish breakfast taking into account of everyones dietary need....If at Sg u need to experience Shangri-La hospitality

Fantastic ambiance and good location. Spacious room, neat and clean with a staff who are very accommodating and exceedingly nice. The food are superb. The menus from breakfast itself has a lot to choose from Great hospitality!

Review title: Nice hotel in a tropical lush setting
Review: Five nights spent on business. Nice and spacious room with a balcony overlooking a lush garden with birds singing at sunset. Very quiet at night. Small issue with getting two mugs for my teas and coffees on arrival, it took many phone calls. Also switching on and off the various lights in the room is incredibly complicated, one does not know which is which. Nice breakfast but better get there not too late as it is very crowded

We stayed at the Shangri-la Hotels in Bangkok and Singapore 27 years ago when we lived in Asia.  We remembered how great they were and decided to stay here during our recent trip to Singapore .   It was as great as it was in our memories.  We stayed in the garden wing, as we did before. It was a tropical getaway from a busy city.  Balconies with bougainvillea overhanging.  Palm trees with a squirrel chattering away. Luxurious rooms. Great service.   We loved the Waterfall restaurant on the first floor.  The food was fabulous.  We ate there 4 times. At the end of a busy day it was the perfect place to relax and get a 5 star meal at a very reasonable price.    The hotel has 3 very distinct wings.  For business, the tower wing or valley wing would be the rightchoice. But if you are…

I always stay here. The recent renovation is subtle but an improvement, as are the new cafe and library area. Good professional attentive friendly service. There are many options for accomodation. The swimming pool is the right size and ambience.

We opted to stay here for 2 nights out and 2 nights in on a return trip to Australia and New Zealand. This was our first visit to this hotel.  In December we had a lovely well appointed room with balcony in the Garden Wing which had clearly been updated in the recent past. As ever with this group, the service was impeccable; from the temporary check-in desk( another wing was being upgraded) to the waiting team in the Italian poolside restaurant. On our return in February we were upgraded to the Valley Wing for accommodation but not all the added extras. We found the room on the 2nd visit to be comfortable but we didn't love it so very pleased we didn't book it! The amenities of the hotel are what you should expect from a de-luxe brand - not OTT but definitely luxurious.

Review title: Great place to stay, awesome for business
Review: I stayed for a week in this beautiful resort-style hotel, for business.  The reception on day one was extremely friendly, courteous and professional. Jade was the receptionist on both arrival and departure and did a superb job. In fact, in this hotel you are cared for very well, with staff available everywhere to assist you. Just ask if you need help. The bedroom was spacious and modern. It's clear that renovations were being made, and because of this, it had a very new feel. Large TV, awesome bed, great shower (which I used at least twice daily), and it included all the smaller things that made the stay very nice - bath robes and slippers, well-stocked mini-bar, safe etc. It also has a large outdoor swimming pool. From a business perspective, again we were well catered for. In…

Stayed here during a vacation, we booked Horizon Club room in the Tower Wing. The rooms are a mix of classic elegance and luxury, spacious and quiet. The staff kept the room spotless even cleaning again when turning down the bed in the evening.  The breakfast buffet  at ‘The Line” was huge and high quality. So many different cuisines to choose from. Service was great. We love the food at the Shang Palace (Chinese) & Nami (Japanese) restaurant, and at the Waterfall restaurant too.   Only issue is... the location. Not very accessible to the main Orchard shopping area.  All in all, a fabulous stay that have made a memorable experience in beautiful Shangri-la!

So we stayed at the Shangrila hotel in singapore from 6-10 September 2017 and honestly the hotel was a big disappointment  The Airport pickup was great , the staff had come all the way to the airplane to pick us up and the car was great with two car seats for the kids which they loved 😍  On reaching the hotel we were escorted to the room within seconds but the room was extremely average and a big disappointment...  Also the email we had received from the hotel and what the hotel staff had been communicated about our reservations were two different things so initially that also had to be sorted..  the front office manager was good and he came and moved us to another bigger room same category which was nicer but I guess all their rooms definitely need a facelift...  Bkfast was…

Lovely hotel and fab food ....not just cakes and scones it's an all you can eat experience from noodles to really nice Italian cured meats and mozzarella and tomato salad. Throw in a few glasses of something and you have a glorious afternoon treat ...brilliant !!. We had informed the hotel that one of our party was gluten free. When we arrived the head chef walked her around the food available to her and on top had produced a selection of cake and scones just for her.Really nice man we all felt well looked after. Ready to go back again ...go you won't be disappointed!!

Shangrila- beautiful to uphold after their renovations now serving a hawker styled lunch/ tea Buffett at the lobby lounge.  You get greeted by a coterie of smiling staff who send you to the wrong location! That's ok though...they were trying their best!  The peranakan themed Buffett with pretty nonya porcelain is eye candy. However, the food is lack luster.  The waitresses didn't understand the tea orders- then again they are not local so can't blame them.  I tried the ka Soh fish bee hoon. The toman fish was nicely sliced but had a characteristic muddy taste. No msg detected - a good sign.   My lunch companions decided on the prawn noodle soup but no indication that it was great.  The rest of the dishes looked tired and tasted tired too.  Local Malay kue was served but didn't…

Review title: Beautiful Singapore and Fabulous Shangri-la Hotel...a perfect pair!
Review: For different reasons, this trip to Singapore had been cancelled and rescheduled for so many times until we pushed through with the trip last Sept. 1-4. I have stayed in three different hotels in my previous business trip to Singapore but nothing came close to The Shangdi-la Hotel. It was worth the long wait because we were able to stay in a perfect hotel in Singapore,  It was a perfect because this time I came with my wife for a much needed vacation and stayed in a fabulous hotel.  From the very friendly and accommodating staff and the cool ambience of the lobby, we could see the lashed greenery surrounding the pool. More so, we were astonished to see the Waterfall Garden and colourful Koi pond on our way to the villa wing of the hotel.  Our room was clean, neat and complete…

What can I say that I haven't said before??  The Shangri-La hotel Singapore is really amazing and it only gets better everytime we stay there.  It's our home away from home. It's the reason we keep going back to Singapore.    I told someone recently, it's " The Shangri-La Singapore vs The rest of the world " everytime we are looking for a holiday destination. And The Shangri-La Singapore always wins!  One thing that really stood out this time were the Fantastic 3 (haha, that's how we refer to the lifeguards, Elaine, Bernard and Kesavan). These guys literally save lives on a weekly (if not, daily) basis.  It's baffling how many people get in trouble in the pool, but it's extremely reassuring to see the lifeguards at this hotel coming to the rescue of these unfortunate people.…

Last Sunday was the last day of my 2 week stay with my family in Singapore, and my daughter-in-law chose the Rose Veranda High Tea at Shangri-La as our farewell time together.   I have never seen anything like it in my life.. it was simply superb!  The staff were delightful and very attentive.  I loved every minute of it and ate my way through a large amount of food presented in such a way that we could try a little of many things!  It is a help yourself buffet.

After a cancelled travel in June I came back to Shangri-La Singapore. Due to a mistake during booking (wrong reservation dates), the check in was not as smooth as normally. I totally understand that. But the problem was solved very quickly by the staff. That is why I always come back to Shangri-La Singapore. They make it possible for the customer.  But after renovation, the Horizon Club rooms were reduced so you cannot get an early check in, which is for me bad, as I arrive always in the early morning after a long flight. Of course, you can have the room early, but you pay a 2nd night.For me this is a point that should be looked at from the management.

Sometimes its the places you know best that you forget to applaud. I have been a regular guest at this wonderful hotel over several years and coming to the end of a week long stay here. The majestic entry is eye catching, the pool area is magnificent, and the rooms are a cut above the rest. But it is the highly professional and friendly staff that really make this place - everyone from housekeeping, to the grounds staff and the reception areas make the effort. There are three wings to the hotel - the garden wing, the tower and the valley wing. If you ever get the opportunity to stay in the valley wing then you must do so - it is luxury defined. But the other parts of the hotel are excellent as well. My preference is the tower wing, in a Horizon Club room. These have all been…

Nice environmentally friendly ambience coupled with caring staff made for a pleasant short staycation for my family.  Our client experience was generally positive as the staff projected warmth and attended to our needs. They even shared children activities and how my Daughter could earn a scoop of ice cream.

I had a 1 night stay at Shangri-La Singapore for a business meeting in Singapore. The hotel is located in a quieter area near central Singapore. My room was the "Tower Wing King Deluxe". Internet was provided free in the room and in the hotel area. As it was a business trip, we needed help with setting up meeting rooms and entertaining VIPs. The staffs were really helpful and friendly. I was impressed with how big the gym and swimming pool was. The breakfast selection was just average.

Review title: Lovely hotel in a lovely setting
Review: This is a very nice hotel set within walking distance of the city centre and about 20 mins to the nearest underground station. (Orchard). Set back from the road, the spacious and grand entrance lobby is extremely welcoming, as notably are the reception staff. The room I was given was large with plenty of space to move around and to work if I wanted to.  Outside there is a resort style pool beside it there is one of the largest hotel gyms that I've been to. (Indoors) Dinner was of a buffet style, with a good selection of western and Asian food selection, seating was inside or out facing the pool. Other restaurants including Italian were available on an a la carte basis. Definitely be back to this hotel. Loved Singapore and loved the Shangri-La.

Review title: High end hotel with great service
Review: This place is gorgeous! It's a high end hotel and reminds me of the Four Seasons. The service was very good and it's not overly expensive as far as high end hotels go. It's centrally located, easy to get to everything from the hotel, I walked to Orchard street. And mainly took Uber to the museums which was a very reasonable cost. Some minor issues with some of the servers wanting us to order right away but that just may be cultural. Our room was nicely appointed , the bed was a little firm for us but they added a pillow top and it was much softer. The breakfast buffet is amazing, I think they have every nation covered! We had dinner at each onsite restaurant, all were very good. Loved the pool and spa, can't wait to come back!

The hotel is located at a quiet residential area off Orchard Road, one of the main shopping/dining areas in the city.  Hotel is about 15 minutes walk to Orchard Road and there is a shuttle bus that runs every hour.  The hotel sits on a large real estate with beautiful gardens with nice landscaping and a large swimming pool.  We stayed at the Tower wing the most vintage building on the property but the rooms were recently upgraded.  Size of room is on the smaller side but still comfortable.  Do note certain floors of tower wing are under renovation so noise of power drills can be heard promptly at 9AM every morning and noise of the work through out the day.  Garden wing is an option if you want to stay away from the noise.  The staff was generally friendly and professional,…

This hotel is fabulous in every way, but staying in the valley wing is an experience in itself! They staff really care and they treat you like royalty!   Staying at the valley wing comes wing many perks such as the wonderful breakfast in the Summit room where you have an array of both western and oriental breakfast menus. In addition, valley wing customers can also eat at the horizon club, the line restaurant and the waterfall restaurant. Furthermore, snacks, high tea and canapes are served at various times of the day and can be enjoyed at the delectable valley wing lounge or the more informal horizon club based on the 24th floor of the tower wing.   The staff make this hotel and the ones in the valley wing are particularly wonderful, including Hari and Vanessa and many more. We…

Everything at the Shangri-la is like fine silk. You may not initially appreciate the qualities that provide a depth of character, wonderful drape and impressive texture, but after some experience within this fabric, you begin to understand why the Shangri-la continues to be rated at the top of its class.   The surrounding buildings, rather than give the feeling that one is boxed in within the cosmopolitan city, give the illusion that one is nestled within the palm of the city state, and you can savour all of the near-equator botanicals that come with a deep tropical experience: a dedicated orchid "pod," palms and plumerias abound.   No, I'm not being paid for this review, I'm just head-over-heels for the place. I can't wait to get back.

This is an absolutely stunning hotel. From the moment you are welcomed into the main foyer you realise that this place is special. It smells divine, the staff are plentiful and extremely helpful and the rooms are outstanding. Definitely upgrade to the Horizon Club to take advantage of the breakfast, high tea and nightly canapes and cocktails, it is very worth the additional cost. I would absolutely recommend this hotel, it is a short stroll from Orchard Road but taxi's are plentiful, cheap and the drivers are all lovely.

Friendly stuffs, spacious room, variety of breakfast though I didn't really have time to enjoy it! It was a pleasant surprise that I received several postcards just because I asked where to get it! I have only one minor complaint as a person who enjoys hot/aromatic bath to soothe and relax after a long day work, that is no bathtub in the room!!  Apart from that Shangri-La is still my first choice to stay for my next visit!

What a hotel, from arrival to departure, this hotel is one of the best in Singapore. The staff cannot do anymore for you, the food and the facilities are fantastic.  My room was too big, the TV was too big, the bed and bathroom, too big. Fantastic stay and would go back again.

Review title: New look for an established hotel
Review: The 46 year old Tower Wing has undergone a renovation, unveiling its new look in mid-2017. I stayed in its standard room (#1329) for two nights and enjoyed its clean, sleek and chic new look. However, its a huge change from its former look.   The lobby has gone from warm browns and opulent gold (with colorful flowers, ornate chandeliers and wall carvings, brown marble walls and flooring) to a cool white/black/green look. Its smart, trendy, chic with uber-cool flowers (green hydrangeas on moss balls, which are now a permanent fixture unlike its ever changing floral displays in the lobby of old). The lobby lounge has also become more trendy with Peranakan-style ceramics and books on shelves (like a trendy study), which is nice. The gigantic chandeliers are gone, which makes the…

Clean hotel, decent food, good service.  Good for families.  Breakfast area was a bit chaotic, recommend eating in The Falls if you don't want to deal with lots of screaming kids running around while you have breakfast.

We stayed for two nights, then went on a cruise, then stayed one night upon return. The service, cleanliness, Horizon  Club, food, just everything was on point without being obtrusive. Amazing discreet service, the rooms are worth every cent, turn down service, all the little touches. The location is excellent too being a short walk to Orchard Road and short Taxi to Chinatown etc. First time at this hotel in Singapore, have stayed at a couple of other 5 stars and this is so far in front. Will stay again when next in Singapore.

Stopped over for two days and stayed here as part of our honeymoon. Location was walking distance to main shopping area. Didn't have chance to use the  pool or Laurie activities but the breakfast was brilliant.

Review title: Wow experience i never had before.
Review: Having stayed the last couple of nights at this hotel, I must say I have had a fabulous experience. From the entrance lobby on level 3 to the Horizon club on level 24, everything is stunning. A special thanks to Angela and her team in Horizon club for making my stay so relaxing and exclusive.

My wife and I stayed at the Shangri-La for two nights in June en route to New Zealand - we very much wish we could have stayed longer. This is simply one of the best hotels you will find in the far east. Even the local taxi drivers volunteer that information when they know where you are staying! The accommodation, staff and facilities are superb. The hotel also has in-house one of the best Chinese restaurants at which you will ever eat.

Review title: Fabulous hotel just minutes away from orchard road on foot - amazing staff
Review: We traveled with our 6 year old to Singapore with the Shangri las being our first stop and it couldn't have been a better start for us. The hotel staff at reception were great finding us a room well before normal check in time and providing our 6 year old with a treasure hunt around the hotel.  The rooms we had was well proportioned with ample space for two grown ups and a roll out bed  with plenty of space left appreciate the room.  The pool and gardens are a great spot from which you would have no idea that you were in the middle of a city.  Breakfast (which was included as part of our stay) was an experience in itself with a huge choice from international kitchens and friendly staff.  In room dining was also great.  i would highly recommend a stay at the Shangri la whether…

Normally I would review a hotel after my visit, however, this trip to Singapore has been exceptional.  As well as having a beautiful room and service, the staff and chefs in Horizon club pay fabulous attention to detail.  From signature dishes to individual attention, everything is planned to immense detail.  I must congratulate the Horizon club team and management for making this trip exceptional.   No guesses which hotel I will stay in for my future planned trips to Singapore   First class

An established grand hotel in Singapore in an area of greenery. The gardens reflect the tropics with a collection of flowering orchids in the garden wing. It's many restaurants offer excellent food at higher end affordable prices . It's a great place to stay as well.

Review title: A great place to stay and dine
Review: After arriving at the hotel by car, the first impression is the overwhelming lobby with its gigantic pillars, the polished floor and the classic design.  Even though that our room was not ready for check-in, we got the offer to take a first breakfast at the buffet as well as shower and change in the gym. After this we roamed around Orchard Road for a hour and came back to get in our room.  The room was very clean and offered a pool view. All curtains were able to be controlled from the bed by remote. The King Size bed deserved its name and the bath room offered a comfortable size with a well dimensioned shower and enough storage room for two people.  The WiFi connection was high and for free. Remote connections and Skype calls were no problem.  I can highly recommend this hotel.

Valley Wing - usually love this hotel but this time very disappointed with a number of small issues that built up throughout the stay.  No orchids on arrival but not a problem, no ladies toiletries bag, minibar not restocked, continual poor service due to lack of staff afternoon and evening and breakfast was a joke, 5 incorrect orders and eggs sent back 3 times to be cooked properly before finally arriving without other ordered items.  Finally staff extremely rude over the ridiculous flip flop rule at breakfast but ok for hookers to be walking around the lobby and garden area night and day.  They were obviously high class ones!!  What a shame as this was the only place we would stay in Singapore!

Nice rooms with elegant decor. Staff, attentive, as always. Breakfast, standard - but not amazing. (Failed the obscure grapefruit juice test - they'd run-out by 10am). Hotel is close to Orchid Road - making it further from the airport, but closer to restaurants and night-life.

We stayed 8 days. The staff are friendly and helpful.  Everything was air conditioned and cool. Rooms cleaned early so good if you are out early and want to come back early.   Plenty of complimentary water. They even come round in the evenings to see if you require more.   The breakfast was amazing. They cater for everyone with large selections to choose from.   The pool is nice and big so plenty of room and spacious around the pool.   Would definitely stay again

Unfortunately, as I was here on a business trip, I wasn't able to enjoy all the facilities that the hotel has to offer. But what I did experience was incredible service and high quality of accommodation and food. I stayed in the garden suite with a view of the garden and the room was spacious, functional and clean with a decent sized bathroom which contained a bath and a separate shower.  The breakfasts are amazing ... in terms of quality, quantity and variety. Catering for an international clientele, the buffet offers a considerable choice of foods; from pancakes and waffles to omelettes, sausages, bacon and baked beans to fruits, croissants and cereals to curries, noodles and rice. Upon returning late one evening, I ordered from the room service menu and was pleasantly…

I've stayed many times in this hotel in the garden wing (the main building still has old fashioned rooms) and I have to say that I like everything about it.  Warm welcoming from staff, the Shangri-la smell, the amazing pool and breakfast and spacious and luxurious rooms with the wooden floor.  If I was to return to Singapore, this would definitely be my landing point.

We stayed for two days from August 23, 2017.  We were assigned rooms on the 6th floor, but renovations were underway on the 7th and 8th floors. The construction continued from 9:00 am to 6:00 pm Drilling noise and hammer sound continued.  For other luxury hotels, it is customary not to place a room in the immediate lower floors of the renovations.  I was really shocked when a luxury hotel like Shangri-la was doing this kind of room assignment.  It was a very stupid room allocation policy that blew everything from the kindness of the staff, to the skilled service, to the excellence of the facilities.  Penang, Kuala Lumpur, Bangkok, Hong Kong, etc. We were very satisfied with Shangri-La Hotel and our favorite hotel chain is Shangri-La.  But Shangri-la Singapore really gave me a…

Review title: Island Ballroom Banquet Events and 1 night stay
Review: My value experience observation in Valley Wing, Island Ballroom at Shangri-la Singapore. Not so much about the hotel room, as many had already written their value feedback below, but more on the unpleasant dining experience over an invited event.   Back in my internship days with NUS as a Defence executive officer intern, I didn't realised that we've always taken manual labours like those banquet servers for granted. I've always been dining with my parents around the hotels since young and once, I had  also been to school functions which happened in the Island Ballroom as well with Shangri la. Im definitely not new to the environment. Though most, if not all that I observed working in the banquet line are uneducated, but some I met are really humble and respectful. I was telling…

We stayed at the shangri-la with family and friends for 6 nights. We had very spacious connecting rooms at the garden wing with a pool view balcony. We were greeted with orchids upon arrival to the hotel by wonderful staff . The hotel has a beautiful luxurious lobby great for an afternoon tea or coffee time. The food and restaurants are amazing  especially chef  Marco's Italian restaurant. The main breakfast area is huge with a wide variety however I would say it needs updating since it has a cold feeling of 60s 70s  design that doesn't match the hotels overall look . We preferred to have our breakfast at the Italian restaurant.  I should also mention Johnny the very helpful and courteous concierge who granted us the best tables at different restaurants! Michelle the garden wing…
